procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 100 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 100 mL water and heat until boiling to form a clear solution.
Add 10 mL of 85% H3PO4 and stir. Gradually add 80 mL concentrated HCl while maintaining stirring.
procedure_steps.comments: Initial precipitate forms on cooling, containing minor impurities

procedure_steps.description: Allow the mixture to cool and stand for about 4 hours. Reduce volume as much as possible.
Dissolve the precipitate in 120 mL of water, filter into a separatory funnel. Add 70 mL ether, then slowly add 40 mL concentrated HCl, shake and separate layers.
Add another 120 mL ether, then 30 mL concentrated HCl, shake and separate. The lower aqueous layer contains H3[α-PW12O40].
Wash the separated ether layer in a second funnel with 120 mL water if needed, releasing any dissolved product into the aqueous phase.
procedure_steps.comments: Gas may form, continue until gas is absorbed

procedure_steps.description: Allow the final aqueous layer to stand and gradually form crystals of H3[α-PW12O40].
Dissolve 0.5 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 1.0 mL H2O at 25 °C and let stand for 12 hours.
Add 0.2 mL 85% H3PO4 and 0.5 mL 12 mol·L^-1 HCl to the solution. Let the final solution stand at 25 °C for 12 hours until clarified.
Add 3 mL acetonitrile and 0.14 g (n-C4H9)4NBr. Stir for 15 minutes. A precipitate forms.
Filter the precipitate under dry air suction. Dry in vacuum at 80 °C using CH2Cl2 vapor or solution as needed. Store at ambient temperature.
Dissolve 8.2 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 335 mL boiling water. Add 100 mL CH3CN, then 0.39 g NaH2PO4·2H2O, followed by 65 mL conc. acetic acid. Shake to mix.
procedure_steps.comments: 31P-NMR indicates presence of α- and β-PW12O40 species

procedure_steps.description: Cool the solution to 0 °C and filter. Add 12 g NH4Cl to the filtrate; a white precipitate forms. Let stand overnight, filter again to remove the precipitate (containing α-PW12O40).
procedure_steps.comments: Remaining filtrate is enriched in β-PW12O40

procedure_steps.description: To the β-PW12O40-enriched filtrate, add 250 mL CH3CN and 50 mL acetic acid, then add 0.2 g n-Bu4NBr. A white precipitate forms.
Recrystallize from ethanol if needed, dry in air to obtain ~0.6 g product. Further purification can be done by dissolving in acetonitrile and slow crystallization.
procedure_steps.comments: Pure [(n-Bu4N)3][β-PW12O40] crystals formed after a few days

product_summary.name: H4[α-SiW12O40]·nH2O
product_summary.notes: Crude solution used to isolate H4[α-SiW12O40]·nH2O

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 11 g Na2SiO3 in 100 mL boiling water. Filter if not fully dissolved.
Dissolve 182 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 300 mL boiling water separately. This is solution B.
Cool solution A, then slowly add boiling solution B over 5 minutes with stirring. Add 165 mL of 4 mol·L^-1 HCl dropwise, stir 10 minutes.
Adjust pH to about 5–6 by adding 50 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 HCl while stirring. Keep at 100 °C for 1 hour.
Filter the hot mixture, wash with Na2WO4·2H2O solution and HCl. Cool the filtrate to room temperature. Final volume is ~450–500 mL.

product_summary.name: K4[α-SiW12O40]·17H2O
product_summary.notes: Stable crystals in pH < 4.5. Approx. 130 g

procedure_steps.description: Raise pH of the filtrate to basic with 11 mol·L^-1 KOH. Add 2.0 g KCl and stir until homogeneous.
Dissolve the coarse precipitate in warm (~50 °C) acidic solution (2 mol proportion HCl) to near neutral pH, then recrystallize.

product_summary.name: H4[α-SiW12O40]·nH2O
product_summary.notes: White anhydrous powder obtained; no yield reported

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 11 g Na2SiO3 in 100 mL boiling water with magnetic stirring to give solution A  [oai_citation:0‡SYN5.txt](file-service://file-61YyxMKRiupgVyy8c2TJwF)
Stir until the silicate dissolves completely
If solids remain, hot-filter to obtain a clear Na2SiO3 solution
Dissolve 182 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 300 mL boiling water to give solution B
Stir the tungstate solution until completely dissolved
Slowly add the boiling tungstate solution B to the cooled solution A over 5 min while stirring
Continue stirring the combined solution for an additional 10 min
Add 165 mL of 4 M HCl dropwise
Stir for 10 min after acid addition
Add 50 mL of 1 M HCl to adjust pH to 5-6
Maintain the solution at 100 °C for 1 h
Filter the mixture while hot
Wash the solid twice with 50 mL of 1 M Na2WO4 solution
Wash the solid with 80 mL of 4 M HCl
Cool the filtrate to room temperature and filter through paper
Concentrate the clear solution to 1 L (reported volume inconsistent with previous 450-500 mL yield)
Further evaporate to ~120 mL using a rotary evaporator
Allow to cool; removal of remaining aqueous phase leaves anhydrous white H4[α-SiW12O40]·nH2O
Recrystallize the anhydrous powder in a desiccator to give pure crystals of H4[α-SiW12O40]·nH2O

name: HCl
reagents.comments: Then up to 12 mol·L^-1 for pH adjustment

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.96 g Na2SiO3·9H2O and 0.80 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 1.4 mL H2O at 25 °C for 12 hours.
Heat to 60 °C with stirring, add 0.25 mol·L^-1 HCl, then raise temperature to 80 °C and stir for 0.5 h. Adjust pH to 2 with 12 mol·L^-1 HCl.
Add 0.33 g (n-C4H9)4NBr and stir for 15 minutes. Filter the precipitate.
Wash with ethanol and ether, dry in vacuo. Yield: 0.25 g of product.
Add 5 mL of ice water to the reaction vessel.
procedure_steps.comments: Ice water used to keep temperature low

procedure_steps.description: Add Na2WO4·2H2O (1 g), Na2SiO3·9H2O (0.42 g) and [EMIM]Br (2 g); stir until dissolved.
Stir the clear solution to ensure homogeneity.
Heat the mixture to 150 °C.
Add 20 mL of 6 M HCl to the hot solution.
Allow the reaction mixture to cool slowly to room temperature.
Filter to collect the yellow precipitate.
Dry the precipitate to afford [EMIM]3[α-SiW12O40].
Add 198 g Na2WO4·12H2O to 250 mL boiling water. Stir and add 40 mL 3 mol·L^-1 HCl rapidly. Keep hot.
In another container, dissolve 11 g Na2SiO3 in 100 mL of 6 mol·L^-1 HCl. Adjust final pH to 0, combine with tungsten solution at 80 °C, stirring.
Heat mixture with stirring, reduce volume to ~400 mL. Filter to remove insoluble matter. The filtrate contains β-SiW12O40 species.
Concentrate the filtrate 1:1, then add ethanol or ether. Slowly evaporate the solvent to form H4[β-SiW12O40]·nH2O crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Yields the β-isomer in hydrated form

procedure_steps.description: Add 250 mL boiling water to the vessel and dissolve 198 g Na2WO4·12H2O with stirring.
Introduce 40 mL of 3 M HCl and continue heating rapidly.
Add 11 g Na2SiO3 dissolved in 100 mL 6 M HCl to the reaction mixture.
Adjust pH to 0, heat with stirring at 80 °C and concentrate to ~400 mL.
Filter hot to remove insoluble impurities; keep filtrate.
Transfer filtrate to 750 mL ethanol and acidify (1 : 1) to induce precipitation.
Seal the mixture and allow white precipitate to form gradually.
Filter and collect H4[β-SiW12O40]·nH2O crystals.
Dry the crystals in air.
Adjust pH of the H4[β-SiW12O40] solution to 1 using 1 M KOH.
Add 50 g KCl and stir to form a yellow precipitate.
Filter and collect the yellow solid potassium salt.
Dissolve the solid at 50 °C.
Adjust pH to 2 by adding acid to promote recrystallisation.
Allow the solution to cool, yielding K4[β-SiW12O40]·17H2O crystals.
Filter and collect the crystals.
Dry to constant weight.

name: KCl
reagents.comments: First use: 90 g; second use: 80 g

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 11 g Na2SiO3 in 100 mL of boiling water (Solution A).
Dissolve 182 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 300 mL boiling water. Then add 1 mL boiling water every minute for 10 min.
Add 165 mL of 4 mol·L^-1 HCl solution rapidly to precipitate tungstic acid.
Add Solution A. Use additional 4 mol·L^-1 HCl to adjust pH to about 5–6. Keep at this condition for ~100 minutes.
Add 90 g KCl and stir gently. A light yellow precipitate forms after ~15 minutes. Filter the precipitate.
Dissolve the filter cake in 850 mL boiling water, filter out any insoluble matter. Add 80 g KCl to the filtrate. Filter again and wash with 50 mL 2 mol·L^-1 KCl solution twice.
procedure_steps.comments: Light yellow powder after second precipitation

name: Na2CO3 (2 mol·L^-1)
reagents.comments: Used to adjust pH rapidly to 9.1

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 15 g of K8[β2-SiW11O39]·14H2O in 150 mL boiling water, filter any insolubles.
Add 2 mol·L^-1 Na2CO3 solution rapidly to reach pH 9.1. Maintain pH 9.1 with small additions of 2 mol·L^-1 K2CO3 as needed.
Slowly add 40 g KCl while maintaining pH at 9.1. A white precipitate forms. Filter the white precipitate and wash with 1 mol·L^-1 KCl solution. Dry to obtain K8[γ-SiW10O36]·12H2O.

product_summary.name: TBA4[y-SiW12O40]
product_summary.notes: Product soluble in DMF, DMSO, acetone; stable in organic solvents.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 7.5 g K8[Y-SiW11O36]·12H2O in 50 mL water. Add 20 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 HNO3 and shake for 20 min. Filter out any precipitate of high-boiling acid.
Slowly add 5 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 HCl. Then add 5 mL ethanol and 75 mL distilled water dropwise.
Slowly add 5 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 Na2WO4 solution (5 mmol) over at least 2 minutes. Filter out any precipitate. Then add tetrabutylammonium bromide (4 equivalents).
Wash the precipitate with ethanol and 20 mL distilled water. Dissolve it in 75 mL pure water. Then re-precipitate by adding 250 mL distilled water. Filter and wash again to obtain the final product.

characterization.comments: In DMSO, four characteristic peaks with area ratio 2:2:1:1; δ range ~102–115 ppm and 125–157 ppm

product_summary.name: K5[α-BW12O40]·11.4H2O
product_summary.notes: 71 g initial precipitate refined to 57 g final product

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 100 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 5 g H3BO3 in 100 mL water. Stir vigorously. Gradually add 60 mL of 6 mol·L^-1 HCl, maintaining pH ~6. Boil (no water refilling) for 3 hours, then filter out ~17 g of Na10W12O41·xH2O.

Dissolve the filtered intermediate in 6 mol·L^-1 HCl, adjust pH to 2, stir for hours, then add 20 g KCl. A white precipitate forms (71 g after filtration). Refine in 60 °C water to yield 57 g final product.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4H[α-BW12O40]·4.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Refined with ether wash; final hydrate ~4.5H2O

procedure_steps.description: Add a tenfold volume of (TBA)Br solution to 0.02 mol·L^-1 K5[α-BW12O40] solution. Separate the resulting precipitate using acetone.
Wash the precipitate with ether, then dissolve in ethanol to yield (n-Bu4N)4H[α-BW12O40]·xH2O. Perform azeotropic drying if needed.

product_summary.name: H4[α-GeW12O40]·14H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystalline product, stable in strongly acidic solution

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 10.5 g Ge metal in 60 mL 6.25 mol·L^-1 NaOH. Slowly add to 50 mL 1 mol·L^-1 H2O2, heat gently to complete oxidation. Cool, filter, concentrate to get a germanate solution ([Ge] ~0.37 mol·L^-1, [OH^-] ~0.52 mol·L^-1).

Add ~50 mL GeO2 solution, 25 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 H3PO4, then 70 mL of the germanate solution. Heat to 80 °C, gradually add 45 mL of 13 mol·L^-1 HNO3, adjusting pH to ~0.5. Solution turns yellow as pH shifts from 5. Continue heating and stirring at 80 °C for 5–7 hours.
Cool to room temperature. Add 10 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 HNO3 to facilitate crystallization. Filter, wash, and dry to obtain ~66 g of H4[α-GeW12O40]·14H2O.

characterization.comments: Dropping point at 1 mol·L^-1 NaAc / 1 mol·L^-1 Ac; potentials -0.200V(1F), -0.460V(1F), -0.890V(2F).

product_summary.name: K4[α-GeW12O40]·14H2O
product_summary.notes: K4[α-GeW12O40]·7H2O initially; additional hydration can yield ·14H2O form.

procedure_steps.description: Add 1 mol·L^-1 K2CO3 to the mother liquor from H4[α-GeW12O40]·14H2O preparation, forming a white powdery crystalline K4[α-GeW12O40]·7H2O. Filter and isolate.
Add a 0.2 mol·L^-1 aqueous solution of K4[α-GeW12O40]·7H2O to a TBA-Br aqueous solution. A tan precipitate forms.
Separate the tan precipitate, then wash with ethanol multiple times and treat with ether. The final tan-colored crystals are (n-Bu4N)4[α-GeW12O40].

amount_details.comments: First addition to acidify solution A

procedure_steps.description: Solution A: Add 12 mL of 6 mol·L^-1 HCl to 30 mL of 2 mol·L^-1 GeCl4 solution; label as A. Solution B: Add 10 mL of 0.5 mol·L^-1 Ge basic solution to 2 mL of 6 mol·L^-1 HCl to form a white precipitate; label as B.
Quickly add solution B to solution A (final pH ~6.5). Then wash the precipitate in beaker B with 6 mL of 6 mol·L^-1 HCl, dissolving it into solution A to reach final pH = 1.
Add 15 g KCl to the mixture. A white precipitate forms. Filter, wash with ethanol, and dry in air. Product yield: 5.6 g.

characterization.comments: Dropping electrode in 1 mol·L^-1 HAc / 1 mol·L^-1 NaAc buffer. Absorption waves at -0.110 V (1F), -0.350 V (1F), -0.700 V (2F).

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve K6[β-GeW12O40]·9.4H2O in water and filter. Collect the clear solution.
Add 60 mL concentrated HCl, then 80 mL acetic acid. Allow the mixture to stand and separate layers.
Add excess sulfuric acid to remove water in air, forming an orange face-centered cubic solid after partial evaporation/drying. Product is H4[β-GeW12O40]·22H2O.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[β-GeW12O40]
product_summary.notes: White solid eventually dissolves in ether; references [26]

procedure_steps.description: Add an excess of TBA-Br solution to a 0.1 mol·L^-1 K6[β-GeW12O40]·9.4H2O aqueous solution. A white precipitate forms.
Rinse the precipitate with a small amount of TBA-Br solution, let it react further. Wash with tetrahydrofuran to remove impurities. The heavy solid dissolves in ether.
React 20 mL of a 2 mol·L^-1 arsenic acid solution (from dissolving As2O3·5H2O + NaOH) with ... [details truncated in text].

Dissolve 165 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 100 mL water. Add 100 mL of 1,4-dioxane to get a mixed gel. Then add 25 mL of 12 mol·L^-1 HCl, mix and crush the gel. Add it in batches to 150 mL concentrated HCl, stir for 30 min. Filter and wash with 1,4-dioxane and ethanol, then air-dry (120 g).

characterization.comments: Cyclic voltammetry in 0.5 mol·L^-1 HCl, 1:1 H2O/EtOH. Peaks at 0.270 V, 0.420 V, 0.580 V.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)3[α-AsW12O40]
product_summary.notes: Dry product after repeated exchange and washing

procedure_steps.description: In a 0.10 mol·L^-1 Na3[α-AsW12O40] solution, add TBA-Br solution. A precipitate forms that floats in a small amount of TBA-Br with stirring.
procedure_steps.comments: Repeated additions until Na+ is replaced

procedure_steps.description: Wash away absorbed water using ethanol and ether. Dry in air to obtain (n-Bu4N)3[α-AsW12O40].

product_summary.name: Na6[Al(AlOH2)W11O39]
product_summary.notes: Product isolated as thick solution, not weighed

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 10 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 200 mL water.
Slowly add 4 mL 6 M HCl to adjust pH to ~7.7.
Add AlCl3·6H2O (1.33 g) portion-wise over several hours with stirring.
Continue stirring 30 min after final addition; precipitate forms.
Remove water under vacuum at 30–35 °C to obtain a thick (~50 mL) solution.
Shake; allow phase separation and extract the bottom layer containing Na6[Al(AlOH2)W11O39].
Dry the extracted layer under vacuum (30–35 °C) to remove excess acid.

characterization.comments: Spectrum confirms presence of both α and β forms

product_summary.name: Na6[α/β-Al(AlOH2)W11O39]
product_summary.notes: Product present in filtrate; isolation not described

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 100 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 400 mL water.
Add 23 mL 12 M HCl dropwise until pH ≈ 7.7; a precipitate forms.
Heat gently and add 13.32 g AlCl3·6H2O in 80 mL water over 90 min with stirring.
Continue heating and stirring for 1 h.
Cool the mixture to room temperature.
Filter; the filtrate contains Na6[α/β-Al(AlOH2)W11O39].
procedure_steps.comments: Product left in solution, not isolated

procedure_steps.description: Add 20 mL concentrated H2SO4 to 500 mL precursor solution, adjusting pH to ~0.
Add a further 3 mL H2SO4 and heat to reflux for 5–7 days until 27Al NMR shows complete conversion.
Add 147 mL H2SO4 to precipitate the product complex.
Cool the mixture, add 500 mL ethanol, shake and let layers separate.
Separate the lower layer containing product.
Dry under vacuum to give H5[α/β-AlW12O40]·nH2O.

apparatus.notes: Used for concentration of the solution

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 101.34 g of H5[α/β-AlW12O40] in 125 mL water.
Filter the solution to remove insoluble matter.
Add 150 mL of 2 M NaOH to adjust the pH to 6.
Heat the mixture for 3 days.
Cool the solution to room temperature.
Concentrate the solution by rotary evaporation.
Cool the concentrated solution to 5 °C to induce crystallization.
Collect the white crystals of Na5[α-AlW12O40]·13H2O by filtration.
Dissolve 15 g Na5[AlW12O40] in 20 mL water.
Add 7 mL concentrated H2SO4 with cooling.
Cool the acidified solution.
Transfer the solution to a separatory funnel.
Add 25 mL diethyl ether, shake well.
Cool the mixture to enhance phase separation.
Separate the layers and collect the bottom aqueous phase.
Evaporate the collected layer in a water bath to obtain a yellowish solid.
Redissolve the solid in a small amount of hot water.
Cool the solution to 5 °C.
Filter to obtain crystalline H5[α-AlW12O40]·12H2O.
Take 5.0 g of H5[α/β-AlW12O40] powder and 5 mL of water.
Add 10 mL of saturated KCl solution.
Allow the suspension to sit for a few weeks at room temperature until crystals form.
procedure_steps.comments: Text mentions K6[α-AlW12O40] crystals, but title is K5[α-AlW12O40].

characterization.comments: Discrepancy in stoichiometry: K5 vs. K6 in text.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 73.9 g H5[AlW12O40] (18.8% α-phase, 81.2% β-phase) in 150 mL water and filter.
Add 141 mL of 0.75 M Na2CO3 dropwise to adjust pH to 2.4.
Stir during evapocasting until a yellow powder precipitates.
Cool the mixture at 5 °C, then filter and centrifuge multiple times to separate fractions.
Combine all products, wash, and isolate 13.17 g final product (97.5% β-phase).
Dissolve 7.5 g of Na5[β-AlW12O40] in 20 mL of water.
Keep the solution in an ice bath.
Add 5.0 mL of 18.0 M HCl.
Add 15 mL of acetone and stir. A yellow crystalline solid forms.
Filter and isolate the product. Dry in vacuum oven.
procedure_steps.comments: Final product described as H5[β-AlW12O40]·13H2O in text, but title says ·10H2O.

product_summary.name: K5[FeW12O40]·10H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystalline solid obtained after reflux evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 8.6 g phosphotungstic acid in 100 mL water.
Add 15 mL sodium acetate.
Pour the mixture into 250 mL of 1 M Fe phosphate solution.
Evaporate the mixed solution under reflux at 60–70 °C until crystals form.
Collect the crystalline solid K5[FeW12O40]·10H2O.

product_summary.name: (NH4)4Co[CoW12O40]·20H2O
product_summary.notes: Product dried in air. Total water usage is at least 525 mL plus 'small amount' in final dissolution.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 198 g of Na2WO4·2H2O in 400 mL of water (part of total water usage).
Add 40 mL acetic acid to set pH to 6.5–7.5. Label this solution A.
Dissolve 24.9 g of Co(CH3COO)2·4H2O in 125 mL of hot water (further water usage).
Gradually add the cobalt solution to the boiling acetic acid solution. Then slowly add solution A with stirring and heating.
Filter the resulting solution, then evaporate the filtrate to dryness.
Dissolve the dried product in a small amount of boiling water, cool, and filter again.
procedure_steps.comments: Washed with cold water and ethanol; final deep yellow crystals.

product_summary.name: K4Co[CoW12O40]·15H2O
product_summary.notes: Discrepancy in product stoichiometry (K4 vs K6) in text.

procedure_steps.description: Heat 130 g of KCl in water until fully dissolved.
Add the KCl solution to the (NH4)4Co[CoW12O40]·20H2O solution.
Boil the solution while stirring, then cool to obtain a yellow precipitate.
Filter the solid product from the cooled mixture.
Wash the yellow precipitate.
procedure_steps.comments: No solvent details provided for washing.

procedure_steps.description: Air-dry the final yellow product.
procedure_steps.comments: Text refers to final as K6Co[CoW12O40]·15H2O, discrepancy vs. title.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve (NH4)4Coᴵ[CoᴵᴵW12O40]·20H2O in water at 80°C.
Add 15 g of oxalic acid, boil the mixture. The solution turns dark green and cloudy within minutes.
Filter the hot mixture to remove any residue.
procedure_steps.comments: Residue washed with 250 mL acetic acid (R3).

procedure_steps.description: Evaporate the filtrate to obtain deep yellow crystals.
Wash the crystals with a small amount of cold acetic acid (and two drops of sulfuric acid in every 100 mL of water).
Air-dry the final product.

product_summary.name: (NH4)3Co[CoW12O40]·19H2O
product_summary.notes: Text mentions crystals of acetic acid as well, but main product is the complex.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve (NH4)4Coᴵ[CoᴵᴵW12O40]·20H2O in 75 mL hot water and 50 mL acetic acid at 100°C.
procedure_steps.comments: pH adjusted with small amount of acetic acid solution if needed.

procedure_steps.description: Obtain the yellow precipitate, filter, and wash.
Re-dissolve the filtered product in 125 mL of boiling water, then cool.
Add 190 g of NH4Ac and evaporate to dryness at 50°C.
The deep yellow crystalline product is air-dried.

product_summary.name: (NH4)3Coᴵ[CoᴵᴵW12O40]·16H2O
product_summary.notes: Results in (NH4)3Coᴵ[CoᴵᴵW12O40]·16H2O, different hydrate than Methods 1 & 2.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 25 g of Na2WO4·2H2O in 75 mL of water.
procedure_steps.comments: Forms solution A after steps below.

procedure_steps.description: Add ammonium oxalate to form a yellow precipitate, then dissolve it in 125 mL of boiling water.
procedure_steps.comments: Exact amount of ammonium oxalate not given.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g of Co(NH4)4(C4O3N4O2)4 in 40 mL of hot ethanol at 40°C.
Add the cobalt solution to the previous yellow solution (solution A). Stir and filter.
Air-dry the yellow crystalline product.
Dissolve (NH4)4CoII[CoIIW12O40]·20H2O in water at 80 °C.
Add 13 g oxalic acid.
Boil the solution.
Filter while hot to yield yellow crystals of K3CoII[CoIIIW12O40]·16H2O.
Dissolve 15 g of Rb2SO4 in 200 mL of water to form an ion exchange environment.
procedure_steps.comments: Ion-exchange column or environment is implied.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve (NH4)4Co[CoW12O40] ⋅ 20H2O in water at 80°C, introduce sulfate ions into the solution.
procedure_steps.comments: Exact water volume not specified for this dissolution step.

procedure_steps.description: Boil for several minutes; solution turns green to dark green. Then filter.
Chill the solution and add 150 mL of ethyl acetate. Shake; crystals form.
Filter and isolate the product crystals.
Dissolve 15 g of Cs2SO4 in 200 mL of water to form an ion exchange environment.
Dissolve (NH4)4Co[CoW12O40] ⋅ 20H2O at 80°C, introduce sulfate ions, and stir.
procedure_steps.comments: Solution turns green to dark green after several minutes.

procedure_steps.description: Boil for 5 minutes, then filter the solution.
Add 5 mL of hot water. After cooling, filter again if needed.
Wash the product with acetic acid solution to remove remaining Cs.
Dissolve 20 g of K4Co[CoW12O40] ⋅ 15H2O in 100 mL of 1 M HCl at room temperature.
Boil the solution, then evaporate in an ice bath where green needle crystals form.
procedure_steps.comments: No explicit mention of additional water volume used, but presumably some remains.

procedure_steps.description: Filter off the crystals formed.
Introduce 80 mL of 2 mol·L-1 K2Co[CoW12O40] ⋅ 15H2O solution into 2 mol·L-1 H2SO4 solution.
Keep the mixture at boiling, forming green needle crystals.
Filter and freeze the product to isolate crystals.
Dissolve 56.2 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 400 mL water and mix with 198.6 mL HNO3.
Introduce 1.0 g ZnSO4 dissolved in 700 mL solution, stir, and heat at 80–90 °C.
Allow the mixture to split and separate phases after heating.
Concentrate the solution slowly to 150 mL.
Let the concentrate stand to precipitate white crystals.
Collect crystals by filtration.
Wash the filtrate with 12 M HNO3.
Wash the solid with ethanol.
Evaporate to dryness on a steam bath and dry in a vacuum desiccator.
Dissolve 56.2 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 400 mL water and mix with 255.4 mL HNO3.
Boil the mixed solution.
Add 10 g Sr(NO3)2 daily for 5 days while stirring at 80–90 °C (total 50 g).
Concentrate to 150 mL, stand to crystallize, and collect crystals by filtration.
Wash with 12 M HNO3 followed by ethanol.
Evaporate to dryness and dry in a vacuum desiccator to obtain pure H6[ZnW12O40]·26H2O.

product_summary.name: Na6[ZnW12O40]·15H2O
product_summary.notes: Yield given for intermediate; final mass not reported

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 56.2 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 400 mL water  [oai_citation:0‡SYN41.txt](file-service://file-MW9eHL23aPQ1xvGLFx5qML)
Mix the solution with 198.6 mL nitric acid
Dissolve 1.0 g ZnSO4 in 700 mL water and introduce into the mixture
Heat the dish at 80-90 °C while stirring until the mixture separates
Separate the resulting three parts after heating
Concentrate the zinc-tungstate solution slowly to 150 mL
Let the concentrated solution stand until white crystals precipitate
Collect the crystals by filtration
Wash the crystals with 12 M nitric acid
Wash the crystals with ethanol
Evaporate to dryness on a steam bath, washing repeatedly until acid-free
Dry the residue in a vacuum desiccator to obtain pure 12-tungstozincate
Dissolve 56.2 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 400 mL water and mix with 255.4 mL nitric acid  [oai_citation:1‡SYN41.txt](file-service://file-MW9eHL23aPQ1xvGLFx5qML)
Boil the mixed solution and maintain at 80-90 °C
Add 10 g strontium nitrate daily for 5 days with stirring, keeping the temperature at 80-90 °C
Concentrate the resulting solution slowly to 150 mL
Allow the solution to stand until white crystals form
Collect the crystals by filtration
Wash the crystals with 12 M nitric acid
Wash the crystals with ethanol
Evaporate to dryness on a steam bath, washing until acid-free
Dry the residue in a vacuum desiccator to obtain pure 12-tungstozincate
Heat the aqueous solution of H6[ZnW12O40].
Add the ammonium solution to the hot mixture.
Immediately filter the mixture.
Cool the filtrate to room temperature.
Allow to crystallize to yield colorless crystals.
Prepare a hot aqueous solution of 12-tungstozincate.
Add an appropriate amount of BaCO3.
Stir until reaction completes.
Filter the hot mixture to remove solids.
Cool the filtrate to room temperature.
Obtain colorless crystals of Ba3[ZnW12O40]·28H2O.
Heat the 5 % aqueous tetramethylammonium bromide solution.
Add 12-tungstozincate acid to the hot solution while stirring.
Stir until reaction is complete.
Cool the solution to precipitate white crystals.
Filter to isolate the crystals.
Add 200 mL water to a beaker and dissolve 100 g Na2MoO4·2H2O.
Add an appropriate volume of 1 M H3PO4.
Slowly add 100 mL concentrated HCl while stirring.
Transfer the clear solution to a 1000 mL separatory funnel.
Add 150 mL anhydrous ether, shake, and stand 15 min.
Separate the aqueous bottom layer.
Add an additional 100 mL ether, shake, and separate again.
To the organic layer add 50 mL water and 80 mL ethanol; shake.
Separate the lower aqueous phase.
Add 25 mL water and 15 mL ethanol to the organic layer.
If solution turns blue, add a few drops of nitric acid to re-oxidize.
Dry the ether layer over anhydrous Na2SO4.
Concentrate under reduced pressure.
Recrystallize from acetic acid and ether to obtain yellow crystals.
Add 6.8 mL of 1.4 M H3PO4 (R2) to 420 mL of 0.85 M Na2HPO4 solution (R1).
Add 284 mL of 1.7 M HCl (R3) to the mixture.
Cool the reaction mixture to room temperature (~25 °C).
Filter the microcrystalline Na2H[α-PMo12O40]·14H2O.
Dry the filtered product.
Recrystallize the crude product from 140 mL acetic acid (R4) and 200 mL water (R5).

characterization.device: Glassy carbon electrode in 0.5 M HClO4 (1 : 1 water/1,4-dioxane)

procedure_steps.description: Add 10 mL 1 M H3PO4 (R1) to 120 mL 1 M HCl (R2).
Add 18 mL 13 M HNO3 (R3) to the mixture.
Introduce 100 mL 1,4-cyclohexane (R4) and mix.
Add a solution of 12 g n-Bu4NBr (R5) in 10 mL water (R6).
Filter the precipitated solid.
Wash the solid with 100 mL boiling water (R6).
Wash the product with ethanol (R7).
Wash the product with ether (R8).
Dry the washed product.
Dissolve 0.07 g PCl5 (R1) in 0.1 mL water (R2).
Dissolve 0.5 g Na2MoO4·2H2O (R3) in 1.5 mL water (R2) and mix with the PCl5 solution.
Slowly acidify with 0.25 mL concentrated HNO3 (R4) dropwise.
Add 0.3 g n-Bu4NBr (R5) and stir for 15 min.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash with water (R2) and ethanol (R6).
Dry the product under vacuum.
Recrystallize in hot CH3CN (R7) at 80 °C, then cool to 25 °C.
Dissolve 2.42 g Na2MoO4·2H2O (R1) and 0.16 g NaH2PO4·2H2O (R2) in 95 mL water (R3).
Add 4.35 mL concentrated HCl (R4).
Add 0.8 g n-Bu4NBr (R5) to precipitate the product.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash with water (R3) and ethanol (R6).
Recrystallize in acetonitrile (R7).

product_summary.name: H4[SiMo12O40]
product_summary.notes: Product contains ~2 H2O; drying reduces to 5–6 H2O per unit

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 50 g Na2MoO4·2H2O (R1) in 200 mL water (R2) and heat to 60 °C.
Slowly add 20 mL HCl (R3) with stirring.
Combine with 5 g Na2SiO3 (R4) in 50 mL water (R2) and stir.
Filter the mixture through a glass wool–asbestos filter (App1).
Cool the filtrate to room temperature.
Extract with 55 mL ether (R5).
Dissolve crude product in 50 mL water (R2) and 15 mL conc. HCl (R6); extract with ether (R5).
Remove ether and concentrate the yellow solution at 40 °C.
Heat at 40 °C for 3–4 days or dry in a desiccator to reduce water of crystallization.
Add 37 mL 1 M HNO3 (R1) to 120 mL 1 M Na2MoO4 solution (R2).
Add 120 mL 0.2 M Na2SiO3 solution (R3) dropwise.
procedure_steps.comments: Solution turns yellow indicating β-anion formation

procedure_steps.description: Heat at 80 °C for 30 min to convert β- to α-anion.
Add 12 g TBA Br (R4) to precipitate the α-anion.
Filter the precipitate and wash with water (R5) and ethanol (R6).
Stir crystals in a small amount of water/ethanol until needle-like crystals form.
Dissolve 0.04 g Na2SiO3·9H2O (R1) and 0.40 g Na2MoO4·2H2O (R2) in 1.3 mL water (R3).
Slowly add 4 M HCl (R4) to pH 2.
Heat the solution at 80 °C for ~20 min.
Cool to 25 °C and add 0.19 g TBA Br (R5); stir 15 min.
Filter and wash with ethanol (R6); dry in air.
Dissolve in acetone (R7) at elevated temperature and precipitate in CH3CN (R8) at 25 °C.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[β-SiMo12O40]
product_summary.notes: Yellow needle crystals, then additional block crystals upon evaporation.

procedure_steps.description: Add 37 mL of concentrated HNO3 to 120 mL of 1 M sodium molybdate solution, then slowly add 200 mL of 1,4-dioxane.
procedure_steps.comments: Then add 50 mL of 0.2 M Na2SiO3 solution.

procedure_steps.description: Allow the solution to stand at room temperature for 15 hours, turning dark yellow.
Add 20 mL of 1.9 M (TBA)Br4 solution. A dark red oil precipitates quickly, separating solids and oils.
Use 1,4-dioxane and ether to extract and isolate the product. 25 g of yellow needle crystals obtained.
procedure_steps.comments: Evaporate the remaining fraction to get large yellow block crystals.

data_peaks.comments: Pt electrode, 0.5 M HClO4, 1:1 acetone-water solvent

procedure_steps.description: Add 37 mL conc. HNO3 (R1) to 40 mL 1 M Na2MoO4 solution (R2).
Slowly add 27 mL germanium oxide solution (R3).
Maintain at 80 °C for 30 min to complete β→α transformation.
Add 15 mL 12 M HCl (R4).
Add 30 mL ether (R5) and extract yellow crystals.
Evaporate acid under water bath to obtain crystalline product.
Add 40 mL of 13 M HNO3 to 120 mL of 1 M Ge acid solution, then slowly add 0.38 M Na2GeO3 and 27 mL of 0.52 M NaOH solution.
Heat at 80°C for about 30 minutes to convert [β-GeMo12O40]4- to [α-GeMo12O40]6-.
Add 12 g of (TBA)Br; the solution turns yellow. Filter, wash with water, ethanol, and ether.
procedure_steps.comments: Crystallize in a vacuum oven to obtain needle crystals, 20 g yield.

name: 1,4-Dioxane
reagents.comments: Approximate total volume used for reaction and TBABr solution; additional volume used for washing.

procedure_steps.description: Add 40 mL of 13 M HNO3 to 400 mL of 1,4-dioxane.
Add 120 mL of 1 M Na2MoO4 solution to the mixture.
Add 27 mL of the prepared germanate solution dropwise.
Stir the yellow solution at room temperature for 1 hour.
Add 50 mL of 0.62 M TBABr in 1,4-dioxane.
procedure_steps.comments: Solution separates into an oily layer

procedure_steps.description: Filter the mixture to collect the yellow product.
Wash the product with 1,4-dioxane followed by diethyl ether.
Dry the washed powder in a vacuum oven.
Add 2.42 g of Na2MoO4⋅2H2O and 0.31 g of Na2HAsO4⋅7H2O to 45 mL of water.
Add 4.35 mL of HCl solution, then 50 mL of CH3CN, and finally 0.8 g n-Bu4NBr. A precipitate forms.
Wash the solid with water and ethanol, then dry in vacuum.

apparatus.notes: Vacuum over NaOH and P2O5 for drying

procedure_steps.description: Under nitrogen, add 50 mL of 0.5 M ammonium phosphate solution to 300 mL of 0.35 M ammonium rhenate solution.
Add 100 mL of 2 M ammonium molybdate solution dropwise.
Add 160 mL of 12 M HCl to the blue solution.
Store the mixture in a refrigerator overnight to promote isomer conversion.
Filter the blue precipitate.
Wash the precipitate quickly with small portions of hydrochloric acid to remove adsorbed rhenium.
Dry the product in vacuum over NaOH and P2O5.
Under bubbling argon, dissolve 7 g of H7[β-AsMo12O40] in 60 mL acetonitrile.
Add 2 mL of 13 M HCl; the blue solution turns yellow.
Filter the yellow precipitate and wash with cold water.
Add 10 g of TBABr to the filtrate with stirring to precipitate the product.
Dry the yellow solid under vacuum.

apparatus.notes: Stainless steel autoclave with Teflon liner

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.618 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O and 0.527 g Na2B4O7·10H2O in 3 mL water.
Add 0.357 g NiCl2·6H2O to the solution.
Stir with gentle heating for 8 hours while allowing partial evaporation.
Transfer the mixture into a Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave.
Heat the sealed autoclave at 180 °C for 3 days.
Cool the autoclave to room temperature at 4 °C h-1.
Filter the resulting powder.
Wash the powder with water.
Dry to obtain black single crystals.
Dissolve 0.26 g NaOH in 8 mL of water.
Add 0.35 g Nb2O5·xH2O and 0.27 g TEOS. Stir for about 1 hour, adjusting pH to ~12.7.
Transfer 23 mL of the mixture into a Teflon-lined autoclave. Heat at 190°C for 12–24 hours.
Filter the white precipitate, yielding 0.27 g product (73% based on Nb).

product_summary.name: K12[Ti2O2][SiNb2O40] · 16H2O
product_summary.notes: White or colorless solid after hydrothermal reaction.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.364 g KOH in 8 mL of water at room temperature.
Add 0.35 g Nb2O5, 0.18 g TEOS, and 0.13 g TIPT. Stir for 30 minutes.
Transfer the mixture into a Teflon-lined autoclave. Heat at 220°C for 20 hours.
Filter, wash, and dry the final product. The yield is 0.45 g (78% based on Nb).
Dissolve 72.5 g Na2WO4·2H2O (0.22 mol) and 2.84 g Na2HPO4 (0.02 mol) in 150–200 mL of water. Heat to 80–90°C.
Adjust pH to 4.8 with nitric acid, then evaporate about half the solvent.
Add 80–100 mL ether, collect the upper ether layer. Repeat until no phosphoric acid remains.
Obtain crystalline Na7[PW11O39] with 15–20 waters of crystallization.

product_summary.name: Li7[PW11O39]
product_summary.notes: Ion-exchange preparation from the sodium salt.

procedure_steps.description: Exchange Na+ in Na7[PW11O39] with Li+ using Amberlite IR 120 resin.
Dry the resulting lithium salt to obtain Li7[PW11O39].
Dissolve 20 g of H3[P2W12O40] in 100 mL of water and heat the solution.
Add 1 kg of KCl, adjust pH to 5.0, filter, and concentrate under reduced pressure.
Place at room temperature to recrystallize. Obtain white crystals of K7[PW11O39]·12H2O.
procedure_steps.comments: Heating them yields anhydrous or partially dehydrated salt.

product_summary.name: [(CH3)4N]4Na2H[α-PW11O39]·8H2O
product_summary.notes: White crystals obtained by slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 50 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 90 g Na2HPO4 in 20 mL water.
Adjust the pH of the solution to 6.0 using hydrochloric acid.
Add 0.15 mL TiCl4 and mix the solution thoroughly.
procedure_steps.comments: TiCl4 is optional according to the procedure

procedure_steps.description: Allow the solution to cool to room temperature.
Add the cooled solution to 1.00 g (CH3)4NCl.
Evaporate the solution slowly at room temperature to obtain white crystals.
Add 40 mL water, 20.0 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 1.48 g Na2HPO4·7H2O with stirring until fully dissolved.
Slowly add 4 mL 12 M HCl drop-wise over 15 min.
Add 8.0 g n-Bu4NBr dissolved in 60 mL water; a white precipitate forms immediately.
Add 6 mL 3 M HCl to adjust pH to 1.0 – 1.2.
Stir vigorously for 5 min at pH 1.0 – 1.2.
Filter the suspension to isolate the solid.
Wash the solid with water.
Dry under vacuum at 60 °C.
Dissolve 120 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 150 mL water with stirring until clear.
Add 4.0 mL 85 % H3PO4 drop-wise; pH ≈ 8.9 – 9.0.
Stir vigorously.
Add 2.5 mL cold acetic acid drop-wise; precipitate forms (pH ≈ 7.5 ± 0.3).
procedure_steps.comments: Reported 0.40 mol is contradictory to volume.

procedure_steps.description: Continue stirring for 1 h.
Filter the precipitate.
Dry the solid product.
Dissolve 120 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 150 mL water with stirring.
Add 4.0 mL 85 % H3PO4 drop-wise.
Add 35 mL 1 M HCl slowly; pH drops and precipitate forms.
Stir for an extended period (longer than 1 h).
Filter the precipitate.
Dry the product.
Dissolve 120 g of Na2WO4·2H2O in 150 mL of water.
Stir the solution.
Slowly add 3 mL of H3PO4 while stirring.
procedure_steps.comments: Acidification leads to a white solid

procedure_steps.description: Filter the resulting mixture.
Wash the solid with water.
Dry the white precipitate to obtain the final product.
Dissolve 11 g Na8[β-HPW9O34]·24H2O in 20 mL water.
Add a premixed solution of 16 mL 1 M sodium molybdate and 12 mL 1 M HCl drop-wise to the above solution, adjusting pH to 6.0 – 6.5.
Add solid KCl, stir, then filter to collect the product.
procedure_steps.comments: Amount of KCl not specified; excess used.

name: K7[α-PW7Mo5O40] ⋅ 25H2O
K5[α-PW7Mo5O40] ⋅ 25H2O
product_summary.notes: Product reportedly unstable in aqueous solution

procedure_steps.description: Mix 20 mL cyclohexane and 30 mL of 5.45 mol·L^-1 HCl solution.
Add 10 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 tetraethylammonium solution.
Add 10 g of K7[α-PW7Mo2O39] ⋅ 19H2O to the mixture.
Dissolve 59 g H3PW12O40·nH2O in 50 mL water.
Gradually add 5 g Li2CO3 with vigorous stirring until pH 4.8.
Dissolve 3.1 g NaVO3 in 100 mL water and add to the above solution; heat to 80 °C while stirring.
Adjust pH to 4.0 with 6 M HCl, combine solutions, then adjust to pH 2.0 and perform heat/cool cycles (60 °C ↔ 25 °C) until stable.
Add 20 g KCl, maintain 60 °C for 15 min, then cool to 25 °C.
Filter yellow precipitate.
Wash with 50 mL pH 2 water.
Dry the product.
Dissolve 8.2 g NaOAc in 100 mL water.
Adjust pH to 4.8 with acetic acid.
procedure_steps.comments: Volume of acetic acid not specified.

procedure_steps.description: Add 3.05 g NaVO3 and 20 g Na9-xHx[α-PW9O34]; stir 48 h at 25 °C (wine-red solution forms).
Add 8 g CsCl and stir 30 min.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash twice with water and ethanol.
Dry under vacuum.
Dissolve 10 g of Cs5[γ-PV2W10O39] in 300 mL of water.
Reduce the temperature to 0 °C, filter, and concentrate to ~75 mL.
procedure_steps.comments: Evaporation or spinning to 75 mL, then filter again

procedure_steps.description: Cool again to 0°C and filter to obtain solids (~5.5 g, 70% yield).
Dissolve the obtained product (5.5 g) in 200 mL of water at 25°C, filter, then slowly evaporate at 0°C to yield 7 g with 60% yield.
Dissolve 1 g of NaVO3 in 40 mL of water and heat to 70°C. Slowly add 5 mol·L^-1 HCl solution to adjust pH to 0.8, stirring until a green color forms (VO2⁺). Filter and cool.
procedure_steps.comments: VO2⁺ formation indicated by green color

procedure_steps.description: Obtain Cs7[PW10O39]·H2O (3.6 mmol) as a solid, dissolve slowly in aqueous methanol (details not fully specified).
Stir the solution for 30 minutes to obtain a yellow precipitate. Filter to obtain 10.9 g of crude Cs5[γ-PV2W10O39]·17 H2O (90% yield).
Dissolve 10 g of crude product in 100 mL of water, slowly acidify to pH 2.0, add 5 g more crude Cs5[γ-PV2W10O39], stir 1 hour, filter at 0°C to obtain 12 g of Cs6[γ-PV2W10O39]·6H2O.
procedure_steps.comments: pH 2.0, final product is described as Cs6[γ-PV2W10O39]·6H2O

characterization.comments: Characteristic peaks, yellow product at pH 2

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)5[PV2W10O40]
product_summary.notes: Product isolated as crystalline solid; literature also reports formula variant O39 vs O40

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve NaH2PO4·2H2O (0.39 g) and Na2WO4·2H2O (8.25 g) in 400 mL water with stirring.
Add 21.7 mL concentrated HCl dropwise with stirring.
Introduce 5 mL of V(V) stock solution (from NH4VO3 + NaOH) into the reaction mixture.
procedure_steps.comments: Exact masses of NH4VO3/NaOH added unknown (sub-aliquot)

procedure_steps.description: Dilute with water to a total volume of 500 mL.
Add excess n-Bu4NBr to precipitate the POM tetrabutylammonium salt.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash the solid successively with ethanol and diethyl ether.
Recrystallize the crude product from acetonitrile to obtain (n-Bu4N)5[PV2W10O40] crystals.
Dissolve NaH2PO4·2H2O (0.39 g) and Na2WO4·2H2O (8.25 g) in 400 mL water with stirring.
Add 21.7 mL concentrated HCl dropwise with stirring.
Introduce 5 mL of V(V) stock solution (from NH4VO3 + NaOH) into the reaction mixture.
Dilute with water to a total volume of 500 mL.
Add excess n-Bu4NBr to precipitate the POM salt.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash the solid successively with ethanol and diethyl ether.
Recrystallize the crude product from acetonitrile to obtain (n-Bu4N)4[PVW11O40] crystals.

name: K4[α-PVW11O40]·2H2O
product_summary.notes: Approx. 40 g of yellow solid obtained

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 54 g of H3[PW12O40] in 50 mL of water and stir for about 2 hours at room temperature.
Add solid Li2CO3 to adjust pH to 4.9. Stir and reduce the volume to about 75 mL.
Add 100 mL of 0.2 M NaVO3 solution and stir.
Add 6 M HCl dropwise to adjust pH to 2.0, heat to 60°C, keep warm for ~10 min, then cool to room temperature.
Add 6 M HCl dropwise again to pH 2.0, reheat to 60°C for 10 min, cool to room temperature.
At 60°C, add 20 g of KCl, stir for about 10 minutes, then cool to room temperature to obtain a yellow precipitate.

characterization.comments: Mentioned in text without specific peak values

name: K5[PVⁿW11O40]⋅8H2O
product_summary.notes: First portion 7.8 g, second portion 13.8 g

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 29 g of H3[PW12O40] in 20 mL of water.
Slowly add 2.6 g of Li2CO3 to adjust pH to about 4.8.
Add 1.6 g of VOSO4 dissolved in 5 mL of water to the mixture, stirring for 2 minutes to reach pH ~1.9.
Add 10 g of KCl in 30 mL of water. Heat the mixture at 0°C for 15 minutes to reduce the volume by half.
Cool the mixture to 0°C, filter the precipitate, and dry to obtain 7.8 g of product.
Warm the mixture to 60°C for 15 minutes to further reduce the volume by half, then filter at 0°C to obtain 13.8 g of product.
Dissolve 30 g of Na3[PW12O40] in 25 mL of water.
Add an equivalent amount of HAc/NaAc buffer (pH 4.5) containing VOSO4 while stirring.
Heat to near boiling, then add solid KAc until no further color change is observed.
Add 1 g of KAc and store the mixture in an ice box overnight to crystallize.
Filter and wash with HAc/NaAc buffer (pH 4.5) to recrystallize.

name: Acetic acid/sodium acetate buffer (1 M, pH 4.8)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve NaVO3 (6.1 g) in 200 mL 1 M acetate buffer (pH 4.8).
Add Na8H[HPW9O34] (40 g) and stir until a dark-green solution forms.
Add KCl (15 g) and stir for 30 min.
Add 250 mL ethanol, filter and dry to isolate K6[α-1,2,3-PV3W9O40]·4H2O (intermediate).
To the remaining solution add CsCl slowly until no further precipitation occurs.
Filter the Cs-salt precipitate and wash with 25 % ethanol.
Recrystallize the solid from hot water (80 °C) and dry to give Cs6[α-1,2,3-PV3W9O40].

name: Acetic acid/sodium acetate buffer (1 M, pH 4.8)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve NaVO3 (6.1 g) in 200 mL acetate buffer (pH 4.8).
Add Na8H[HPW9O34] (40 g) and stir at 25 °C to form a dark-green solution.
Add KCl (15 g) and stir for 30 min.
Add 250 mL ethanol, filter hot and dry to obtain K6[α-1,2,3-PV3W9O40]·4H2O.
Dry the solid product.

product_summary.name: K5[α-1,2-PV2W10O40]·3H2O
product_summary.notes: Orange crystals; NMR shows 85 % target isomer

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve Na8H[HPW9O34] (30 g) in 50 mL water at 20 °C with vigorous stirring.
After 1 min, slowly add VOSO4 (4.2 g) dissolved in 17 mL water; stir 30 min.
Heat to 60 °C and add a few crystals of Br2; orange crystals precipitate.
Add KCl (25 g) and stir at 80 °C.
Filter and dry to obtain 28.3 g orange product (85 % α-1,2-isomer).
Optional: suspend product in 0.5 mL 1 M HCl, keep at 80 °C for 16 h to obtain structural isomer.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[PVW11O39]
product_summary.notes: Yellow powder; single crystals obtainable by recrystallization from ether

procedure_steps.description: Mix 0.24 g VOCl3 and 5 g (n-Bu4N)4H3[PW11O39] in 25 mL acetonitrile under nitrogen in a Schlenk flask.
Heat the reaction mixture at 80 °C.
Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature.
Add 300 mL diethyl ether to precipitate a yellow solid.
Filter the precipitated solid.
Wash the solid with diethyl ether.
Dry the product under vacuum.
Dissolve 0.225 g methyltrioxoniobium in 2 mL acetonitrile under nitrogen.
Dissolve 0.375 g NbCl5 in 2.5 mL acetonitrile.
Combine the two acetonitrile solutions to form NbOCl3·2MeCN.
Stir the mixture for 2 h at 25 °C under nitrogen.
Rapidly add the NbOCl3·2MeCN mixture to a solution of (n-Bu4N)3H3[PW11O39] (in 40 mL acetonitrile).
Reflux the mixture until the solvent evaporates completely.
Cool the residue to room temperature.
Filter the crude product.
Wash the solid with diethyl ether.
Recrystallize the product from 300 mL diethyl ether.
Dry the recrystallized solid under vacuum.
Dissolve 0.495 g TaCl5 in 25 mL chloroform under nitrogen.
Prepare an aqueous solution of 5 g (n-Bu4N)3H3[PW11O39] and 4 g Na2CO3 in 25 mL water.
Slowly add the aqueous phase to the chloroform solution with vigorous stirring.
Allow the biphasic mixture to react for 24 h at room temperature.
Filter the mixture and wash the precipitate with water.
Transfer the filtrate to a Schlenk flask and heat at 80 °C.
Cool the solution to room temperature.
Add 300 mL diethyl ether while stirring to precipitate the product.
Filter the yellow solid and wash with diethyl ether.
Dry the product under vacuum.
Dissolve Na3[PW12O40] and Na3[PMo12O40] in water in an 11 : 1 molar ratio.
Concentrate the solution until the polyoxometalate concentration reaches 0.1 mol L-1, causing red crystals to precipitate.
Collect the crystals by filtration.
Dry the crystalline product.
Dissolve 10 g Na3[PW12O40] in 100 mL 1 M HNO3 (pH 2.3).
Introduce chlorine gas to oxidize the solution to [PW11O39]7-.
Add 7.83 g Na2MoO4·2H2O dissolved in 100 mL water and 10 mL 40 % HCl.
Add 200 mL Hg(II) acetate solution.
Stir for 15 min.
Filter the red solution.
Add an additional 10 mL water to the filtrate and stir for 15 min.
Slowly evaporate the solution to crystallize the product.
Collect the crystals by filtration.
Dry the crystalline product.
Dissolve 90 mg H3[α-PW12O40]·6H2O and 7.5 mg CoCl2·6H2O in 1.5 mL water.
Heat the solution to 80 °C in an oil bath.
Cool to room temperature and stir.
Add 300 mL diethyl ether to precipitate a yellow solid.
Filter the solid.
Wash the product with diethyl ether.
Dry the product under vacuum.
Add 100 mL water to a beaker and add 11 g Na2SiO3 with stirring to give solution A.
Dissolve 182 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 300 mL boiling water to obtain solution B.
Add 165 mL 4 M HCl drop-wise to solution B over 30 min while stirring, forming tungstic acid precipitate.
Pour solution A into solution B with stirring.
Immediately add 50 mL 4 M HCl to adjust pH 5–6.
Heat the mixture to boiling, then cool to room temperature.
Filter to obtain a clear solution.
Add 150 g KCl, stir until a white solid forms.
Collect the precipitate by filtration and wash with 50 mL cold water.
Air-dry the product to constant mass.

name: K6Na2[SiW11O39]·13H2O
product_summary.notes: White solid with correct elemental analysis

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 90.7 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 150 mL water. Add 3.05 g Na2SiO3 under vigorous stirring.
Slowly add the mixture to 100 mL of 4 M HCl solution while heating to boiling for 1 hour. Cool to room temperature.
Add 37.5 g of KCl to the cooled solution to obtain a white solid precipitate.
Filter and wash the solid. Collect and dry. Elemental analysis matches K6Na2[SiW11O39]·13H2O.
Dissolve 2.84 g Na2SiO3·9H2O (10 mmol) in 50 mL water, add 11.24 g Na2WO4 (45 mmol), and heat under reflux ~48 hours. Filter off undissolved solids to obtain a dark purple solution of [α-SiW12O40]4-.
Take 16 mL of the solution, add 0.4 g solid salt (unspecified), adjust pH to ~5.5 with HCl, and add 0.002 g carbon powder. Stir the mixture at ~15°C to grow crystals further.

name: (CH6N3)K6Na[SiW11O39]·11.5H2O
(CN3H6)6K6Na[SiW9O39]·11.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Nominally labeled (CH6N3)K6Na[SiW11O39]·11.5H2O, but procedure text describes (CN3H6)6K6Na[SiW9O39]·11.5H2O.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.5 g of KCl in 20 mL of water and add 9 mL of the [α-SiW12O40]4- solution. A pale yellow precipitate forms.
Filter the pale yellow precipitate and dry it in air.
Dissolve 0.25 g of the dried solid in 6 mL of water and add 0.004 g of dibucaine hydrochloride.
Adjust the pH of the solution to 6.0.
Leave the solution to crystallize at 15 °C, yielding yellow crystals of (CN3H6)6K6Na[SiW9O39]·11.5H2O.

characterization.comments: Characteristic peaks of the final product

procedure_steps.description: Add 40 mL water to a flask and dissolve 5.8 g Na9[β-HSiW9O34]·23H2O and 1.42 g Na2WO4·2H2O with stirring.
Add 5 mL HCl to adjust pH to 6.0 while stirring.
Add 50 mL ethanol, allow layers to separate, and decant the lower layer.
Repeat addition of 25 mL portions of ethanol and decanting five times.
Filter the remaining solid.
Evaporate and dry the solid in a vacuum desiccator.
Dissolve 11 g Na2SiO3 in 100 mL water with stirring.
Add 182 g Na2WO4·2H2O dissolved in 300 mL water.
Rapidly add 165 mL 4 M HCl while stirring, then adjust pH to 5–6 with additional acid as required.
Maintain the solution at pH 5–6 for 100 min with stirring.
Slowly add 90 g KCl, stir 15 min, and filter the white precipitate.
Dry the crude product, then dissolve in 850 mL water and re-precipitate with 40 g KCl.

name: K8[β3-SiW11O39] · 14H2O
product_summary.notes: K8[β3-SiW11O39] · 14H2O (white solid); fractions separated from β8 and α bodies

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 30 g of K8[β2-SiW11O39] · 14H2O (9.4 mmol) in 300 mL of water. Filter out any insolubles.
Adjust the pH of the filtrate to 4–5 with 5 mL of 4 M HCl solution, then store at room temperature for 44 hours.
Add 60 g of solid KCl, stir for 2 hours, and filter the white precipitate (β8 compound). Wash with 200 mL of water.
Add 40 g of KCl to the filtrate to obtain more precipitate. Wash with 200 mL of 1 M KCl, then dry in air.

characterization.comments: Two electron waves at -0.69V and -0.89V vs SCE in 1 M NaAc/AcAc
White solid; slowly converts to α bodies in solution

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 15 g K8[β2-SiW11O39]·14H2O in 250 mL boiling water, filter any residue.
Quickly raise pH to 9.1 with 2 M K2CO3 solution.
Bubble CO2 through the solution; stand until pH drops slightly.
Stir 16 min, maintaining pH ≈ 9.1.
Add 40 g KCl to precipitate the product.
Filter, wash, dissolve precipitate in 1 M KCl, and evaporate to dryness at room temperature.
Dissolve 182 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 11 g Na2SiO3 in 200 mL water with stirring.
Slowly add 130 mL 6 M HCl while stirring.
Boil the mixture until the volume reduces to 300 mL.
Filter hot to remove any precipitate.
Dissolve 50 g Na2CO3 in 50 mL water in a separate vessel.
Slowly add the hot filtrate to the Na2CO3 solution.
Slowly evaporate; upon cooling a precipitate forms.

product_summary.name: Na9[β-HSiW9O34]·23 H2O
product_summary.notes: Colourless crystals; water-soluble solid that slowly isomerises in solution

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 12 g Na2SiO3 (R1) in 250 mL cold H2O (R4).
Add 150 g Na2WO4·2H2O (R2) with stirring.
Portion-wise add 95 mL 6 M HCl (R3) with vigorous stirring.
Filter the resulting mixture to remove solids.
Allow the clear filtrate to stand at room temperature for several hours until colourless crystals form.

characterization.device: Glassy-carbon electrode, 1 M HOAc/NaOAc vs SCE

apparatus.notes: 20 g Dowex-50 (H⁺ form) used for cation exchange

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 41.4 g H4[SiW12O40] (R1) in 25 mL H2O (R2); heat to 80 °C.
Add 13.8 g NaHCO3 (R3).
Cool to 25 °C and filter; adjust filtrate to pH 8.2.
Add 4.9 g NaVO3 (R4) to the filtrate.
Add excess 6 M HCl (R5); boil strongly for 1 min.
Cool on ice and adjust to pH 5.5; filter to remove V2O5.
Heat filtrate to 80 °C, then cool to precipitate the product; collect by filtration and wash with H2O.
Recrystallize to obtain second crop (13.5 g).
Pass crude product through Dowex-50 (App1) to yield Li-salt.
Dissolve 28.8 g of H4[SiW12O40] (10 mmol) in 25 mL of water and heat to 40°C. Slowly adjust pH to 7.9 by adding 7.2 g NaHCO3.
Add 3 g VOSO4 (18 mmol) dissolved in 5 mL water dropwise over about 30 minutes while heating to 60°C.
Slowly add 10 g of KCl, let it stand at 60°C for 15 minutes, then cool to 0°C for 15 minutes.
procedure_steps.comments: K+ introduced for final salt formation

procedure_steps.description: Filter the mixture and collect black crystals. 23 g product obtained.
Dissolve 5.5 g NaVO3 (R1) and 40 g Na10[α-SiW9O34] (R2) in 400 mL H2O (R3).
Adjust pH to 1.5 with 6 M HCl (R4) to obtain a wine-red solution.
Add 50 g KCl (R5); stir and filter the dark-red precipitate.
Wash precipitate with 1.5 L EtOH (R6) and dry in air.
Dissolve powder in hot H2O (65 °C), filter while hot, and cool to 0 °C to crystallize.

product_summary.name: K6H[α-1,2,3-SiV3W9O40]·3 H2O
product_summary.notes: Orange crystals; further recrystallization gives black-red form

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5.5 g NaVO3 (R1) and 40 g Na10[α-SiW9O34] (R2) in 400 mL H2O (R3).
Adjust pH to 1.5 with 6 M HCl (R4).
Add 50 g KCl (R5); filter dark-red precipitate.
Wash with 1.5 L EtOH (R6) and dry in air.
Dissolve powder in hot water (65 °C), filter, cool 16 h at 0 °C to obtain orange crystals; dry to 2.3 g product.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[γ-SiW10Mo2O40]
product_summary.notes: Yellow precipitate isolated after Et2O addition

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.50 g (n-Bu4N)2Mo2O7 (R1) and 2 g (n-Bu4N)4H4[γ-SiW10O36] (R2) to 5 mL EtOH (R3).
Add 5 mL 2 M HCl (R4); stir until solids dissolve.
Allow solution to stand several days undisturbed.
Slowly add 200 mL Et2O (R5) to precipitate yellow solid.
Filter, wash with Et2O (R5), and dry.
Dissolve 2.5 g VOSO4·5H2O in 30 mL 1 M H3Ac/NaAc buffer with rapid stirring at room temperature.
Add 24 g K8[SiW11O39]·13H2O to the stirred solution.
Heat the mixture to 60 °C and stir for 3 min.
Gradually add 7.5 g solid KCl.
Cool the mixture to 5 °C to precipitate black solids.
Filter to isolate the black solid.
Dissolve 10 g of the solid in 12 mL water.
Quickly filter off insoluble green impurities.
Heat the purple solution at 70 °C for 2 h.
Allow the solution to cool to room temperature.
Filter to obtain the final product.
Add 10 mL 1 M Na2MoO4 solution dropwise to 6 mL 13 M HNO3 at 25 °C.
Add 10 g K8[SiW11O39]·12H2O to form a yellow precipitate of K4[α-SiMoW11O40].
Allow the precipitate to stand several hours.
Filter to collect the pale-yellow solid.
Wash the solid with water, ethanol and acetic acid.
Cool the filtrate to 0 °C to recover additional product.
Dissolve the combined pale-yellow solid in 30 mL water and add 10 g n-Bu4NBr to precipitate (n-Bu4N)4[α-SiMoW11O40].
Wash the final yellow solid with water, ethanol and acetic acid.
Dissolve 6 g K8[γ-SiW10O36]·12H2O in 50 mL 4.8 * 10-2 M [Mo2O4]2⁺ solution.
procedure_steps.comments: Solution color changes from yellow to dark red

procedure_steps.description: Add 3.5 g CsCl to the cooled dark-red solution to precipitate the product.
Filter and collect the precipitate Cs6[γ-SiW10Mo2O40]·8H2O.
Dissolve 25 g crude K4[β-SiMo3W9O40] in 50 mL water.
Add 20 g n-Bu4NBr dissolved in 20 mL water; a yellow precipitate forms.
Filter to collect the yellow precipitate.
Wash with water, ethanol and acetic acid.
Recrystallize the solid from ethanol and dry.
Dissolve 25 g crude K4[β-SiMo9W4O40] in 50 mL water.
Add 20 mL ion-exchange resin and mix.
Filter to remove the resin.
Evaporate the filtrate to dryness to obtain H4[β-SiMo9W4O40]·30H2O.
Add 40 mL 1 M Na2MoO4 solution to 60 mL 12 M HCl (acidification).
Slowly add 27 g Na9[β-HSiW9O34]·23H2O.
Stir the mixture for 30 min.
Add excess KCl to induce precipitation.
Filter to collect the light-yellow precipitate.
Wash the crude product with saturated KCl solution, ethanol and acetic acid.
Dissolve 60 g Na2SiO3·9H2O in 500 mL boiling water.
Add 362 g Na2WO4·2H2O and continue boiling for 2 min.
Quickly add 200 mL 6 M HCl with vigorous stirring; white colloid forms.
Stir the mixture for 10 min.
Filter to remove the colloid; cool the filtrate to 4 °C in an ice-bath and stand 2–3 days.
Collect white crystals Na9H[A-β-SiW9O34]·23H2O; dry 1–2 days.
Dissolve 6.4 g NaVO3 in 900 mL hot water at 85 °C; cool to 20 °C and acidify with 22.6 mL 6 M HCl to pH≈1.5.
Add 48 g Na9H[A-β-SiW9O34] precursor and stir; then add 60 g KCl.
Add 900 mL methanol; red solid precipitates immediately.
Filter and dry 12–24 h at room temperature to obtain crude K6H[A-β-SiW9V3O40].
Dissolve 30 g crude product in 100 mL 0.03 M HCl and 50 mL methanol; crystallize by slow evaporation at 4 °C for 6 h.
Filter crystals and dry at room temperature.
Dissolve 30 g K6H[A-β-SiW9V3O40]·3H2O in 150 mL 0.03 M HCl.
Slowly add 15 g (C4H9)4NCl while stirring to obtain a clear solution.
Add an additional 75 mL 0.03 M HCl; yellow precipitate forms within 5–10 min.
Filter immediately; wash with 20 mL 0.03 M HCl; dry under vacuum 6 h then at 65 °C.
Dissolve 20 g product in 30 mL hot ethanol (55 °C); add 75 mL hot acetone (55 °C).
Allow to stand at 20–25 °C for one week to crystallize; filter and dry.
Dissolve 15 g [(C4H9)4N]4H3[A-β-SiW9V3O40] in 150 mL ethanol.
Add 13.1 mL 1.0 M (C4H9)4NOH in methanol while stirring; continue for 15 min.
Remove solvent under vacuum at room temperature (12–16 h) to obtain yellow-brown powder (crude product).
Dissolve 0.79 g CpTiCl3 in 30 mL dry ether under N2; add drop-wise to 1.83 g AgNO3 in 20 mL ether; stir 15 min to form red CpTi3+ solution (AgCl precipitates).
Add 15 g [(C4H9)4N]4[A-β-SiW9V3O40] dissolved in 50 mL dry ethanol to the filtered CpTi3+ solution.
Remove solvent by rotary evaporation; transfer viscous residue to 150 mL ether; stand 15 min.
Filter red solid; wash with 20 mL dry ethanol; dry under vacuum 2 h to yield product.
Dissolve 1.91 g K7H[Nb6O19]·13H2O in 250 mL water with stirring.
Add 20 mL 1 M HCl to obtain clear yellow solution.
Add 7.82 g Na10[α-SiW9O34]·23H2O and dissolve completely.
Add 25 g CsCl; [α-Si(NbO2)3W9O37]7- salt precipitates.
Filter, wash twice with 20 mL ethanol and acetic acid, dry under air.
Dissolve 4.50 g Cs6H[A-α-Si(NbO2)3W9O37]·8H2O in 150 mL 0.5 M HCl (yellow solution).
Evaporate until yellow film appears.
Slowly add 6 mL 1 M CsOH to adjust pH to 2.5; white precipitate forms.
Filter and dry under vacuum at room temperature for 9 days.
Dissolve 8.3 mL 1 M CsOH and 6.82 g (TBA)6H2[A-α-Si2Nb6W18O77]·Et2O in 60 mL ether.
Stir and wash with petroleum ether to remove excess reagents.
Filter precipitated product; wash twice with 20 mL ether and 50 mL acetonitrile.
Dry under vacuum for 3 days.
Add R1, R2, R3 and a small amount of water to a reaction vessel (total volume ≈ 31.7 mL).
Introduce 0.66 mol of 1.63 M n-Bu4NOH (R5) to dissolve all solids.
Heat the mixture at 50 °C in acetonitrile to promote reaction.
Remove residual solids by filtration.
Dry the filtrate residue at 80 °C for 2–3 h to give (n-Bu4N)7[SiW9Nb3O40].
To 190 mL water add 3.15 g K8[Ta10O29]·17H2O and 30 mL 30 % H2O2; stir to dissolve.
Introduce 24 mL 1 M HCl while stirring.
Add 8.73 g Na10[A-α-SiW9O34]·18H2O; stir until homogeneous yellow solution forms.
Add 30 g CsCl and stir 30 min to precipitate the product.
Filter the yellow solid and wash with 15 mL ethanol.
Dry the washed solid to afford Cs3K3.5H0.5[SiW9(TaO2)3O37]·9H2O.

characterization.comments: Calculated values: Si 0.78 %, K 3.79 %, Cs 11.04 %, Ta 15.03 %, W 45.81 %

procedure_steps.description: Add 80 g Cs8K3.5H0.5[SiW9(TaO2)3O37]·9H2O to 30 mL 0.5 M HCl to form a yellow solution.
Evaporate solvent, allow to cool gradually, filter, and wash twice with acetone.
Further evaporate the mother liquor to obtain additional solid upon slow evaporation.
Dissolve 182 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 15 g Na2GeO3 in 200 mL water with stirring.
Add 130 mL 6 M HCl to acidify the solution.
Boil the mixture and concentrate to 300 mL.
Filter hot to remove solids; keep filtrate.
To 50 mL of the filtrate add 50 g ice-cooled water then hot water to induce crystallisation.
Collect Na10[α-GeW9O34]·18H2O crystals.
Dissolve 16.4 g Na2GeO3 in 250 mL cold water.
Add 150 g Na2WO4·2H2O with stirring.
Slowly add 95 mL 6 M HCl while heating the mixture.
Allow the mixture to crystallise for several hours at room temperature.
Filter to collect white salt crystals.
Dry the crystals to constant weight.

product_summary.name: K8[β2-GeW11O39]·14H2O
product_summary.notes: White precipitate; yield based on combined W & Ge

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5.4 g GeO2 in 100 mL water (Solution A).
Add 165 mL 4 M HCl to Solution A over ≤ 15 min with stirring.
Dissolve 18 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 300 mL water (Solution B) and slowly pour Solution A into B.
Adjust pH to 5.2–5.8 using an additional ~40 mL 4 M HCl.
Bubble CO2 through the acidic solution, maintaining pH for 100 min.
Add 90 g KCl and stir slowly; white precipitate forms within 15 min.
Filter to collect the white solid.
Dry the solid to obtain 112 g K8[β2-GeW11O39]·14H2O.

product_summary.name: K6[γ-GeW10O36]·6H2O
product_summary.notes: White precipitate formed by KCl addition.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 15.2 g K6[β2-GeW11O39]·14H2O in 150 mL water, filter to remove insolubles.
Adjust pH to 8.7–8.9 with 2 M K2CO3 solution and maintain for 16 minutes.
Add 40 g KCl to form a white precipitate.
Filter the precipitate, wash with a small amount of ice water, and dry in air.

product_summary.name: K6Na2[GeW11O39]·13H2O
product_summary.notes: White crystalline product after hot recrystallization

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.092 g GeO2 in 40 mL 1 M NaOH.
Add 72.6 g Na2WO4·2H2O dissolved in 120 mL water.
Add 80 mL 4 M HCl drop-wise with vigorous stirring.
Cool the mixture to room temperature.
Add 30 g KCl to precipitate the product.
Filter and collect the white solid.
Recrystallize the solid from hot solution.
Dissolve 300 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 20 g H3BO3 in 500 mL boiling water.
Add 190 mL 6 M HCl over 20 min with vigorous stirring until the precipitate dissolves.
Boil the clear solution for 1 h.
Cool to room temperature and store at 4 °C for 24 h.
Filter to obtain a clear filtrate.
Add 100 g KCl to the filtrate to precipitate the product.
Dissolve the precipitate in 1 L warm water, filter insolubles.
Add another 100 g KCl to re-precipitate K8[HBW11O39]·13H2O.
Collect the white product by filtration.
Dissolve 72.5 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 5 g H3BO3 in 300 mL water. Adjust pH to ~6.1 and boil.
procedure_steps.comments: Exact base/acid used to reach pH 6.1 not specified.

procedure_steps.description: Gradually add 40 g KCl to the hot solution. After cooling, brown crystals are formed.
procedure_steps.comments: Filter and heat the crystals in water to finalize product.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 36.3 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 75 mL water, heat gently, then cool.
Adjust pH to 9.4 with acetic acid (total volume 90 mL).
Add 2.47 g H3BO3, stir while heating to 80 °C.
Add 1.3 g VOSO4 in 3 mL water; solution turns brown–red.
Add 20 g KCl, stir 5 min at 80 °C.
Cool to 20 °C and stand 30 min.
Filter the precipitate and dissolve in 60 mL water.
Adjust pH to 5 with acetic acid and heat to 90 °C.
Filter hot to remove suspended solids and recrystallize to give crystals.
Dissolve 0.5 g crystals in 50 mL water, heat to 50 °C, add bromine to oxidize.
Filter the reddish-yellow solid product.

product_summary.name: H5[AlW11O37]·22H2O
product_summary.notes: White powder, slightly soluble in water

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 132 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 400 mL water and add 194.4 mL HNO3 to form peroxotungstic acid.
Boil vigorously with stirring for 20–24 h.
Add 10 g Al(NO3)3·9H2O dissolved in 500 mL water; white precipitate forms.
Cool, filter the mixture, and adjust pH < 4.
procedure_steps.comments: Acid used for pH adjustment not specified

procedure_steps.description: Concentrate the filtrate to ~200 mL, cool to 6 °C for 20–24 h.
Filter and wash with 300–400 mL water/ether mixture.
Dissolve precipitate in 400 mL 1 M H2SO4; three layers form—collect bottom layer.
Evaporate the bottom layer to dryness to obtain H5[AlW11O37]·22H2O.

product_summary.name: (NH4)4H[AlW11O37]·17.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Formed by partial neutralization of H5[AlW11O37]·22H2O with NH3.

procedure_steps.description: Add enough ammonia to a solution of H5[AlW11O37]·22H2O to induce dissolution.
Filter to obtain (NH4)4H[AlW11O37]·17.5H2O.
Add guanidinium nitrate solution to a solution of H5[AlW11O37]·22H2O.

product_summary.name: K5[AlW11O37]·22H2O
product_summary.notes: Easily soluble in water, re-crystallizes upon heating.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve H5[AlW11O37]·22H2O in saturated potassium nitrate solution.
procedure_steps.comments: Ion exchange or partial K+ insertion.

procedure_steps.description: Obtain orange-red crystals of K5[AlW11O37]·22H2O upon cooling or partial evaporation.
procedure_steps.comments: Crystals are bright yellow upon heating, revert to yellow solution on dissolution.

product_summary.name: Na9[α-AlW11O39]·15H2O
product_summary.notes: Mixture of α (82%) and β (18%) forms.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.95 g Na5[α-AlW12O40] in 2.0 mL D2O at 4 °C under stirring.
procedure_steps.comments: Heavy water is said to increase the β conversion rate; possibly relevant to polymorph mixture.

procedure_steps.description: Slowly add 22 g NaOH in portions. After about one-fifth has been added, colloidal precipitation begins. Add 2 mL more D2O, stir 15 minutes.
Collect the solid by filtration, vacuum dry.
procedure_steps.comments: Yield 1.76 g (62%), contains about 82% α form and 18% β form.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 15.0 g Na5[β-AlW12O40] (90% β, 10% α) in 9.0 mL water at 4 °C under rapid stirring.
procedure_steps.comments: Initial solution has some mixture of α and β forms.

procedure_steps.description: Slowly add 22 g NaOH dissolved in 20 mL cold water, keeping pH ≤ 9.5. A colloidal precipitation forms.
Vacuum dry the solid. Yield 8.93 g (61%), containing 92% β form and 8% α form.

product_summary.name: K9[α-AlW11O39]·13H2O
product_summary.notes: White powder, pH carefully controlled at 8.25.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 43.76 g H5[α-AlW12O40] in 100 mL water. Heat to 60 °C under stirring.
Slowly add total ~18.59 g K2CO3·1.5H2O in portions (partial as solid, partial as solution) to maintain pH < 8 initially. Then adjust final pH to 8.25.

reagent_usage.comments: 6.97 g added as solid + 11.62 g in solution

procedure_steps.comments: Evolving CO2 bubbles. Final pH 8.25, mixture cooled in ice water.

procedure_steps.description: Collect the white powder, wash with small portions of water, and dry.
Add 50 mL water to the reaction vessel.
Introduce 20 g K9[AlW11O39] and stir until completely dissolved.
Add 12.2 mL 0.5 M VOSO4·3H2O drop-wise while stirring.
Add 4 mL 3 M HCl; solution changes from yellow to orange.
Purge with nitrogen while evaporating until solids begin to form.
Cool the concentrated solution to 5 °C and allow to crystallize.
Collect yellow crystals by filtration.
Recrystallize the product in hot water at 80 °C.

product_summary.name: H5[CrIIIW11O37]·22H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless to greenish final product, water-insoluble. Potential partial decomposition at 120–130 °C.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 56.12 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 400 mL water. Add 194.4 mL HNO3, boil vigorously under stirring to form tungstic acid solution.
procedure_steps.comments: Maintain pH < 5 to prevent tungsten precipitation.

procedure_steps.description: Add 8.1 g Cr(NO3)3 (or alternative Cr sources) in small portions to 500 mL water, then gradually introduce into the boiling tungsten solution. A blue-green precipitate can form if conditions vary.
procedure_steps.comments: Avoid pH>5 to minimize unwanted chromium hydrolysis. If residue forms, add 50 mL 1 M nitric acid to re-acidify.

procedure_steps.description: Adjust solution pH < 4 and evaporate to ~200 mL. Cool to 6 °C for 20–24 hours to allow precipitation.
procedure_steps.comments: Filter and wash with ice water.

procedure_steps.description: Mix the final compound with 300–400 mL acetone, then add 400 mL of 6 M H2SO4. Allow layers to separate; isolate the precipitate.
procedure_steps.comments: Green intermediate product can contain slight blue-green impurities if oxidation/reduction not optimized.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve H5[CrIIIW11O37]·22H2O in water with stirring.
Add a small amount of ammonium acetate or ammonium nitrate solution.
Green crystals form spontaneously.
Collect the crystals by filtration.

product_summary.name: Barium chromium-undecatungstate hydrate
product_summary.notes: Green crystals (reported formula Ba2.5[CrW11O37]·21.5H2O in some sources)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve H5[CrIIIW11O37]·22H2O in water.
Add saturated Ba(NO3)2 or BaCO3 solution to the mixture.
Light-green crystals form and are allowed to mature.
Collect the product by filtration.

product_summary.name: (CN3H6)5[CrIIIW11O37]·5.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Forms light green guanidinium salt of [CrIIIW11O37].

procedure_steps.description: Add guanidine solution into an aqueous solution of H5[CrIIIW11O37]·22H2O to form light green crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: No yield or temperature info provided.

product_summary.name: Potassium chromium-undecatungstate hydrate
product_summary.notes: Water-soluble but decomposes rapidly on dissolution

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve H5[CrIIIW11O37]·22H2O in saturated KNO3 or KCl solution.
Green crystals of K5[CrIIIW11O37]·22H2O form.
Isolate crystals by filtration.

product_summary.name: Manganese undecatungstate acid
product_summary.notes: Deep-red solution yields green crystals; compound unstable

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 56.12 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 400 mL water.
Add 194.4 mL HNO3 to generate peroxotungstic acid; boil vigorously.
Add 10 g Mn(NO3)2 and continue boiling with stirring for 22 h.
Add an additional 67 mL HNO3 to adjust volume to 500 mL.
Evaporate to ~200 mL, cool to 6 °C for 22 h to crystallize.
Filter crystals; cool filtrate on ice and add 300–400 mL acetone to separate layers.
Collect lower aqueous layer and evaporate to dryness to obtain product.
Dissolve Na2WO4·2H2O in water and add 194.4 mL HNO3; boil vigorously.
Add 8 g K3Mn(CN)6 with 120 mL HNO3; continue boiling.
Evaporate to ~200 mL, cool to 6 °C for 20 h to crystallize.
Filter, cool filtrate on ice, add acetone (300–400 mL), separate layers.
Evaporate the aqueous layer to dryness to obtain product.
Dissolve Na2WO4·2H2O in water, add 194.4 mL HNO3, boil with stirring.
Add 7 g MnSO4·4H2O and 90 g H2SO4; continue boiling.
procedure_steps.comments: Solution remains deep-red; pH < 4, no hydrolysis

procedure_steps.description: Evaporate to ~200 mL, cool to 6 °C for 24 h to crystallize.
Filter crystals; treat filtrate with acetone, separate layers.
Evaporate aqueous fraction to dryness to obtain product.
Dissolve H5[MnIIW11O37]·22H2O (R1) in water (R2).
Add ammonium acetate or ammonium nitrate (R3) to the solution to precipitate red crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Red crystals form; product is water-soluble and air-stable

procedure_steps.description: Filter and dry the red crystals.
Dissolve H5[MnIIW11O37]·22H2O (R1) in water (R2).
Add saturated Ba(NO3)2 or BaCO3 solution (R3) to obtain light-green crystals.
Filter and dry the light-green crystals.
Dissolve H5[MnIIW11O37]·22H2O (R1) in water (R2).
Add guanidinium nitrate solution (R3) to obtain reddish-brown crystals.
Filter and dry the crystals.
Dissolve H5[MnIIIW11O37]·22H2O (R1) in saturated KOAc solution (R2/R3) to obtain red crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Product is water-soluble but air-sensitive and hydrolyzes on heating

procedure_steps.description: Filter and dry the red crystals quickly in air.

product_summary.name: K10[Co(II)W11O35(O2)4]·7H2O
product_summary.notes: Product stable at pH 5 in HAc/NaAc buffer

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6.0 g K9[Co(III)W11O39]·12H2O (R1) in 50 mL water (R2) and heat to 80 °C.
Add excess KOAc (R3) to the hot solution to form a red precipitate; filter and recrystallize twice from water.
Dissolve the red solid in 1 M HAc/NaAc buffer (pH 5, R4) to obtain a blue solution.
Add 6 mL 30 % H2O2 (R5) to the blue solution.
Slowly add solid KCl (R6) until large crystals begin to form.
Filter and cool the filtrate slowly in a refrigerator to collect bright-yellow crystals.
Dissolve 36.3 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 6 g acetic acid in 60 mL water.
Add 10 mL 1 M HNO3 dropwise while stirring (final pH ≈ 8.5).
Add 20 g NaAc to the hot solution to precipitate the crude product.
Cool the mixture to room temperature.
Filter to collect the solid.
Wash the solid with methanol.
Dry the product in air.
Dissolve 36.3 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 6 g acetic acid in 60 mL water; boil vigorously.
Add 10 mL 1 M HNO3 dropwise with stirring (pH ≈ 8.5).
Add excess KAc to precipitate K9[GaW10O36].
Cool to room temperature.
Filter the solid.
Wash with methanol.
Dry the product in air.

product_summary.name: Na8[A-HAsW9O34]·11H2O
product_summary.notes: No explicit mass or yield data. IR spectrum reported.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 30 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 1.18 g As2O5 in 40 mL water.
procedure_steps.comments: pH adjusted to 8.4 with acetic acid.

procedure_steps.description: After a few minutes, solution becomes clear. Reflux for 30 minutes to obtain final product.
procedure_steps.comments: Wash 3 times with ethanol, then extract or isolate solid.

product_summary.name: Na8[B-HAsW9O34]·11H2O
product_summary.notes: White precipitate, presumably the B-isomer of HAsW9O34 species.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 30 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 37 mL water. Add 0.8 mL H3AsO4 with stirring.
Add 5 mL acetic acid solution dropwise. After ~1 minute, a large amount of white precipitate forms.
Centrifuge and dry the precipitate at room temperature. Yield 25 g, 83%.
Dissolve 40 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 80 mL boiling water. Add 2.14 g TeO2 and 10 mL concentrated HNO3, mix well.
procedure_steps.comments: Reflux briefly, then cool to RT.

procedure_steps.description: Evaporate solution after cooling. Repeated evaporations yield colorless crystals.
Dissolve 40 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 80 mL boiling water. Add 1.96 g Sb2O3 and 10 mL concentrated HNO3, mix well, reflux briefly.
Cool to RT, then evaporate repeatedly to obtain colorless crystals. Yield 28.0 g (72%).

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[HAsV2W10O40]
product_summary.notes: Product identity depends on vanadium volume; 21.7 mL gives V2 species

procedure_steps.description: Prepare vanadium precursor by dissolving NH4VO3 and NaOH in 500 mL water.
Dissolve 0.78 g Na2HAsO4·7H2O and 8.25 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 200 mL water.
While stirring, add 21.7 mL of the vanadium precursor solution to 250 mL acetonitrile containing the arsenate/tungstate mixture.
Dilute the mixture to 500 mL total volume with acetonitrile/water.
Heat the solution at 80 °C for 3 h.
Add excess n-Bu4NBr to precipitate the tetra-n-butylammonium salt.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash with ethanol.
Dry under vacuum.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[AsVW11O40]
product_summary.notes: 5 mL vanadium solution affords W11 species

procedure_steps.description: Prepare vanadium precursor (NH4VO3 + NaOH in water).
Dissolve Na2HAsO4·7H2O and Na2WO4·2H2O in 200 mL water.
Add 5 mL vanadium precursor solution to 250 mL acetonitrile containing the arsenate/tungstate mixture (cooling).
Heat at 80 °C for 3 h.
Add excess n-Bu4NBr to precipitate the product.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash with ethanol.
Dry under vacuum.
Dissolve 2.42 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 0.31 g Na2HAsO4·7H2O in 100 mL of water.
Adjust the solution pH to ~2.0 with sulfuric acid.
Add 1.3 g n-Bu4NBr. A yellow-gray precipitate forms.
Filter the precipitate, wash with diethyl ether, and dry. Product is yellowish-grey.
procedure_steps.comments: No explicit final yield given other than 'yield was obtained'.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[AsMo11VO40]
product_summary.notes: Yellow precipitate formed upon addition of n-Bu4NBr.

name: NH4VO3
NaOH
reagents.comments: Prepared by dissolving 29.245 g NH4VO3 + 20 g NaOH in 500 mL water

procedure_steps.description: Prepare V(V) solution by dissolving 29.245 g NH4VO3 and 20 g NaOH in 500 mL water.
Dissolve 0.78 g Na2HAsO4·7H2O (2.5 mmol) and 65 g (25 mmol) Na2MoO4·2H2O in 220 mL water.
Add 21.7 mL of 0.25 M HCl in acetonitrile. Stir. Then dropwise add this solution into 45 mL of the prepared V(V) solution. Mix thoroughly, allow to stand.
Add 4.3 g n-Bu4NBr, filter the resulting mixture, wash with ethanol and diethyl ether to obtain yellow precipitate.
procedure_steps.comments: Final product is a yellow solid.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[HAsMo10V2O40]
product_summary.notes: Yellow precipitate, indicates higher experimental hydrogen content.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.78 g Na2HAsO4·7H2O in 200 mL water, forming a yellow solution.
Add the solution to 45 mL of NH4VO3 solution (same stoichiometric ratio). Solution remains yellow. Then add 8 g n-Bu4NBr.
Collect the yellow precipitate via filtration. Wash with ethanol and diethyl ether. Dry to yield 5.1 g product.
procedure_steps.comments: No mention of final pH adjustment or temperature.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[H4GeMo11O39]
product_summary.notes: pH adjustment at 6.4, low-temp conditioning, final addition of n-Bu4NBr.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.7 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 200 mL water. Then dissolve 0.9 g GeO2 in the mixture. Heat to 80 °C.
Adjust pH to ~6.4 with Li2CO3 solution. Let the solution stand at 4 °C (described as 'spolier formation').
procedure_steps.comments: Some crystallization or partial reaction occurs.

procedure_steps.description: Add n-Bu4NBr, filter, and dry the precipitate. Final product is (n-Bu4N)4[H4GeMo11O39].

characterization.comments: C, H, N not fully listed in the experimental data.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.8 g GeO2 in 20 mL 5 % NaOH solution.
Dissolve 1.4 g Na2MoO4 in 30 mL water and add dropwise to the GeO2 solution.
Add 20 g NaVO3 dissolved in 50 mL water.
Adjust pH to 1.0–1.5 with 1 M H2SO4.
Stir the mixture at 90 °C for 2 h.
Cool the reaction mixture to room temperature.
Extract the product from the sulfuric-acid medium with ethanol.
