Dry in air to obtain orange polyhedral crystals.
Dissolve 7.3 g H3[PMo12O40] in 40 mL water.
Adjust pH to 2.3 with Li2CO3 solution.
Add 18 g n-Bu4NBr with vigorous stirring to precipitate a yellow solid.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash with water.
Dry under vacuum.
Dissolve 6.05 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 0.39 g NaH2PO4·2H2O in 500 mL water.
Adjust the pH to 4.0 using HCl.
Add 2.9 g n-Bu4NBr to precipitate a yellow solid.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash the solid with water and ether.
Dry the product.
Dissolve 70 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 0.69 g NaH2PO4·2H2O in 200 mL water. Adjust pH to 1.0 with HCl.
Slowly evaporate at room temperature to obtain gray-white crystals. Filter, wash with 95% ethanol, dry in vacuum.
Add 18 g Na2HPO4·12H2O to a mixture of 73 mL 1.7 M H3PO4 and 20 mL water with stirring until dissolved.
Cool the solution to -10 °C using an ice–salt bath.
Slowly add 10 g Na2MoO4·2H2O dissolved in 200 mL water while maintaining -10 °C.
Store the pale-yellow solution at 0 °C to crystallize.

name: HCl
reagents.comments: Added in two portions of 18 mL and 20 mL, total 38 mL

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 10 g Na3H6[A-α-PMo12O34]·13H2O in 18 mL of 1 M HCl plus an additional 20 mL 1 M HCl, stirring for 2 hours.
Add solid KCl to the acidic solution to form a yellow precipitate. Filter and wash minimally with water at 20 °C.
Dissolve 7.1 g Na2HPO4 in 100 mL water with stirring.
Add 6.1 g V2O5 dissolved in 100 mL boiling water to the phosphate solution and heat.
Add 5 mL concentrated H2SO4; the solution turns dark red.
While heating, slowly add 133 g Na2MoO4·2H2O dissolved in 200 mL water until dissolved.
Slowly add 85 mL concentrated H2SO4; colour changes to light red.
Remove heating and cool to room temperature.
Add 400 mL cold ethanol; mixture separates into three layers.
Extract red middle layer, pass N2 to remove ethanol and obtain red crystalline solid.
Dissolve red solid in 50 mL water and concentrate under vacuum until crystals form; cool and isolate crystals.
Dry the bright-red crystals in air.
Combine 30 g metavanadic acid, 3.4 mL 85 % H3PO4 and 74 g MoO3 in 800 mL water.
Reflux the mixture for 8 h.
Add 145 mL concentrated H2SO4 to the hot solution.
Add 200 mL ethanol; an organic layer separates.
Collect organic layer, evaporate to dryness and recrystallize to obtain crystals.

product_summary.name: H5[PMo10V2O40]·34.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Red crystals. Good agreement with theoretical values.

name: H2SO4 (conc.)
reagents.comments: for color change to dark red

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 24.4 g sodium bifluoride in 100 mL water, boil. Add 7.1 g Na2HPO4 in 100 mL water, plus 5 mL conc. H2SO4. Solution turns dark red.
Add 121 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 200 mL water, grind to dissolve fully. Slowly add 85 mL conc. H2SO4. Heat mixture until all dissolved, then add 500 mL glacial acetic acid.
procedure_steps.comments: Layered polyacid compounds form. Red precipitates.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve red precipitates in 50 mL water, boil under reduced pressure until crystals appear. Evaporate step by step, filter, and dry. Final mass 35 g.

reagent_usage.comments: Used if needed for final wash

procedure_steps.comments: Elemental analysis matches H5[PMo10V2O40]·34.5H2O. Found: P 1.34, Mo 40.68, V 4.32.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 7.1 g Na2HPO4 in 50 mL water.
Add 36.6 g metavanadic acid in 200 mL boiling water; cool to room temperature and add 5 mL conc. H2SO4 to obtain a red solution.
Add 54.5 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 150 mL water; stir vigorously.
Slowly add 85 mL conc. H2SO4.
After cooling to room temperature, add 400 mL ethanol; collect the red middle layer.
Evaporate ethanol under nitrogen, dissolve residue in 40 mL water, concentrate under vacuum until crystals form; cool and collect crystals.
Add excess concentrated ammonia to a solution of H5[PMo10V2O40]·34.5H2O until precipitation is complete.
Filter red precipitate.
Wash solid with water and dry under vacuum.

product_summary.name: (NH4)3H[PMo11VO40]·3.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Red ammonium salt obtained after vacuum drying.

procedure_steps.description: Add excess concentrated ammonia to a solution of H4[PMo11VO40]·32.5H2O to precipitate red solids.
Filter the precipitated solids.
Wash with water and dry under vacuum.

product_summary.name: (C3H5N2)3(C3H4N2)[PMo11Co8O38]·4H2O
product_summary.notes: Red crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Add 20 mL water to a beaker.
Add Co(CH3COO)2·4H2O (0.4 mmol), Na2MoO4·2H2O (0.4 mmol), NaH2PO4·12H2O (0.4 mmol) and imidazole (1.8 mmol); stir to dissolve.
Adjust pH to 3.5 with 4 M HCl.
Heat the solution to 50 °C while stirring and bubble CO2 through the mixture until a red solution forms.
Transfer the red solution to a 50 mL sealed tube.
Allow the sealed tube to stand at room temperature; slow evaporation yields red crystals.

product_summary.name: [Cu2(BTC)4/3(H2O)2]6[H2GeW12O40]·(C4H12N)2·xH2O
product_summary.notes: Blue block crystals isolated after hydrothermal synthesis

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve Cu(NO3)2·3H2O (0.24 g) and H4[GeW12O40]·nH2O (0.2 g) in 10 mL water; stir for 20 min.
Add BTC (0.21 g) and CH3NH2·HCl (0.09 g); stir 30 min.
Adjust pH to 2–3 with dilute HCl.
Transfer the mixture to a sealed autoclave and heat at 180 °C for 24 h.
Cool to room temperature to obtain blue crystalline blocks.

product_summary.name: [Cu2(BTC)4/3(H2O)2]6[HPW12O40]·(C4H12N)2·xH2O
product_summary.notes: Blue block crystals of MOF-POM composite

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve Cu(NO3)2·3H2O (0.24 g) and H3PW12O40·nH2O (0.2 g) in 10 mL water; stir 20 min.
Add BTC (0.21 g) and CH3NH2·HCl (0.09 g); stir 30 min.
Adjust pH to 2–3 with dilute HCl.
Transfer to an autoclave, heat 180 °C for 24 h.
Cool to room temperature, collect blue crystals.
Dissolve Cu(NO3)2·3H2O (0.24 g) and H4[SiMo12O40]·nH2O (0.2 g) in 10 mL water; stir 20 min.
Add BTC (0.21 g) and CH3NH2·HCl (0.09 g); stir 30 min.
Adjust pH to 2–3 with dilute HCl.
Transfer to an autoclave, heat 180 °C for 24 h.
Cool to room temperature, collect blue crystals.

product_summary.name: [Cu2(BTC)4/3(H2O)2]6[HPMo12O40]·(C4H12N)2·xH2O
product_summary.notes: Blue MOF crystals with POM inclusion

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve Cu(NO3)2·3H2O (0.24 g) and H3PMo12O40·nH2O (0.2 g) in 10 mL water; stir 20 min.
Add BTC (0.21 g) and CH3NH2·HCl (0.09 g); stir 30 min.
Adjust pH to 2–3 with dilute HCl.
Transfer to an autoclave, heat 180 °C for 24 h.
Cool to room temperature, collect blue crystals.
Dissolve 0.24 g Cu(NO3)2·3H2O and 0.20 g H3[AsMo12O40]·nH2O in 10 mL water.
Stir the blue solution for 20 min at room temperature.
Add 0.21 g BTC and 0.09 g CH3NH2·HCl.
Stir for 30 min at room temperature.
Adjust the pH of the mixture to 2–3 (acid not specified).
Transfer the mixture to a sealed Teflon reactor.
Heat at 180 °C for 24 h.
Cool the reactor to room temperature.
Collect the blue crystalline blocks by filtration.
Dissolve 0.24 g Cu(NO3)2·3H2O and 0.20 g H4[SiW12O40]·nH2O in 10 mL water.
Stir the solution for 20 min at room temperature.
Add 0.21 g BTC and 0.09 g CH3NH2·HCl.
Stir for 30 min at room temperature.
Adjust pH to 2–3 (acid source not specified).
Transfer to a sealed Teflon reactor.
Heat at 180 °C for 24 h.
Cool to room temperature.
Collect blue crystalline blocks by filtration.

product_summary.name: {[Na(dibenzo-18-crown-6)(MeCN)]3[PMo12O40]}
product_summary.notes: Blue block crystals obtained after 5-day standing

procedure_steps.description: Grind 0.36 g dibenzo-18-crown-6, 0.058 g NaCl, and 0.60 g H3[PMo12O40]·24H2O in an agate mortar for 30 min.
Add 20 mL acetonitrile to the ground mixture.
Ultrasonicate briefly to disperse the solids.
Keep the suspension in a loosely capped test tube for 5 days; blue block crystals form.
Collect the crystals by filtration and air-dry.

product_summary.name: Na14[H2Si4Nb16O56]·45.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Product prone to hydrolysis; yield varies

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.96 g NaOH in 50 mL water.
Add 1.62 g silicic acid with stirring.
Add 2.10 g Nb2O5 and stir to homogenize.
Transfer the suspension to a 100 mL Teflon-lined autoclave.
Heat at 220 °C for 5–8 h.
Cool to room temperature.
Filter to obtain reddish crystals and fine powder.
Evaporate water from basic mother liquor (pH ~13.5) and cool in a refrigerator to recrystallize purer crystals.
Dissolve 0.15 g K7H[Nb6O19]·13H2O, 0.05 g NaVO3, and 1.0 g CuSO4·H2O in 8 mL water.
Add ~10 drops ethylenediamine while stirring to maintain pH ≈ 12.3.
Transfer the mixture into a 23 mL Teflon-lined autoclave.
Heat at 110 °C for 90 h.
Cool to room temperature.
Collect purple crystals by filtration and air-dry.
Add 500 mL water to a vessel and dissolve 250 g Na2WO4·2H2O.
Slowly add 210 mL 85 % H3PO4 over 4 h with stirring; solution turns yellow.
Cool to room temperature (25 °C).
Add 100 g BaCl2, stir 10 min, and filter off Ba3(PO4)2 precipitate; repeat once more with another 100 g BaCl2.
Concentrate filtrate to ca. 250 mL and heat to 45 °C.
Allow to stand 5 days; yellow crystals of (NH4)6[β-P2W18O62] form (intermediate, 21 g).
Dissolve 21 g intermediate in 40 mL water at 45 °C and adjust pH 2 with dilute acid.
Filter the hot solution, then add 6 g KCl.
Cool slowly; collect K6[β2-P2W18O62]·19H2O crystals by filtration and air-dry.

product_summary.name: Tetrabutylammonium β2-phosphotungstate
product_summary.notes: Precipitated solid dried to constant mass

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve crude (NH4)6[β2-P2W18O62]·nH2O (0.27 g) in 10 mL water.
Add 0.18 g (n-C4H9)4NBr with stirring; precipitate forms.
Filter the solid, wash with ethanol then ether, and dry in air.
Dissolve 2 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 24 mL water at 25 °C; add 2 mL 85 % H3PO4 and stand 12 h.
Add 2 g NH4Cl; white precipitate forms. Filter and dry.
Redissolve crude solid in 7 mL water at 50 °C; rapidly add another 2 g NH4Cl, filter and dry (1.44 g mixed ammonium salt).
Dissolve portion of mixture in 30 mL water; add 0.18 g (n-C4H9)4NBr, stir.
Filter precipitate, wash with ethanol and ether, dry to give product.

product_summary.name: H6[P2W18O62]
product_summary.notes: Complex procedure with partial extraction. Possibly forms pure H6[P2W18O62] upon repeated treatments.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 200 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 1000 mL water, stir, heat. Gradually add 80 g 85% H3PO4, stir 8 hours, boil, then cool solution ~1000 mL total.
procedure_steps.comments: If solution becomes yellow, might add ammonia to adjust.

procedure_steps.description: Add 200 g NH4Cl, stir, cool, let precipitate form. Possibly reduce volume by half. Dry the precipitate.
Take 25 mL sample of the dried precipitate, add 15 mL conc. HCl and 10 mL acetic acid. Solid is extracted further; filter, dry. Repeat if needed until edges are clear.

reagent_usage.comments: No exact volumes beyond 15 mL HCl and 10 mL HOAc for 25 mL sample

procedure_steps.comments: Yields H6[P2W18O62], details not fully specified.

product_summary.name: K16[α-Si2W18O66]·25H2O
product_summary.notes: Light yellow crystals. pH ~5.7 is key.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 7.2 g K10[A-α-SiW9O34]·13H2O in 100 mL water. Add 5 mL of 1 M HCl to adjust pH to ~5.7.
Allow solution to stand for two days. Light yellow crystals of K16[α-Si2W18O66]·25H2O form, yield ~40%.
Dissolve 220 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 300 mL water.
Slowly add 150 mL 1 M H3AsO4 under stirring.
Add 100 mL 4 M HCl, heat the mixture, then cool to room temperature.
Add 50 g (NH4)2SO4 to induce precipitation (Crude A); filter (38 g). Repeat on supernatant to give Crude B (114 g).
Dissolve Crude B in 200 mL water, keep at 5 °C, then recrystallize from 125 mL hot water to obtain pure product.

product_summary.name: (NH4)6[α-As2W18O62]⋅15H2O
product_summary.notes: Conversion from γ- to α-isomer upon further treatment or aging.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 100 g Na2WO4⋅2H2O in 600 mL water, add 140 g As2O3. Stir and boil the solution for 8 hours.
Add a small amount of concentrated acetic acid and cool. Blue-green crystals may form (first precipitate). Collect and wash with water.
procedure_steps.comments: These initial crystals are by-product, not final target.

procedure_steps.description: To the remaining hot solution, add 100 g NH4Cl in portions. Then slowly pour into a hot concentrated 3:1 NH4Cl solution. Yellow solid precipitates.
Recrystallize or age the yellow γ-isomer crystals to obtain lemon-yellow (NH4)6[α-As2W18O62]⋅15H2O.
procedure_steps.comments: Final α-isomer is the stable form.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6.6 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 2.4 g Na2SO3 in 25 mL water.
Add 5 mL HCl; adjust pH to ~1.9 with H2SO4.
Reflux the mixture for 72 h.
Dissolve 6.0 g (Bu4N)Br in 200 mL water; mix with reaction liquor—yellow precipitate forms.
Filter precipitate, wash with ethanol, dry in air.
Recrystallize from acetonitrile to obtain yellow crystals.
Dissolve 11.25 g Na2WO4·2H2O (R1) in 335 mL H2O (R2); add 275 mL MeCN (R3) with stirring.
Slowly add 75 mL 18 M H2SO4 (R4).
Heat the mixture at 70 °C for 14 days.
Cool to room temperature and add 200 mL EtOAc (R5); allow phase separation and collect pale-green lower layer.
Dissolve 15.50 g [BMIM]Cl (R6) in 3 mL MeCN and add to the green layer.
Evaporate solvent; wash the solid with acetone (R7) and ether (R8) to remove residual solvent.
Recrystallize from EtOH/Et2O (1 : 1, R9 / R8) and dry to constant mass.

product_summary.name: K7[H4PW18O62]·18H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystals can be labeled K7 or K6 salt forms with different stoichiometry. IR: 1066, 1032, 979, etc.

name: Na2WO4·2H2O
reagents.comments: Method 1: 240 g (0.73 mol), Method 2: 19.8 g (0.06 mol)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 240 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 300 mL water, add 38 mL 1 M H3PO4 plus 100 mL 4 M HCl. Heat and reflux 96 hours, cool. Add 100 g KCl, plus 150 mL water, heat to 80 °C, and cool. Yellowish sediment forms: K6[H4PW18O62]·18H2O.
procedure_steps.comments: Elemental analysis: K ~5.96%, P 0.63%, W ~62%. IR, 31P NMR data given.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 19.8 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 250 mL water, slowly add 85 mL 4 M HCl, 30 mL 1 M H3PO4. Stir, reflux 60 hours. Cool, add 70 g KCl, get golden crystals (60% yield).
procedure_steps.comments: Two alternative methods to produce K7 or K6 versions, referred to as 'K6[H4PW18O62]' in text.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 330 g Na2W4O13·2H2O and 5 g As2O3 in 350 mL boiling water. After dissolution, add 140 mL conc. HCl, stir 15 minutes while boiling.
procedure_steps.comments: Allow 15 hours to stand, forming yellow crystals (sodium salt).

procedure_steps.description: For single-crystalline ammonium salt: dissolve 130 g sodium salt in 150 mL boiling water, add 100 mL 13% NH4Cl solution. Allow slow evaporation to yield yellow crystals of (NH4)7[H2AsW18O66]·16H2O.

product_summary.name: Na10[H2SbW16O60]·7H2O
product_summary.notes: Green crystals obtained after one-week evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 13.2 g Na2WO4·2H2O (R1) in 50 mL H2O (R2) and heat to 90 °C.
Prepare solution of 5 g SbCl3 (R3) in 10 mL 4 M HCl (R4); add drop-wise over 2 min.
Adjust pH to 3.6 with additional 4 M HCl (R5).
Maintain 90 °C for 10 min.
Cool to room temperature and allow slow evaporation for 7 days to grow green crystals.
Dissolve 2.0 g Na-salt (R1) in 50 mL H2O (R2) under vigorous stirring.
Add 0.6 g n-Bu4NBr (R3) dissolved in 20 mL H2O (R2) slowly; yellow precipitate forms.
Filter, wash with water (R2) and ethanol (R4), dry under vacuum.
Recrystallize from ethanol/ether (R4 / R5) to obtain pure product.
Dissolve 14.0 g TEA·HCl (R1) and 13.0 g Na2WO4·2H2O (R2) in 80 mL H2O (R3).
Add 6 mL 1 M HCl (R4) to pH 1.2.
Heat and reflux for 3 h.
Cool, filter; allow to stand 2 days to grow green crystals.
Wash crystals with ethanol (R5); dry under vacuum.
Dissolve 20 g Na2WO4·2H2O (R1) in 50 mL H2O (R2).
Add 1.0 g H5IO6 (R3) dissolved in 10 mL H2O (R2) while stirring.
Immediately adjust pH to 1 with 1 M HCl (R4).
Heat to reflux, then allow to cool to 80 °C.
At 80 °C add 15 g KCl (R5) with stirring; continue stirring for several hours until green crystals form.
Filter crystals and dry in air.
Dissolve K6[H4W18O56(IO6)]·9H2O in 50 mL water.
Add a solution of 2.5 g TPA·Br in 50 mL water.
Allow the mixture to stand until a yellow precipitate forms.
Filter the precipitate.
Wash the solid with water followed by ethanol.
Dry the washed solid under vacuum.
Recrystallize the product from ethanol/diethyl ether to obtain analytically pure (TPA)6[H3W18O56(IO6)].
Dissolve Na2WO4·2H2O (10 g) and TEA·HCl (7 g) in 20 mL water.
Add 0.5 g H5IO6 dissolved in 5 mL water.
Adjust pH to 3 with 6 M HCl.
Heat the mixture under reflux for 0.5 h.
Evaporate to half its volume.
Allow to stand at room temperature for 3 days to form pale-green crystals.
Collect the crystals by filtration.
Recrystallize the product from a small amount of ethanol.
Dissolve 100 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 450 mL water.
Add 15 mL 85 % H3PO4 and 80 mL conc. HNO3.
Boil under reflux.
Slowly add 100 g NH4Cl while stirring until a yellow precipitate appears.
Filter the precipitate and wash with water followed by acetone.
Dissolve the crystals in water and adjust pH to 7 using NH4OH.
Store solution in a refrigerator overnight to crystallise.
Filter and collect the yellow crystals.

product_summary.name: H6[P2Mo18O62]·23.4H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow crystals obtained via acidification method

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 50 g (NH4)6[P2Mo18O62]·14H2O in 100 mL water.
Add 60 mL conc. HCl and 60 mL acetic acid to the solution.
Add butanol (1/4 total volume) to the mixture.
Cover and evaporate at room temperature until a yellow precipitate appears.
Dissolve the precipitate in cold water.
Place the solution in a vacuum desiccator to crystallise H6[P2Mo18O62]·23.4H2O.
Dissolve 0.91 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 0.07 g Na2HPO4 in 50 mL water (Solution A).
Adjust Solution A to pH 1 with 1 M HCl.
Dissolve 0.5 mL tert-butylamine in 50 mL water, adjust pH with HCl (Solution B).
Combine Solution A and Solution B, then add 2 mL diethyl ether.
Allow to stand; yellow crystals form in 4 days.
Filter and collect the crystals.
Dissolve 0.36 g Na2HPO4 in 3.65 mL 1 M HCl to obtain Solution A.
Dissolve 5.43 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 10 mL water (Solution B).
Slowly add Solution A into Solution B under stirring to obtain a yellow solution followed by precipitation.
Add 0.43 g tert-butylamine hydrochloride dissolved in 3 mL water, adjust pH to 3.
Filter the mixture.
Let the filtrate stand; yellow crystals appear in 2 weeks.
Air-dry the crystals to obtain yellow powder.
Dissolve 85 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 7 g As2O5 in 350 mL water with stirring until a clear solution is obtained (over several days).
Add acetic acid drop-wise until the pH stabilises.
Heat the solution at 80 °C for 6 h.
Cool to room temperature and filter to remove any solids.
Extract the filtrate twice with diethyl ether (1 : 1 v/v with aqueous H2SO4).
Remove residual acid under reduced pressure and dry under vacuum (over P2O5).
Allow the concentrate to stand for 3 days; yellow crystals form.
Wash the crystals with ice-cold water and dry.

product_summary.name: [BMIM]4[α-S2Mo18O56]
product_summary.notes: Purple solid after evaporation and washing.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6.23 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 20 mL water, add 4.96 mL 18 M H2SO4 and 100 mL CH3CN. Cool, filter violet solution, add 10.0 g [BMIM]Cl in 5 mL CH3CN. Evaporate to dryness, wash purple solid with ethanol & ether. Dry.
Dissolve 11 g TEA in 100 mL water.
Add 10 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 1 g Na2SO3 while stirring.
Adjust pH to 4.0 with HCl, stir and filter.
Store the filtrate at 4 °C for 3 days to grow dark-green crystals.
Collect the crystals by filtration and air-dry.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)4[Mo18O54(SO3)2]·C2H3N
product_summary.notes: Yellow-brown solid obtained after ether washing

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 4.8 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 0.30 g Na2SO3 in 80 mL water.
Add 10 mL concentrated H2SO4 with stirring.
Introduce 2.5 g n-Bu4NBr in 50 mL water; a yellow-brown solid precipitates.
Filter the solid and wash with diethyl ether.
Dry the product under vacuum.
Dissolve 1.5 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 1.5 g TEA in 25 mL hot water.
Add 0.08 g NH4VO3 and adjust pH to 1 with conc. HCl.
Reflux the solution for 2 h.
Cool and leave undisturbed for several days; dark-green crystals form.
Filter the crystals and air-dry.

product_summary.name: K10[α2-P2W17O61]⋅20H2O
product_summary.notes: pH range for stability is 2–6. 31P NMR: -7.1, -13.6 ppm peaks. IR: 1084, 1050, 1012 cm^-1.

procedure_steps.description: Mix 80 g K6[α or β-P2W18O62] solution (1.15*10^-2 mol) with 200 mL water. Add 20 g KHCO3 (0.2 mol), stir completely. A white precipitate forms, dissolve again in 500 mL boiling water (95 °C), then cool for 3 hours. White crystals form. Air dry 2–3 days to get 57 g product (70% yield).
procedure_steps.comments: K10[α2-P2W17O61]·20H2O. IR and NMR data available.

product_summary.name: K9[α1-LiP2W17O61]·20H2O
product_summary.notes: White powder obtained by ethanol recrystallisation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 21.2 g LiOAc in 500 mL hot water and add 10 mL 1 M HCl; stir for 10 min.
Add 40 g K12[H2P2W18O62]·24H2O; stir for 2–3 min.
Add 50 mL 1 M LiCl, 4.8 g LiOH and 23.2 g WO3 while stirring until mostly dissolved.
Adjust pH to 4–5 with 1 M HCl, add 200 mL water and solid KCl; a white precipitate forms in 3–5 min.
Filter, wash the solid with ethanol and dry in air.
Recrystallize from ethanol to obtain pure product.

product_summary.name: (n-C4H9N)6H4[α1-P2W17O61]
product_summary.notes: Precipitate forms quickly upon TBA, mild acid addition.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.0 g K9Li[α1-P2W17O61] in 25 mL water (yellow solution). Add 750 mg (TBA)Br in 10 mL water. Then add 0.1 mL 1 M HAc, filter out white precipitate. Yield 1.05 g, 93%.

product_summary.name: K10[α2-P2Mo17O61]·20H2O
product_summary.notes: pH carefully controlled, series of washes in slightly acidic water, then vacuum dryness.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 40–50 g K6[α/β-P2Mo18O62]·xH2O in 100 mL water, set pH=2.4 with NaAc, stir 90 min, keep final pH 3.8–4.0. Add 25 g KCl, decant with 3.8 N water, wash 3 times, then place in distilled water twice, vacuum dry.

product_summary.name: Sodium α2-pentadecatungstophosphate
product_summary.notes: White solid, almost insoluble in water

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 38.5 g K6[P2W18O62]·xH2O in 125 mL water.
Add 35 g NaClO4·H2O and stir vigorously 20 min.
Place mixture in ice-bath, then filter off KCl precipitate.
Pour filtrate into 100 mL water containing 10.6 g Na2CO3.
Add 25 mL water, stand 1–2 min, then filter and dry the solid.
Wash product with 25 mL ethanol for 3 h and 25 mL ether for 3 min.
Vacuum-dry to constant mass (white powder).
Dissolve 200 g precursor in 50 mL hot water, then cool.
Add 15 g NaClO4 followed immediately by excess KClO4 to precipitate KCl.
Add 1 M Na2CO3 to pH 9.0 drop-wise.
Filter the precipitate, wash with ethanol and acetone, dry.

product_summary.name: Potassium hydrogen vanadophosphotungstate
product_summary.notes: Crimson to yellow crystals dried at 60 °C

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 32.8 mmol HVO3 in 700 mL hot water; cool to room temperature.
Add 16 mL 6 M HCl to obtain grey-yellow solution.
Slowly add 46 g Na12[P2W15O56]·18H2O; solution turns crimson, stir 10 min.
Add 100 g KCl; adjust pH to 1.5 with additional 75 mL hot 6 M HCl; crystallize overnight.
Filter crystals and dry at 60 °C.
Add 0.95 g of V2O5 to 175 mL of water in an ice bath until the mixture warms to room temperature.
Add 4 mL of 6 M HCl solution while stirring rapidly.
procedure_steps.comments: Acidify the solution to facilitate reaction.

procedure_steps.description: Slowly add 11 g of Na12[α-P2W15O56]·18H2O.
procedure_steps.comments: Added slowly to control pH and avoid precipitation at this stage.

procedure_steps.description: Stir the mixture for 10 minutes.
Add 8 g of solid TMACl (tetramethylammonium chloride).
Filter the final precipitate. The pH is about 1.5 and total solution volume is ~400 mL.
Heat the filtrate to induce further precipitation.
procedure_steps.comments: Temperature not specified, presumably near boiling.

procedure_steps.description: Filter again to collect additional precipitate formed upon heating.
Dissolve 35 g precursor in 200 mL pH 1.5 aqueous medium; separately dissolve 25 g n-Bu4NBr in 200 mL pH 1.5 water.
Combine the two solutions (pH 1.4–1.6) and add 200 mL hot DMF plus 1.8 g Amberlyst 15; stir, then filter off resin.
Reduce solvent volume to ~50 mL under stirring.
Pour suspension into 1 L pH 1.5 solution, stir 1 h.
Stir final mixture at 50 °C for 5 days to complete ion exchange.
Filter, wash and dry product.
Dissolve 83 g precursor in 300 mL water.
Add 48.4 g Tris in 200 mL water, stir 30 min.
Add 80 g KCl until dissolved; then add 55.3 g K2CO3, stir 15 min.
Extract precipitate, dry at 120 °C to constant weight.

name: Li5.5K3H3.5[P2W12O56(NbO2)]·H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow precipitate. Product obtained after frozen condensation.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 12.15 g K12H2[α2-P2W12O48] in 450 mL of a mixed solution containing K7H[Nb6O19], H2O2 (0.5 mol·L^-1), LiCl (1 mol·L^-1), and HCl (4 mol·L^-1).
procedure_steps.comments: Solution heated and pH adjusted to ~0.85 eventually.

procedure_steps.description: Add 15 mL of 4 mol·L^-1 HCl, adjust pH to 0.85.
Add 15 g of KCl, stir for 5 minutes.
Add 5 mL of 11.6 mol·L^-1 H2O2, then filter under suction.
procedure_steps.comments: Second addition of strong H2O2 solution.

procedure_steps.description: Add 3 g CsCl to the filtrate, yielding a yellow precipitate upon condensation and freezing.
procedure_steps.comments: Final product forms as reaction product is concentrated.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6 g of K4H4PW17O62·18H2O in 20 mL of water.
Slowly add 17 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 KHCO3 to the solution while stirring.
Filter the mixture and dry the product.

product_summary.name: Potassium-lithium octadecatungstophosphate
product_summary.notes: White needle-like crystals stable at pH 1–8

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve AcOH, LiOH, LiCl and 28 g K12[H2P2W12O48]·24H2O in 950 mL water.
Seal bottle and stand 1 day; white needle crystals appear.
Continue crystallization one week.
Filter and air-dry crystals 3 days.

product_summary.name: (NH4)14[NaP5W30O110]·31 H2O
product_summary.notes: White powder after drying at RT

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 50 g Na2WO4·2H2O (R1) in 60 mL H2O (R5); add 80 g conc. HCl (R2) with stirring (solution turns yellow).
Filter the mixture to remove solids.
Oxidize the clear solution with 1 mL conc. HNO3 (R3).
Cool to 60 °C and add 50 g NH4Cl (R4); cool, filter yellow precipitate (discard).
Boil 150 mL filtrate; hot-filter to remove white solid.
After cooling, add 40 g NH4Cl (R4) and filter white precipitate.
Dissolve white precipitate in 140 mL boiling water (R5); filter hot.
Let filtrate evaporate slowly at room temperature for several days to give white needles.
Dissolve 3.0 g Na2WO4·2H2O (R1) in 50 mL 1 M H2SO4 (R2).
Sequentially add 1.0 g H2WO4 (R3), 1.0 g Ce(NO3)3·6H2O (R4) and 0.6 g KCl (R5); stir 10 min.
Continue stirring with heating for 3 h.
Cool and allow slow evaporation (~2 months) to yield yellow block crystals.
Dissolve 2.20 g K8[Ta6O19]·17H2O (R1) in 12 mL 30 % H2O2 (R2) + 160 mL H2O (R3); boil to decompose peroxo groups.
Add 14 mL 1 M HCl (R4) followed immediately by 0.50 g Na12[P2W15O59]·18H2O (R5); stir at 45 °C.
Cool to room temperature and filter.
Add 7 g KCl (R6) to filtrate; after yellow precipitate appears add further 25 g KCl, stir 40 min.
Collect yellow crystals by filtration; wash with 12 mL water and 12 mL EtOH (R7); dry at RT.
Dissolve 1.0 g precursor (R1) in 20 mL 0.5 M HCl (R2); stir 5 h.
Filter to remove insoluble material.
Allow the filtrate to evaporate slowly at room temperature to obtain crystalline product.
Dissolve 50 g K6[α-As2W18O62]·14H2O in 180 mL warm water.
Add 45 g NaClO4. A white precipitate of KClO4 forms. Filter off the solid.
To the filtrate, gradually add 1 mol·L^-1 Na2CO3 solution until pH ~ 9. A white precipitate forms.
Collect and rinse the white precipitate with 95% ethanol and ether. Dry for 2 days to get Na12[As2W15O56]·21H2O.

product_summary.name: K14[As2W19O66(H2O)]
product_summary.notes: Yellow solution formed upon second KCl addition, then dried product.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.89 g As2O3, 18.8 g Na2WO4·2H2O, and 0.67 g KCl in 50 mL boiling water.
Add 12 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 HCl to adjust pH to 6.3. Keep at 80 °C for 10 minutes.
Filter the hot solution. Add 15 g KCl, stir 15 minutes, forming a yellow solution. Filter again and dry at 80 °C.

product_summary.name: (NH4)7[H4P2W18O62]·16H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow single crystals formed upon slow evaporation in presence of NH4Cl.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 330 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 5.5 g As2O3 in 350 mL water, boil, add 140 mL concentrated HCl, continue boiling 15 minutes. Yellow crystallites form.
For single crystal measurement, dissolve 130 g sodium salt in 150 mL water. Add 100 mL 13% NH4Cl solution. Slowly crystallize to get (NH4)7[H4P2W18O62]·16H2O as yellow crystals.

product_summary.name: K10[As2W20O68(H2O)]·nH2O
product_summary.notes: Likely white or yellowish product after adjusting pH with KHCO3.

procedure_steps.description: Mix 66 g Na6[As4W32O103] in 400 mL water, add 12 mL 1 mol·L^-1 HCl, boil for 15 min, add KHCO3 to adjust pH (details not fully given). Cool, filter, dry.
procedure_steps.comments: Method incomplete, final dryness yields K10[As2W20O68(H2O)]·nH2O.

procedure_steps.description: Mix 66 g Na2WO4·2H2O (R1) and 1.9 g As2O3 (R2) in 70 mL boiling H2O (R3); continue boiling (yellow precipitate forms).
Allow mixture to stand 1 day; collect yellow crystals (25–28 g).
Dissolve crystals in 20 mL water plus 5 mL HCl (R4); extract impurities with 10 mL EtOAc (R5) twice, separate aqueous phase.
Remove EtOAc by heating; evaporate aqueous layer to obtain 15 g yellow crystals.

apparatus.notes: Warm water bath at room temperature

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g H6[As2W21O69(H2O)]·nH2O in 2 mL water  [oai_citation:0‡SYN203.txt](file-service://file-7FZRf6niwaxE9ZXJwYEozg)
Add 1 g RbCl to the solution
Stir the mixture in a warm water bath at room temperature until a yellow solution forms
Add 40 mL of 0.25 M HCl pre-heated to 60 °C to induce reprecipitation
Cool the solution and allow it to stand until crystallisation occurs (2 days)
Dry the crystalline product in an oven at 60 °C
Collect the product after 6 days total growth time

characterization.comments: Calculated vs. found values for H2Rb4[As2W21O69(H2O)]·34H2O

product_summary.name: H2Rb4[As2W21O69(H2O)]·34H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow crystals obtained after successive recrystallisations

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1 mol Na2WO4·2H2O and 0.5 mol arsenate in 350 mL boiling water  [oai_citation:1‡SYN203.txt](file-service://file-7FZRf6niwaxE9ZXJwYEozg)
Stir the hot solution briefly to ensure complete dissolution
Add 20 mL glacial acetic acid
Allow the mixture to stand for 24 h to yield yellow crystals mixed with white powder
Dissolve the crude crystals in 3 M HCl under poor light (1:1)
Recrystallise the solution
Add ether to form two liquid layers
Recrystallise again from 1 M HCl solution to obtain the final product

product_summary.name: Na27[NaAs4W40O140]·60H2O
product_summary.notes: Na27[NaAs4W40O140]·60H2O forms as a white precipitate after 2-day reaction.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 132 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 5.2 g NaAsO4 in 200 mL water, then add 82 mL 6 mol·L^-1 HCl at 80°C. Stir for two days. pH rises to ~4. White solids form on cooling, filter, yield 80 g (69%).

characterization.comments: White powder, soluble in water. Stable at pH 4–7.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 30 g Na2[NaAs4W40O140]·60H2O in 200 mL water, then add 5 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 Co(NO3)2 solution. Stir 10 minutes.
Add 10 g NH4Cl, filter, wash precipitate with 200 mL fresh water. Redissolve in another 10 g NH4Cl. Filter to get final green product.

characterization.comments: Green crystalline solid stable at pH 4–7.

name: Acetic acid
CH3CO2H
reagents.comments: 3 mL added every 30 min during addition plus a final 25 mL portion

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 18.7 g Sb2O3 in 50 mL concentrated acid to give solution A.
Dissolve 99 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 120 mL de-ionized water at 80 °C to give solution B.
Gradually add solution A to hot solution B with vigorous stirring; simultaneously add 3 mL acetic acid every 30 min.
procedure_steps.comments: Dropwise addition of Sb solution; total acetic acid volume not specified

procedure_steps.description: Filter while hot to remove any insoluble matter and obtain a clear filtrate.
Cool the filtrate slightly and add a final 25 mL acetic acid.
Collect the dark-yellow precipitate by filtration.
Wash the precipitate with 200 mL de-ionized water; collect the washings as solution C.
Cool 60 mL of the acidic filtrate to 8 °C.
Slowly add 60 mL of solution C to the cooled filtrate.
Filter the resulting dark-yellow powder.
Air-dry the powder to constant mass.

characterization.comments: Additional water and nitrate bands present at 3400–1405 cm-1

product_summary.name: Na4(NH4)2[α2-H2VW17O54(VO4)2]
product_summary.notes: Purple crystalline solid after 5 days evaporation.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.36 g Na2WO4·2H2O (4.1 mmol) and 1.3 g NH2OH·HCl (18.8 mmol) in 10 mL water, forming white precipitate after 2 min.
Add 0.2 g NH4VO3 (1.7 mmol), stir, then add 3 mL 37% HCl to adjust pH to 3.8.
Transfer mixture to a 160 °C reaction kettle for 3 days. Cool, then allow slow evaporation for 5 days, forming purple crystals.

product_summary.name: (TEAH)6[α2-H2VMo17O54(VO4)2]
product_summary.notes: Green crystalline solid after 5 days air dry.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.3 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 1.6 g TEA in 12 mL water, forming a white precipitate after 2 min.
Add 0.2 g NH4VO3. Then add 3 mL 37% HCl to adjust pH to 2.2.
Transfer mixture to a 160 °C reaction kettle for 3 days. Cool, wash, and air dry for 5 days. Green crystalline solid obtained.

product_summary.name: [Gd(H2O)3]3[GdMo12O42]·3H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorful crystals from hydrothermal reaction at pH ~0.8

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve GdCl3 (0.55 mmol in 6 mL 35% HCl) and 0.18 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O (0.146 mmol) in 18 mL water. pH ~0.8.
Subject mixture to hydrothermal synthesis at 170°C for 5 days. Cool. Colorful crystals obtained.
Method 2: Dissolve 6 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O (4.85 mmol) in 50 mL water, boil, add 0.391 g Ce(SO4)2·4H2O (0.94 mmol), boil 15 min, then cool by evaporation. Add 0.8 g NH4NO3, filter clear solution.
Dissolve yellow product in 30 mL 0.2 mol·L^-1 H2SO4. Recrystallize, then dissolve in 20 g NH4NO3 + 10 mL water. After ~48 hours, (NH4)6[H2CeMo12O42]·9H2O forms, ~1.058 g, ~50% yield.

product_summary.name: [Li(H2O)4]2Co(H2O)4Ce(H2O)3[CeMo12O42]·3H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow crystals from multi-ion combination at moderate temperature.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.854 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in 70 mL water at 90°C, cool slightly. Dissolve 5.480 g (NH4)2Ce(NO3)6 in 20 mL water by heating, combine solutions at 65°C.
Gradually add 3 mL 6 M H2SO4 while stirring 30 min at 65°C. Then add 1.1897 g CoCl2·6H2O and 0.6398 g Li2SO4·H2O. Keep reaction at 80°C, then cool to RT.
Obtain yellow crystals after separation and partial evaporation. The product is [Li(H2O)4]2Co(H2O)4Ce(H2O)3[CeMo12O42]·3H2O.
procedure_steps.comments: Elemental analysis: Li 0.61, Co 2.44, Ce 11.13, Mo 45.98

procedure_steps.description: Add 1.854 g of (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O to 40 mL of water and stir until dissolved.
Stir the solution until clear.
Heat the solution to 90 °C to complete dissolution, then cool to room temperature.
Add 0.5480 g of (NH4)2Ce(NO3)6 dissolved in 20 mL water to the cooled solution.
Heat the combined solution to 65 °C.
Gradually add 3 mL of 6 M H2SO4 over 30 min while maintaining 65 °C and stirring.
Gradually add 1.1885 g NiCl2·6H2O.
Gradually add 0.6398 g Li2SO4·H2O.
Stir and maintain the reaction at 80 °C (duration not specified).
Cool the reaction mixture to room temperature.
Filter to collect yellow crystals.

characterization.comments: Elemental analysis compared to theoretical values

procedure_steps.description: Add 1.854 g of (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O to 40 mL of water and stir until dissolved.
Heat to 90 °C to dissolve, then cool to room temperature.
Add 0.5480 g of (NH4)2Ce(NO3)6 dissolved in 20 mL water.
Heat the combined solution to 65 °C.
Gradually add 3 mL of 6 M H2SO4 over 30 min while maintaining temperature.
Gradually add 0.6398 g Li2SO4·H2O.
Stir and maintain the reaction at 80 °C.
Cool to room temperature.
Filter to collect yellow crystals.

characterization.comments: Elemental analysis compared to theoretical values

product_summary.name: (NH4)3[AlMo6O24H6]·7H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystalline product forms upon cooling of the filtrate.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in 80 mL boiling water.
Add 20 mL Al(III) sulfate solution (3.1 mmol) dropwise into the boiling mixture.
Filter the hot solution, concentrate the filtrate, and cool to ambient temperature to obtain the product.

product_summary.name: (NH4)3[FeMo6O24H6]·7H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystalline product forms upon cooling of the filtrate.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in 80 mL boiling water.
Add 20 mL Fe(III) sulfate solution (3.1 mmol) dropwise into the boiling mixture.
Filter the hot solution, concentrate the filtrate, and cool to ambient temperature to obtain the product.

product_summary.name: (NH4)3[CrMo6O24H6]·7H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystalline product forms upon cooling of the filtrate.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in 80 mL boiling water.
Add 20 mL Cr(III) sulfate solution (3.1 mmol) dropwise into the boiling mixture.
Filter the hot solution, concentrate the filtrate, and cool to ambient temperature to obtain the product.

product_summary.name: (NH4)4[CoMo6O24H6]·7H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystalline product forms upon concentration and cooling.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 30.9 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O (25.5 mmol) in 260 mL boiling water.
Add 4.2 g CoSO4·7H2O (0.015 mol) and 2 g H2O2 in 30 mL water. Boil until dissolved, filter, concentrate the solution to obtain the crystalline product.

product_summary.name: (NH4)4[ZnMo6O24H6]·5H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals formed upon mixing with Zn2⁺ source.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g of (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in 80 mL boiling water.
Dissolve ZnSO4·5H2O (3 mmol) in 20 mL water. Add to the boiling solution to obtain a colorless crystalline product.

product_summary.name: (NH4)4[NiMo6O24H6]·5H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals formed upon mixing with Ni2⁺ source.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g of (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in 80 mL boiling water.
Dissolve NiSO4·5H2O (3 mmol) in 20 mL water. Add to the boiling solution to obtain a colorless crystalline product.

product_summary.name: (NH4)3[CuMo6O24H6]·5H2O
product_summary.notes: Pale yellow precipitate forms with excess acetone.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.75 g CuSO4 in 20 mL water (3 mmol). Dissolve 5 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O (4.2 mmol) in 80 mL boiling water. Mix to get a yellow precipitate.
Add excess acetone to obtain a pale yellow precipitate.
Dissolve 0.75 g MnSO4 in 20 mL water.
Add 5 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O to 80 mL boiling water to form a yellow suspension.
Combine the MnSO4 solution with the boiling molybdate suspension; maintain near-boiling for a few minutes.
Add excess acetone to the hot mixture to precipitate a pale-yellow solid.
Filter the precipitate.
Dry the solid to constant weight.
Dissolve 0.75 g CoSO4 in 20 mL water.
Add 5 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O to 80 mL boiling water to obtain a yellow suspension.
Combine the CoSO4 solution with the boiling molybdate suspension.
Add excess acetone to precipitate a pale-yellow solid.
Filter and collect the precipitate.
Dry to obtain the product.
Dissolve NiSO4·5H2O in water to form a solution.
Heat the other reagents in water to boiling (depending on x, use (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O, Na2MoO4·2H2O, MoO3, Na2WO4·2H2O).
Add the boiling reagent solution to the NiSO4 solution to form the final complex.
Dissolve a molar ratio of (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O and H6TeO6 in water.
Dissolve 21.59g of MoO3 and 5.74g of Te(OH)6 in 1mol·L-1 HCl solution.
Heat to 85 °C for 1 hour.
Add 75mL of red precipitate to the solution.
procedure_steps.comments: Text unclear; possibly a red suspension/solid.

procedure_steps.description: Stir the reaction mixture and allow to cool to 25 °C.
Filter the cooled mixture to obtain the crystalline product.
Wash the crystals with ethanol and water.
Dry the final product in a drying oven.

name: K-containing salt
reagents.comments: Not explicitly specified in text; implied similar method.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve the K source, Mo source, and H6TeO6 in water, using a method similar to the (NH4)6 compound synthesis.
procedure_steps.comments: Details not provided; same approach as (NH4)6[TeMo6O24]·7H2O

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 20 mL 2 M H2SO4 to give solution A.
To 80 mL 2 M H2SO4 (solution B) at 60 °C, add 1 mL 35 % H2O2; allow to react 2–3 h while maintaining 60 °C.
Pour solution A into solution B at 60 °C with stirring; maintain temperature until the color turns reddish-orange.
Add 0.65 g NaAsO2 to the reddish solution.
Add KOH gradually until pH 2 is reached (solution darkens).
Add 1 g CsCl and continue stirring for several hours to grow yellow crystals.
Filter the yellow crystals.
To a solution of 1.35 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in water, add 0.4 mol·L-1 HCl solution and 0.2 g NaIO4.
Reflux the mixture for 1 hour.
Slowly add 0.62 mL of 12 mol·L-1 HCl solution and maintain at 85 °C.
Cool the solution to 25 °C.
Filter the solution, then dry at 85 °C for 12 hours.
Dissolve 145 g of Na2MoO4·4H2O in 300 mL of water.
Adjust the pH of the solution to 4.5 with HNO3.
Add 40 g of Cr(NO3)3·9H2O dissolved in 40 mL water to the mixture.
Reflux (boil) the mixture for 5 minutes.
Filter while hot.
Evaporate the filtrate to about 1500 mL, then continue evaporation until a syrup consistency.
Place the solution in a flat container and let it crystallize for one week.
Transfer the product onto a water filter and clean with ethanol.

product_summary.name: [(H2O)4Ag3][Cr(OH)6Mo6O18]·3H2O
product_summary.notes: Purple crystals obtained after prolonged drying

procedure_steps.description: Add 1 mmol of Na3[CrMo6H6O24]·8H2O solution to 20 mL of water.
Add 1 mmol of AgNO3 solution and heat to 80 °C for 2 hours.
Cool the mixture and filter.
Vacuum dry the filtrate. Purple crystals form in three weeks.
Dissolve 1.5 g AlCl3·2H2O in 25 mL water and add 10 mL glacial acetic acid with stirring until clear.
Add 3.5 g Na2MoO4·4H2O dissolved separately (volume not specified) to the above solution.
Adjust the pH of the mixed solution to 1.8 using 35 % HCl.
Allow the solution to crystallize undisturbed at 20 – 22 °C for 1 week.
Filter off white crystals.
Wash the crystals with water followed by ethanol.
Vacuum-dry the washed product.
Dissolve 12 g Na2MoO4·4H2O in 40 mL of water.
Adjust the pH of the solution to 1.84 with HCl.
Add 0.604 g FeSO4; the solution changes color to dark blue.
Allow the solution to react at ambient temperature for one month to form brown crystals.
Wash the product with ethanol and ether.
Dry the final product in air.

characterization.comments: Some conflicting intensities reported for 935 cm^-1

product_summary.name: (H3O)3[Co(OH)6Mo6O18]·7H2O
product_summary.notes: Green crystals formed over three weeks

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.9 g H2MoO4 and 0.13 g Co(Ac)2·7H2O to 20 mL water.
Add 0.5 mL of H2O2 to the mixture.
Heat the solution near boiling for a few minutes.
Let the solution stand at room temperature for 3 weeks to obtain green crystals.

name: (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O
reagents.comments: Text states 0.20 mmol, likely an error

name: NH4OH
reagents.comments: Used to adjust to a light yellow solid

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 24.72 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in 150 mL water.
Add 4.76 g CoCl2·6H2O in 100 mL water plus 2 g NH4Cl to form a pink solution (pH 4.0–4.5).
Place the mixture in an ice bath, gradually adjust with ammonia to obtain a light yellow solid.
Air dry to obtain ~14.03 g of light yellow solid (60% yield).
Dissolve 5 g CoSO4·7H2O in 30 mL water, add 2 g H2O2 (30%) to make solution A.
Dissolve 30 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in 260 mL water to make solution B (~0.09 mol·L-1).
Add solution B to the boiling solution A, and continue adding H2O2 dropwise while evaporating.
Cool the mixture and filter to obtain green crystals at ~80 °C, then recrystallize.
Add 1.20 g H2MoO4, 0.86 g MnCl2, and 0.36 g MnSO4·H2O to 20 mL of water.
Add 0.3 mL H2O2, heat to 80 °C for 30 minutes.
Cool to room temperature and let stand for 3 days to obtain a red solid.
Dissolve 20 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 100 mL water and heat to boil.
procedure_steps.comments: Text mentions final product with NiMo6, but original references W. Possibly an error or partial substitution.

procedure_steps.description: Add 2.6 g NiSO4·6H2O in 10 mL water to the boiling mixture.
Slowly add 5.4 g K2S2O8 powder, keep boiling for 15 minutes.
Transfer to a steam bath at ~80 °C for 30 minutes; a yellow-green solid forms.
Filter the solid, wash with water, and dry to obtain 2.5 g product (hygroscopic).
Dissolve 0.25 g (NH4)6Mo7O24 and 0.7 g Ga(NO3)3 in a 10 mL H2O / 1 mL MeOH mixture.
Add 0.45 g N-benzyl-N-methylbutylamine with stirring until the solution is homogeneous.
Introduce an additional 2 mL methanol and mix thoroughly.
Filter to remove any insoluble matter.
Allow the clear filtrate to evaporate slowly at room temperature for 9 days to yield colorless block crystals.
At 95 °C, add MnSO4 and excess sulfate to a 10% (NH4)6Mo7O24 solution, stir for 5 minutes.
Rapidly cool the mixture and filter.
Allow crystallization in hot water at 70 °C to obtain deep red H6[MnMo9O32] crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Also reported as H6[MnMn4Mo6O32] in text

product_summary.name: H6[MnMn4Mo6O32]
product_summary.notes: Deep red crystals; used as an intermediate for ion exchange

procedure_steps.description: At 95 °C, add MnSO4 and excess sulfate to the 10% (NH4)6Mo7O24 solution while stirring.
Rapidly cool the mixture, then filter.
Allow crystallization in hot water at 70 °C to obtain deep red H6[MnMn4Mo6O32] crystals.

product_summary.name: Na6[MnMo9O32]
product_summary.notes: Deep-red crystals; product identity ambiguous in text

procedure_steps.description: Heat the 10 % (NH4)6Mo7O24 solution to 95 °C.
Add MnSO4 and excess sulfate to the hot solution.
Stir continuously for 5 min.
Rapidly cool the mixture.
Filter the cooled mixture.
Allow crystallization in hot water at 70 °C to obtain deep-red crystals.
Set pH = 4.5 with acetic acid/potassium hydroxide buffer, then add 0.5 mol·L-1 KMnO4 solution.
Add MnSO4 and Na2MoO4 solutions in a 1:2 molar ratio at 40 °C; total reaction time ~4 hours.
Filter the red reaction mixture and let it crystallize for 3 days.

name: Na2SO4 solution
reagents.comments: pH adjusted to 2 with 0.5 mol·L-1 H2SO4

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.823 g (NH4)6[MnMo6O24]·6H2O in 25 mL of Na2SO4 solution at pH 2.
Add 4 mL of the mixed solution and stir at 80 °C for 8 hours.
procedure_steps.comments: Identity of the 'mixed solution' not specified

procedure_steps.description: Filter the hot solution and evaporate the filtrate at room temperature for ~2 weeks.
Prepare separate solutions: one containing 2.5 mmol KMnO4, another containing 1.6 mmol (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O. Keep them cold in an ice bath.
Under ice bath conditions, add 2 mol·L-1 HNO3 solution to the mixed solutions while stirring.
Combine the solutions and heat to 55 °C, then filter.
procedure_steps.comments: Filtrate is left to evaporate at room temperature

procedure_steps.description: Allow the solution to evaporate at room temperature for crystallization.
Dissolve 0.6132 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in 50 mL of boiling water, then cool the solution and add 10 mL of ice water.
Add 0.5014 g MnSO4·H2O and 0.5790 g K2S2O8 solid. Boil until the solution turns reddish.
Filter while hot, then let the filtrate evaporate at room temperature. Red crystals appear overnight.
Dissolve 12.4 g (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O in boiling water, then adjust pH to 4–6 with H2SO4.
Add 11.8 g MnSO4·H2O and heat to dissolve. Slowly add 4.56 g (NH4)2S2O8 solid while stirring.
Filter, maintain at 80 °C for half an hour, then slowly evaporate at room temperature.

product_summary.name: (NH4)2Na2[Cu(H2O)4][MnMo9O32]·5H2O
product_summary.notes: Orange block crystals obtained after two-week crystallization.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.823 g (NH4)6[MnMo9O32]·6H2O in 25 mL saturated Na2SO4 solution.
Adjust the solution pH to 4 using 0.5 M H2SO4.
Drop-wise add 5 mL aqueous solution containing 0.170 g CuCl2·2H2O (1 mmol).
Stir the orange-yellow solution at 80 °C for 2 h.
Filter the hot mixture and collect the clear filtrate.
Allow the filtrate to stand at room temperature (~22 °C) for 14 days to grow crystals.

product_summary.name: (Zn(H2O)3)3[L/D-MnMo9O32]⋅4H2O
product_summary.notes: Red crystals of mixed L/D isomers

name: Water
reagents.comments: Initial dissolution at 80 °C; 10 mL used for ZnCl2 solution

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.5 g of K3(NH4)3[MnMo6O32] in 40 mL of water at 80 °C.
Add 1 mol·L-1 HCl solution to adjust the pH to about 3.0.
Dissolve 2.7310 g ZnCl2·2H2O in 10 mL water, add dropwise at 80 °C.
Cool the mixture to room temperature and allow slow evaporation.
Dissolve 5 g of K3(NH4)6[MnMo6O32]·8H2O in water, pass through an H-type Dowex-50W resin column to remove K+ and NH4+ and replace them with tetrabutylammonium cations.
Concentrate the resulting solution for a short time.
Add 9.75 g tetrabutylammonium chloride and 25 g KCl to the concentrated solution.
Collect the pink crystals, wash, and air dry.
Dissolve 2.5 g (NH4)6Mo7O24 in water.
Add 0.4 g MnO2 to the solution, then adjust pH to 6.0 with dilute acid.
procedure_steps.comments: React for several hours; solution becomes bright red

procedure_steps.description: Cool to room temperature; red crystals precipitate slowly.

characterization.comments: Formula also given as [H3NNH3]2 K2[MnMo6O32] ⋅ (NH4) ⋅ 3H2O in text, possible discrepancy

product_summary.name: (Himi)6[MnMo9O32]
product_summary.notes: Red crystals obtained after slow evaporation.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.5311 g K3(NH4)3[MnMo9O32] in 50 mL water at 80 °C.
Add 0.6803 g imidazole and stir until dissolved.
Adjust pH to 3.0 with 2 M HCl.
Maintain the mixture at 80 °C for 2 h.
Cool, filter, and collect the solution.
Allow slow evaporation at room temperature to yield red crystals.
Dissolve 0.5306 g K6(NH4)2[MnMo6O19] in 50 mL of 0.5 mol·L-1 Na2SO4 solution with stirring.
Add 0.681 g 4-imidazolecarboxylic acid and 2 mL of 1 mol·L-1 HCl to adjust pH to 3.0.
procedure_steps.comments: Heated at 80 °C with continuous stirring for 2 h

procedure_steps.description: Filter, cool to room temperature, and slowly evaporate for 2 weeks to obtain reddish-brown crystals.
Dissolve 0.5336 g K6(NH4)2[MnMo6O32] in 50 mL of water at 80 °C with continuous stirring.
Add 1.0 g MnCl2·4H2O in 5 mL solution, then 2 mL of 1 mol·L-1 H2SO4 to adjust pH to 3.0.
Filter, cool to room temperature, and slowly evaporate. Reddish-brown crystals form after 3 weeks.
Dissolve 2.0012 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 20 mL of water with strong stirring.
Gradually add 10 mL of 40% acetic acid, 1.5004 g Mn(CH3COO)2·4H2O, and 0.0785 g KMnO4. Adjust pH to 3.0.
procedure_steps.comments: Reaction mixture heated at 40°C for 2 hours

procedure_steps.description: Filter the mixture, cool to room temperature, and slowly evaporate. Bluish-green crystals form after 2 weeks.
Dissolve 0.5267 g K6(NH4)2[MnMo6O32] in 25 mL of 0.5 mol·L-1 Na2SO4 solution.
Add 5 mL of 1 mol·L-1 NiCl2 (5 mmol) solution, then 2 mL of 1 mol·L-1 H2SO4 to adjust pH to 3.0.
procedure_steps.comments: Heat at 80 °C with stirring for 2 hours

procedure_steps.description: Filter, cool to room temperature, and slowly evaporate. Reddish-brown crystals form after 2 weeks.

product_summary.name: Mn3[L/D-MnMo9O32]·13H2O
product_summary.notes: Red crystals obtained after one-week evaporation.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.5168 g K3(NH4)3[MnMo6O18] in 50 mL hot water at 80 °C.
Add 10 mL 1 M MnCl2 solution (10 mmol) with stirring.
Adjust pH to 2.0 using 2 M H2SO4.
Maintain the reaction at 70 °C under reflux for 2 h.
Filter hot, cool the filtrate to room temperature, and allow slow evaporation for 1 week.

product_summary.name: Ni3[L/D-MnMo9O32]·11.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow crystals after 5 days slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Heat 50 mL water to 80 °C and dissolve 0.5234 g K3(NH4)3[MnMo6O32] with stirring.
Add 7 mL 1 M NiCl2 solution (7 mmol) to the hot solution.
Cool to 70 °C and adjust pH to ≈ 2 with 2 M H2SO4.
Filter the hot mixture to remove any insoluble material and allow filtrate to cool.
Let the filtrate evaporate slowly at room temperature for 5 days to form yellow crystals.
Dissolve 0.5234 g K3(NH4)3[MnMo6O32] in 50 mL water at 80 °C with stirring.
Add 6 mL 1 M CoCl2 (6 mmol) to the hot solution.
Adjust pH to ≈ 2 with 2 M H2SO4.
Filter the mixture while hot, then cool the filtrate.
Allow filtrate to evaporate slowly at room temperature for 5 days to yield red crystals.

product_summary.name: Cu3[MnMo9O32]·15H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow crystals obtained in one week

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.5234 g K3(NH4)3[MnMo6O32] in 50 mL water at 80 °C.
Add 8 mL 1 M CuCl2 solution (8 mmol).
Adjust pH to ≈ 2 with 2 M H2SO4.
Filter while hot, cool the filtrate.
Allow slow evaporation at room temperature; yellow crystals appear after 1 week.

product_summary.name: [(CH3)4N]2Nd[HMnMo9O32]·6H2O
product_summary.notes: Red block crystals after 10 days evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.5012 g K3(NH4)3[MnMo6O32] in 50 mL water at 25 °C.
Add 0.1132 g NdCl3 (0.45 mmol) with stirring.
Adjust pH to ≈ 2 using 1 M H2SO4.
Add 0.2139 g (CH3)4NCl and heat the solution at 70–80 °C for 1 h.
Cool, filter, and allow filtrate to evaporate slowly at room temperature.
Red block crystals appear after 10 days.
Add 0.01 mol·L-1 Ni(NO3)2 solution into 10 mL 0.10 mol·L-1 CuSO4 solution, heat to 70°C.
Add 10 mL of 0.10 mol·L-1 ammonium peroxydisulfate solution. Adjust pH to 4.44 with H2SO4, heat for ~30 min.
Allow the solution to stand, forming a dark green solid (65% yield).
Dissolve measured amount of (NH4)6Mo7O24⋅4H2O in water, adjust pH to 4~6 with H2SO4.
Add ammonium peroxydisulfate solution, heat to boiling, the solution changes color. Then add more (NH4)2S2O8 while boiling.
Filter, wash with water, and dry. The final solid is (NH4)6[NiMo6O19]⋅6H2O.
procedure_steps.comments: EA found: Ni 5.09%, N 3.56%, Mo 52.32% (theoretical Ni 5.09%, N 3.49%, Mo 52.46%)

product_summary.name: (NH4)6[P2Mo5O23]
product_summary.notes: Solid product obtained after cooling and filtration

procedure_steps.description: Boil 13.7 g 30 % phosphorous acid and 7 mL 15 M NH3 in 70 mL water.
While boiling, add 14.4 g Na2MoO4·2H2O; continue boiling 30 min until mostly dissolved.
Filter the hot solution.
Add 30 mL concentrated ammonia to the filtrate and cool to crystallise product.
Filter the crystals and rinse with cold water.

product_summary.name: [K3Ca(H2O)4(HP2Mo5O23)]·6H2O
product_summary.notes: Colourless crystals obtained after two-week evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6.73 g Na2MoO4·2H2O, 5.32 g Na2HPO4·12H2O and 1.52 g CaCl2 in 70 mL water with stirring.
Adjust the pH to 4.5 with 1 M HCl.
Heat the solution at 80–90 °C for several hours.
Cool the reaction mixture to room temperature.
Filter the solution to remove any solids.
Add 1.0 g KCl to the filtrate.
Allow the solution to evaporate slowly at room temperature for ~2 weeks.
Collect the colourless crystals by filtration and air-dry.

product_summary.name: Naₙ[(RPO3)2Mo5O15]
product_summary.notes: Generic procedure—product composition depends on R group

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.33 mmol alkyl-phosphonic acid in 5 mL water.
Add 0.20 g Na2MoO4·2H2O (0.83 mmol) with stirring until dissolved.
Slowly add 4 M HCl drop-wise to adjust pH to 3–3.5.
Allow the mixture to cool slowly to room temperature.
Filter to collect ~20 mL of the solidified product.

product_summary.name: Naₙ[((NH3CH2CH2)2PO3)2Mo5O15]
product_summary.notes: Product contains amino-alkyl substituted phosphonate ligands

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.33 mmol bis(2-aminoethyl) phosphonic acid in 5 mL water.
Add 0.20 g Na2MoO4·2H2O with stirring.
Adjust pH to 3–3.5 with slow addition of 4 M HCl.
Allow to cool slowly to room temperature and stand until solidification.
Filter to isolate ~20 mL of the solidified product, then dry.

product_summary.name: Naₙ[(RPO3)2Mo5O15] (variant)
product_summary.notes: Variant procedure—specific R group not specified

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve the alkyl-phosphonic acid (0.33 mmol) in 5 mL water.
Add 0.20 g Na2MoO4·2H2O with stirring until dissolved.
Slowly adjust the pH to 3–3.5 using 4 M HCl while stirring.
Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature and stand.
Filter the mixture to collect the solid product and dry.

product_summary.name: Naₙ[(RPO3)2Mo5O15] (alternate)
product_summary.notes: Alternate file variant of the generic phosphonate-molybdate synthesis

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve the alkyl-phosphonic acid (0.33 mmol) in 5 mL water.
Add 0.20 g Na2MoO4·2H2O (0.83 mmol) with stirring.
Adjust pH to 3–3.5 with 4 M HCl, then allow to cool to room temperature.
Filter to isolate the solid product and dry.
Dissolve 0.14 g H2O2PCH2COOH in 30 mL water under stirring.
Add 0.605 g Na2MoO4·2H2O followed by 0.224 g KCl; obtain clear solution.
Adjust pH to ≈ 3 with 12 M HCl.
Reflux the mixture for 20 min until colour change.
Cool to room temperature and add 2 g RbCl.
Filter, then add ethanol to the filtrate and leave two weeks.
Repeat the steps described for procedure-256-1, substituting H2O2PC2H2COOH for H2O2PCH2COOH.

name: Na2MoO4
reagents.comments: 50 mmol? Possibly a mismatch in text

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.1 g sodium molybdate in 70 mL water, add 7 mL of 15 mL·L-1 ammonia solution, bring to boil.
procedure_steps.comments: Text references 50 mmol and 105 mmol but unclear if mismatch

procedure_steps.description: Add total 14.4 g MoO3 (100 mmol) over 40–45 minutes while boiling. Reduce volume to 20–25 mL.
Cool to room temperature, filter, wash with ice water, vacuum dry. Yield 14.4 g (~78%).
procedure_steps.comments: UV-Vis data: 245 nm, 213 nm at pH 4.9

product_summary.name: (NH4)4[(CH3PO3)2Mo5O15]·2H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals after a few days

name: Malonic acid
reagents.role: additive? Possibly a confusion or side-ligand

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.0 g MoO3 in 30 mL water containing 7 mL ammonia solution, then add 1.92 g malonic acid. Reflux for 15–20 minutes.
Slowly cool the solution to room temperature over a few days. Colorless crystals form.
procedure_steps.comments: Wash crystals with 4 mL cold methanol, dry.

characterization.comments: UV-Vis at 0.7 mmol·L-1, pH 4.3: λ=245 nm

product_summary.name: [(CH3)4N]2Na2[(CH3PO3)2Mo5O15]·3H2O
product_summary.notes: Procedure labeled for phenylphosphonic acid but text references 'CH3PO3' in snippet. Possibly a mismatch.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 7.2 g MoO3 in 20 mL water containing 1.6 g NaOH, then add 1.92 g phosphonic acid, boil for 15–20 min.
Add 4.4 g tetrabutylammonium chloride to 6 mL hot aqueous solution. Heat another 10–15 min, then filter.
procedure_steps.comments: Allow to stand at room temp for crystallization

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.88 g phenylphosphonic acid in 25 mL water containing 4.83 g Na2MoO4•2H2O. Add 4 mL 6 mol·L-1 HCl to acidify. Boil 15–20 min.
Add 0.86 g NH4Cl solution (hot), heat another 15–20 min, then filter while hot.
procedure_steps.comments: Crystallize at room temperature over days.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 10 g (NH4)4Mo7O24•4H2O in 60 mL water, add 3 mL HCl, then add 4.2 g phenylphosphonic acid.
procedure_steps.comments: Adjust pH 4.6-5.0 with 6 mol·L-1 HCl if needed.

procedure_steps.description: Slightly boil until volume ~40-45 mL. Cool to room temperature, filter, crystals form slowly.
Dissolve 0.65 g Na2MoO4•2H2O and 1.58 g phenylphosphonic acid in 30 mL water, add 5 mL 6 mol·L-1 HCl, boil 15–20 min.
Add 2.26 g tetrabutylammonium chloride in 3 mL water, re-heat, reduce volume to ~40-45 mL, then add 0.44 g NH4Cl in 3 mL water. White powder forms in ~10 min.
Dissolve 3.3 g Na2WO4•2H2O in 30 mL water, add 1.6 g phenylphosphonic acid, stir 15 min, then use HAc to adjust pH to 3.0.
Add the tri-n-butylamine or similar reagent. The mixture eventually yields crystals in a 1:1 methylbenzene/water system over time.

characterization.comments: Water/alcohol-insoluble; soluble in acetonitrile, DMF, dichloromethane, acetone

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 4.2 g Na2MoO4⋅2H2O (10 mmol) and 0.50 g 2-aminophenylphosphonic acid (4 mmol) in 20 mL water, add 7.7 mL 6 mol·L-1 HCl (16 mmol), stir 15–20 min, filter.
Add 0.88 g tetraethylammonium chloride (8 mmol) in 4 mL water, evaporate mixture to 20–25 mL by heating, cool to room temperature.
procedure_steps.comments: Pale yellow solid forms, filter, wash with 2-3 mL cold water

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.1 g Na2MoO4⋅2H2O (5 mmol) and 0.37 g p-aminophenylphosphonic acid (2 mmol) in 70 mL water, add 2 mL 3 mol·L-1 HCl (6 mmol), stir 30 minutes, filter.
Add 0.22 g tetraethylammonium chloride (4 mmol) in 2 mL water. Slowly evaporate to form pale yellow solid. Filter, wash with 1 mL cold water twice, air dry.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Rb4[Se2Mo5O21]·2H2O']
procedure_information.comments: N/A

name: Rubidium carbonate
Rb2CO3
reagents.comments: Used at 4 parts in the stated ratio

name: Ammonium heptamolybdate tetrahydrate
(NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O
reagents.comments: Used at 3 parts in the stated ratio

name: Selenium dioxide
SeO2
reagents.comments: Used at 5 parts in the stated ratio

procedure_steps.description: Add Rb2CO3, (NH4)6Mo7O24·4H2O, and SeO2 in a 4:3:5 ratio to water.
Stir the mixture until fully dissolved and homogenized.
Transfer the solution into a 3.5 chamber or container.
Age the mixture at room temperature for 2 weeks to form pale yellow crystals.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['(NH4)4[S2Mo5O21]·3H2O']
procedure_information.comments: Elemental analysis mismatch: text lists (NH4)4[S2Mo9O21]·3H2O. Stored in comments.

name: (NH4)4[S2Mo5O21]·3H2O
product_summary.notes: No explicit final mass or yield reported

name: Sulfur dioxide
SO2
reagents.comments: Gas passed into solution; amount unspecified

name: Sulfate (unspecified)
reagents.comments: Unclear if externally added or formed in situ

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 9 g sodium molybdate in 30 mL water.
procedure_steps.comments: Solution forms the base for reaction

procedure_steps.description: Bubble SO2 gas through the solution until it gradually turns yellow.
procedure_steps.comments: Color change to yellow indicates progression

procedure_steps.description: Add a large amount of sulfate (SO4) into the solution to accelerate the reaction.
procedure_steps.comments: Leads to quick formation of yellow microcrystals upon cooling

procedure_steps.description: Cool the mixture to promote crystal formation.
Filter the yellow microcrystals.
Air dry the filtered crystals to obtain (NH4)4[S2Mo5O21]·3H2O.

characterization.comments: Listed formula in analysis is (NH4)4[S2Mo9O21]·3H2O, possibly an error or different stoichiometry

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 4.8 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 80 mL water.
Acidify with 5.6 mL H2SO4, then add 120 mL ethanol.
Add 11.2 g Et4NCl; solution turns pale yellow.
Keep at 5 °C for 3–4 h; collect pale-yellow micro-crystals.
Wash and air-dry the product.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Cs6[P2W5O23]·7.5H2O']
procedure_information.comments: N/A

name: Tungstic acid
H2WO4
reagents.comments: Often referred to as tungsten acid

name: Phosphotungstic acid eluent
reagents.comments: Used in ion-exchange column at pH 7

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 15 g tungstic acid in 100 mL water.
Introduce ammonia gas to adjust pH to 13.
Pass the solution through an ion exchange column using phosphotungstic acid eluent at pH 7.
Cool the resulting solution to obtain Cs6[P2W5O23]·7.5H2O crystals.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Cs6[P2W5O23]·H2O']
procedure_information.comments: N/A

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 60 g H2WO4 in 400 mL water with stirring.
Slowly add 110 mL of 50% CsOH solution, then filter and wash to obtain a clear blue solution.
procedure_steps.comments: The text mentions ~85% (likely solution or intermediate yield).

procedure_steps.description: Slowly drop H3PO4 until pH ~7.0.
Refrigerate thoroughly at 4°C for 24 hours.
Filter the white precipitate and wash it.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na9[Dy(W5O18)2]·xH2O']
procedure_information.comments: Method similar to Tb variant; DyCl3·6H2O used

name: Water
reagents.comments: 20 mL for dissolving Na2WO4, 2 mL for dissolving DyCl3

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 8.3 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 20 mL water.
Adjust the pH to 7.4–7.5 with HAc.
Dissolve 0.93 g DyCl3·6H2O in 2 mL water and add dropwise while stirring.
Cool the mixture, filter, and let stand at room temperature to obtain crystals.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na9[Ho(W5O18)2]·xH2O']
procedure_information.comments: Method similar to Tb variant; HoCl3·6H2O used

name: Water
reagents.comments: 20 mL for dissolving Na2WO4, 2 mL for HoCl3

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 8.3 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 20 mL water.
Adjust pH to ~7.4–7.5 with acetic acid.
Dissolve 0.94 g HoCl3·6H2O in 2 mL water and add dropwise while stirring at ~85 °C.
Cool, filter, and precipitate at room temperature to obtain crystals.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na9[Er(W5O18)2]·xH2O']
procedure_information.comments: Distinct steps using Er2(CO3)3·3H2O and HCl

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.18 g Er2(CO3)3·3H2O in 30 mL of 0.1 M HCl.
procedure_steps.comments: Solution turns faint purple upon heating

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 50 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 100 mL water with stirring and adjust pH to 7.2 with HAc.
Slowly add the erbium solution into the sodium tungstate solution to obtain the precipitate.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na9[Tb(W5O18)2]·xH2O']
procedure_information.comments: General method for Ln = Tb, Dy, Ho, Er. Here specifically TbCl3·6H2O

name: Water
reagents.comments: 20 mL for Na2WO4, 2 mL for TbCl3

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 8.3 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 20 mL water.
Adjust the pH to 7.4–7.5 with HAc.
Dissolve 0.921 g TbCl3·6H2O in 2 mL water and add dropwise while stirring at ~85 °C.
Cool the mixture, filter, and stand at room temperature to obtain Na9[Tb(W5O18)2]·xH2O crystals.
Prepare a hot aqueous solution of Na2WO4 and adjust pH to 6.5–7.5 with 4 M HCl.
Slowly add Ce(III) chloride/nitrate solution to the hot tungstate solution.
Filter; allow filtrate to stand at 5 °C to crystallize partially.
Follow the same procedure as in procedure-272-1, substituting Nd(III) salt for Ce(III).
Follow the same procedure as in procedure-272-1, substituting Sm(III) salt for Ce(III).
Dissolve sodium tungstate (R1) in water (R2) to form an aqueous solution.

Adjust the solution to pH 6.5–7.5 by slowly adding 4 M HCl (R3).

procedure_steps.comments: Addition carried out slowly to avoid precipitation.

Cool the filtrate to 5 °C to allow partial crystallization of Na7[HoIIIW10O35].
Prepare a hot aqueous solution of sodium tungstate (R1) in water (R2).
Adjust pH to 6.5–7.5 by addition of 4 M HCl (R3).

procedure_steps.description: Slowly add Yb(III) chloride or nitrate solution (R4) to the hot tungstate solution.
Filter the mixture while hot.
Cool filtrate to 5 °C to induce crystallization of Na7[YbIIIW10O35].
Prepare a hot aqueous solution of sodium tungstate (R1) in water (R2).
Adjust the solution to pH 6.5–7.5 using 4 M HCl (R3).

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na7[PrIIIW10O35]']
procedure_information.comments: Text mentions final product as Na2[PrVIW10O35]- salt, possibly a stoichiometric inconsistency with the given title.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 50 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 100 mL water, adjust the pH with acetic acid, and heat to 90 °C.
Slowly add the Pr(NO3)3 solution (2.6 g Pr6O11 equivalent) into the boiling solution, each drop producing a green precipitate.
Cool the mixture to 5 °C, filter, and wash with water.
Redissolve the collected solid in a small amount of water, filter through KCl and CsCl solutions, then cool again to 5 °C.
procedure_steps.comments: Forms final Na7[PrIIIW10O35] (text suggests possible alternative stoichiometry).

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na9[ErW10O36]·35H2O']
procedure_information.comments: N/A

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.180 g Er2(CO3)3·xH2O in 30 mL of 0.1 M HCl solution and heat at 80 °C for 30 minutes to form solution A (orange).
Dissolve 50 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 100 mL water while stirring, then adjust pH to 7.2 with HAc and bring to boiling (solution B).
Add the hot solution A dropwise to the boiling solution B with vigorous stirring for 1 hour.
Quickly add the mixture to additional boiling water (exact volume not specified), then cool to room temperature with stirring for 2–3 weeks until crystals form.
procedure_steps.comments: Aging for 2–3 weeks to obtain final crystals

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 4.05 g H2MoO4 (R1) in 50 mL 0.50 M HCl (R2) to give solution A.
Heat solution A to 60 °C.
Add 5.85 g NH4VO3 (R3) and 60 mL water (R4) to the hot solution; heat to boiling to form solution B.
Combine solutions A and B, adjust pH to 4.6–6.5 with 2 M HCl (R5) while maintaining 50 °C.
procedure_steps.comments: Exact volume of HCl not specified.

procedure_steps.description: Add 1.8 g Ce2O3 (R6) while slowly dripping KAc/AcH (R7) to keep pH at 4.6–4.7.
procedure_steps.comments: KAc/AcH amount not specified; likely excess.

procedure_steps.description: Continue mixing for 10 minutes.
Filter the reaction mixture to remove solids.
Cool the filtrate to 3 °C to obtain red crystals of K7H8[CeMo4V6O36]·xH2O.
Dissolve 4.05 g H2MoO4 (R1) in 50 mL 0.50 M HCl (R2) to form solution A.
Heat solution A to 60 °C.
Add 5.85 g NH4VO3 (R3) and 60 mL water (R4), heat to boiling to create solution B.
Combine solutions A and B; adjust pH to 4.6–6.5 with 2 M HCl (R5) at 50 °C.
Add 1.8 g Pr2O3 (R6) while dripping KAc/AcH (R7) to maintain pH 4.6–4.7.
Stir the mixture for 10 minutes.
Filter the reaction mixture.
Cool filtrate to 3 °C to obtain yellow crystals of K7H8[PrMo4V6O36]·xH2O.
Dissolve 4.05 g H2MoO4 in 50 mL 0.5 M HCl at 60 °C (solution A).
Add 5.85 g NH4VO3 and 60 mL water; heat to boiling (solution B).
Combine solutions A and B with stirring.
Adjust pH to 4.6–6.5 with 2 M HCl and maintain at 50 °C.
Add 1.8 g Nd2O3 while slowly dripping KAc/AcH to keep pH 4.6–4.7.
Stir the mixture for 10 minutes.
Filter the hot mixture.
Cool the filtrate to 3 °C to crystallize yellow product.
Dissolve 4.05 g H2MoO4 in 50 mL 0.5 M HCl at 60 °C (solution A).
Add 5.85 g NH4VO3 and 60 mL water; heat to boiling (solution B).
Combine solutions A and B with stirring.
Adjust pH to 4.6–6.5 with 2 M HCl at 50 °C.
Add 1.8 g La2O3 while dripping KAc/AcH to maintain pH 4.6–4.7.
Stir the mixture for 10 minutes.
Filter the mixture.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['K10[Mn4(H2O)2(PW9O34)2]·20H2O']
procedure_information.comments: Long crystallization (3–7 months) yields ruby-colored crystals. Elemental analysis is given.

procedure_steps.description: Slowly heat 28 g Na8H[PW9O34]·19H2O to ~140 °C until it melts partially. In parallel, dissolve 0.2366 g MnSO4·H2O in 15 mL water (yellow-green solution).
Add the MnSO4 solution to the melted precursor while stirring slowly and warming. Filter out insoluble substances.
procedure_steps.comments: Leads to a combined filtered solution

procedure_steps.description: Add 5 g KCl to the filtrate; a yellow-green solid immediately forms.
Collect and dry the resulting amorphous solid in an oven to constant weight (0.1064 g).
Dissolve the dried product in 20 mL water. Keep the solution at ambient conditions for 3–7 months to form ruby-colored single crystals.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['K10[Zn4(H2O)2(PW9O34)2]·20H2O']
procedure_information.comments: Final yield ~77%. White/purple crystals described.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 19 g ZnCl2 in 15 mL H2O with stirring.
Add 2.0 g Na8H[PW9O34]·19H2O to the Zn2+ solution while stirring. Heat until almost all solvent is gone, then filter.
Add 4–6 g KCl to the filtrate, producing a white precipitate immediately.
Collect the white solid powder, then dry by evaporation.
Dissolve the dried powder in 5–10 mL hot water, cool at 5 °C, and dry in a vacuum oven at 80 °C to obtain purple single crystals.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['K10[Co4(H2O)2(PW9O34)2]·20H2O']
procedure_information.comments: Final yield ~71%. Purple crystals described.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.41 g Co(NO3)2·6H2O in 15 mL H2O with stirring to form Co2+ solution.
Add 2.0 g Na8H[PW9O34]·19H2O to the cobalt solution under stirring, heat until fully dissolved.
Add 4–6 g KCl to the solution, stand to precipitate. Filter the purple solid and evaporate to dryness.
Dissolve the powder in 5–10 mL hot water, stand at 5 °C, then dry in an 80 °C vacuum oven to obtain purple single crystals.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['K10[Cu4(H2O)2(PW9O34)2]·20H2O']
procedure_information.comments: Yield reported at 68%. Light green → light blue solids/crystals.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.62 g CuCl2·H2O in 12 mL water (blue solution).
Add 5.0 g Na8H[PW9O34]·19H2O to the Cu2+ solution at room temperature with stirring until dissolved (greenish solution).
Add 0.66 g KCl to the green solution. A light green amorphous solid forms.

Dry the light green solid. Dissolve any undissolved fraction in small water portions. If precipitation remains, let it stand for ~5 minutes, add more water as needed, stirring slowly until light blue crystals form.
procedure_steps.comments: Light blue crystals form upon partial dissolution/re-precipitation

procedure_steps.description: Collect and dry the light blue single crystals to obtain 1.3 g product (68% yield).

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['[(n-C4H9)4N]6[Fe4(H2O)2(PW9O34)2]']
procedure_information.comments: Tetrabutylammonium substitution. IR & UV-Vis data plus EA provided. Overall yield ~30%.

name: Acetonitrile
CH3CN
reagents.comments: 3–5 mL used to dissolve black oil

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.48 g FeCl2·4H2O and 3.0 g Na8H[PW9O34] to 25 mL water at 60 °C, stir 10 minutes, then filter and discard the solution.
Add 3.6 g KCl to the residue or resulting mixture, collect the precipitate, and vacuum dry.
Dissolve 3 g of the dried intermediate in 100 mL water, then add 2.4 g (TBA)Cl in 300 mL CH2Cl2. Stir, allow precipitate to settle.
Filter and wash the precipitate with water. Collect the lower organic layer solution, evaporate at 24 °C. Use ether to cause further precipitation, forming a green crude product.
Dissolve the black oily substance in 3–5 mL CH3CN to get a dark green solution. Add 150 mL ethanol, collect the green powder, and dry under vacuum.

characterization.comments: Close match with the calculated values

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['K5Cs5[(Hg2)2WO(H2O)(AsW9O33)2]']
procedure_information.comments: Method includes multi-step acid additions; partial elemental analysis provided with discrepancy for As. Possibly incomplete stoichiometry in text.

name: Formic acid
HCOOH
reagents.comments: Added after pH is set to 2

name: Cesium chloride
CsCl
reagents.comments: Added with KCl to help detection

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6.6 g sodium arsenate and 2.2 g As2O3 in 200 mL water. Slowly add 17 mL concentrated HCl until pH ~5.6.
Separately dissolve 6 g ammonium tungstate in 20 mL water, then add 5 mL concentrated nitric acid. Slowly add this tungsten solution to the arsenic mixture, heat to boil, adjust pH to 2.
Add 25 g formic acid, allow the solution to cool over 2–3 days to form transparent crystals.
For detection/improved isolation, add CsCl and KCl, then 5 mL of 10% HNO3 dropwise. Slowly evaporate to obtain a solid.

characterization.comments: Discrepancies likely due to partial stoichiometry differences

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['K10[Mn4(H2O)2(AsW9O34)2]·18H2O']
procedure_information.comments: Yield 78%. Recrystallization in acetonitrile.

name: K10[Mn4(H2O)2(AsW9O34)2]·18H2O
product_summary.notes: Orange product; exact final mass not specified

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.4 g MnCl2 to 5 mL water, then add 2.0 g Na8H[AsW9O34]·11H2O under stirring until dissolved.
Add KCl to the solution and filter to remove any solids. An orange precipitate forms.
Dissolve the orange precipitate in a small amount of acetonitrile. Crystals form upon cooling. Yield: 78%.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na6[Fe4(H2O)10(β-AsW9O33)2]·32H2O']
procedure_information.comments: 92% yield. IR data provided. pH adjusted to 3.0 and mixture heated at 90°C.

name: Iron(III) chloride hexahydrate
FeCl3·6H2O

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.97 g FeCl3·6H2O in 40 mL water. Add 4.0 g Na8H[α-AsW9O33], adjust pH to 3.0 with 4 M HCl.
Heat the mixture to 90 °C, then filter and cool. After 1–2 weeks, yellow crystals form.
Dissolve 0.39 g InCl3 in 40 mL water.
Add 2.00 g Na9[α-AsW9O33] to the solution.
Adjust pH to 2 using 4 M HCl.
Heat the mixture at 80 °C for 1 hour.
Cool to room temperature.
Filter the solution to remove solids.
Layer the filtrate with 0.1 M RbNO3 solution and allow slow evaporation.

product_summary.name: K4Na2[In4(H2O)10(β-SbW9O33)2]·30H2O
product_summary.notes: White crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.39 g InCl3 in 40 mL water.
Add 2.40 g Na9[α-SbW9O33] to the indium solution.
Adjust pH to 2 using 4 M HCl.
Heat the mixture at 80 °C for 1 h.
Cool to room temperature.
Filter the solution.
Layer the filtrate with 0.10 M KCl solution.
Allow the solution to evaporate slowly at room temperature (1-2 days) until crystals form.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na6[Fe4(H2O)2(β-SbW9O33)2]·32H2O']

Heat at 90 °C, filter, then slowly evaporate for 1–2 weeks. Yellow crystals form.

Heat the reaction mixture at 80 °C for 1 hour.

Dissolve 4.4 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 40 mL water at 50 °C.
Add 0.82 g FeCl3·6H2O and 0.41 g K2TeO3 to the solution.
Adjust pH to 1.0 with 4 M HCl.
Heat the solution to 90 °C and stir for 1 hour.
Filter the hot solution and cool to room temperature.
Add 4 g CsCl to the filtrate to precipitate yellow crystals.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na12[Mn4(H2O)2(GeW9O34)2]·38H2O']

Filter the hot solution.

Heat mixture at 75 °C for 60 minutes until the solution turns dark blue, then filter.
procedure_steps.comments: Filtrate is used for final product

procedure_steps.description: Add 1 mL of 1.0 M KCl solution to the filtrate to obtain Na9K[Fe4(H2O)2(FeWO34)2]·32H2O crystals.
