procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na6(C4H12N)4[Fe4(H2O)2(FeW9O34)]·45H2O']
procedure_information.comments: Hydrothermal approach at 160 °C for 44 h, then slow evaporation. Also a byproduct with 9% yield.

name: Na6(C4H12N)4[Fe4(H2O)2(FeW9O34)]·45H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow crystals obtained after hydrothermal + evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.800 g Na2WO4·2H2O, 0.340 g FeCl3·6H2O, and 0.400 g organic base in 5 mL water. Adjust pH with 2 M NaOH.
Seal the mixture in a 23 mL stainless steel vessel, heat at 160 °C for 44 hours, then cool to room temperature.
Slowly evaporate the resulting solution. After two days, obtain Na6(C4H12N)4[Fe4(H2O)2(FeW9O34)]·45H2O crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Yield 100 mg, 12%. Another byproduct was also observed (9% yield).

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.800 g Na2WO4·2H2O, 0.340 g FeCl3·6H2O, and 0.400 g organic base in 5 mL water. Adjust pH with 2 M NaOH if needed.
Seal in a 23 mL stainless steel vessel, heat at 160 °C for 44 hours, cool to room temperature.
After slow evaporation, isolate Na14(C4H12N)5[Fe4W9O34(H2O)2(FeW6O26)2]·50H2O crystals.
Dissolve 0.35 g Na12[P2W15O56]·18H2O and 0.16 g NiSO4·6H2O in 15 mL water while stirring until clear.
Adjust the solution pH to 4.0 using acid.
Seal the solution in a pressure vessel and heat at 160 °C for 10 days.
Cool to room temperature and filter to collect dark-green crystals.
Dissolve 5 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 15 mL water at 75 °C.
Gradually add 7.86 g copper salt dissolved in 10 mL water, maintaining pH 3–4.
Maintain at 75 °C for 60 min until the solution turns dark blue.
Filter to remove green residue and collect the blue-green filtrate.

Cool the clear solution to 5 °C in a refrigerator, let it stand, then filter the white precipitate and dry at 80 °C in vacuum for 0.5 hours.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na16[Co4(H2O)2(P2W15O56)2]·xH2O']

Add 5.0 g Na12[P2W15O56], stir until fully dissolved. Then cool the clear purple solution to 5 °C and let stand overnight.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na16[Cu4(H2O)2(P2W15O56)2]·xH2O']

Add 5.0 g Na12[P2W15O56]. A green suspension forms, filter it to obtain a clear green solution.
Cool the solution to 5 °C, let stand overnight. Filter and dry the product at 80 °C in vacuum for 0.5 hours to obtain ~3.92 g crystals (77% yield).

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na14[(NaOH2)(FeOH2)Fe2(P2W15O56)2]·20H2O']
procedure_information.comments: Multiple steps involving partial precipitation, mention of Fe2O3 removal. Light yellow crystals eventually form.

procedure_steps.description: Slowly dissolve 5 g Na12(α-P2W15O56) in 30 mL water. Separately dissolve 0.49 g FeCl3·4H2O in 30 mL of 1 M NaCl solution.
Let cool and react for ~10 minutes. Filter out any Fe2O3 solid formed. Add 1.5 g NaCl, stir for 10–15 minutes.
Filter off the yellow precipitate, then let the remaining solution stand at room temperature for 1–2 days to get light yellow crystals.
Dissolve 0.75 g precursor in a small volume of 0.5 M NaCl solution.
Adjust pH to 2 using dilute acid.
Slowly add 0.320 g NiCl2·6H2O and heat to 60 °C while stirring for 10 min (solution turns yellow).
Leave the solution standing at ambient temperature for 7 days.
Filter yellow crystals and dry.
Dissolve 0.4948 g MnCl2·4H2O in 50 mL 1 M NaCl solution at 50 °C.
Slowly add 4 g Na12[P2W15O56]·18H2O solution while maintaining 50 °C.
Dry the resulting crystals at 50 °C after filtration.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['Na16[Ni4(H2O)2(P2W15O56)2]·nH2O']
procedure_information.comments: Likely the correct version for Ni doping. Same steps as procedure-305-1. Blue-green crystals after drying.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.5943 g NiCl2·6H2O in 50 mL of 1 M NaCl solution, stirring until a green solution forms.
Slowly add 4 g Na12[P2W15O56]·18H2O solution, heat to 60 °C for a few minutes. The color becomes dark green.
Cool slowly, transparent crystals form. Filter and dry at 50 °C, yielding blue-green crystals of Na16[Ni4(H2O)2(P2W15O56)2]·nH2O.

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of ['NaK[V2O6]']
procedure_information.comments: Hydrothermal method. 12–15 days at 96–100 °C. Pale yellow crystals.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.1 g NaOH in 27 mL water. Add 2.5 g NH4VO3 while heating to 70–80 °C with stirring until completely dissolved.
Cool the solution to room temperature, add 3.6 g KI, stir 30 minutes.
Transfer the solution to a sealed stainless steel reaction kettle (App1). Heat at 96–100 °C for 12–15 days.
Wash the resulting precipitate with water until neutral, then dry to obtain pale yellow block crystals.

V2O5
reagents.comments: Used in 1:1 ratio with MnO; total ~3 g mixture

name: CsCl/NaCl eutectic mixture
reagents.comments: Approximately three times the mass of the MnO/V2O5 mixture

procedure_steps.description: Mix MnO and V2O5 in a 1:1 ratio (~3 g total).
procedure_steps.comments: No explicit time or temperature data

procedure_steps.description: Add CsCl/NaCl eutectic mixture (approximately three times the mass of the MnO/V2O5 mixture).
procedure_steps.comments: No explicit amounts given, approximate ratio

procedure_steps.description: Gradually heat the mixture to 450°C.
procedure_steps.comments: Heating rate or duration not specified

procedure_steps.description: Cool in the furnace to obtain the product.

product_summary.name: [(n-C4H9)4N]3[V5O14]
product_summary.notes: White crystals obtained; no exact yield provided

procedure_steps.description: Add 5 mL of 0.41 M [n-C4H9N]OH to a 25 mL CH3CN solution containing 0.97 g of [n-C4H9N]3H3V10O28 (0.58 mmol).
Filter to remove a small amount of insolubles.
Heat the filtrate to reflux for 15–20 minutes.
Concentrate the solution to about 15–20 mL.
procedure_steps.comments: Solvent partially removed to reduce volume

procedure_steps.description: Gradually cool to a nearly colorless but slightly yellow acidic solution.
Allow the reaction solution to stand at room temperature.
procedure_steps.comments: No stirring is described, but this is a holding/wait step.

procedure_steps.description: Add 30–40 mL of acetone over 15 minutes.
procedure_steps.comments: Exact volume not fixed; range 30–40 mL

procedure_steps.description: Add 2–3 mL of ethyl acetate solution.
Cool the mixture to -7°C and store for 12 hours to yield white crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: White crystals formed upon standing at -7°C

procedure_steps.description: Under nitrogen atmosphere, mix [NEt4]4[VOCl4] and AgAc in a 1:2 ratio in MeCN.
procedure_steps.comments: Exact masses not specified; ratio is 1:2

procedure_steps.description: Briefly expose the solution to air to obtain a dark blue solution.
Gradually evaporate the solvent to obtain [NEt4]2[V5O9Cl(Ac)4]·MeCN.
Under nitrogen atmosphere, mix [NEt4]4[VOCl4] and NaAc in a 1:2 ratio in MeCN.
Briefly expose the solution to air to obtain a dark blue solution.
Gradually evaporate the solvent to obtain [NEt4]2[V5O9Cl(Ac)4]·MeCN.
Add 0.2 g H2[Pt(OH)6]2 to 11 mL NaOH solution.
procedure_steps.comments: Concentration of NaOH solution not given

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.13 g NaVO3 in 20 mL water separately.
Heat the combined solution for 30 minutes.
Cool to room temperature.
Add 3 mL of 1 M HNO3 to adjust pH to 4.
Partially evaporate the solution to remove about 15 mL of water.
procedure_steps.comments: Evaporation on water bath, details not specified

procedure_steps.description: Allow the solution to stand for one day, red hexagonal crystals form.

product_summary.name: [NEt4]3[V9O19(Ac)5]·2MeCN
product_summary.notes: Mixed-valence V(IV/V) cluster crystallized from MeCN.

procedure_steps.description: Under N2, dissolve [NEt4]4[VOCl4] and NaOAc (1 : 3 molar ratio) in MeCN.
Briefly expose the solution to air; a blue solution forms rapidly.
Reduce the volume by 50 % under vacuum; dark-green crystals slowly grow.

name: Tetra-n-butylammonium bromide
(n-C4H9)4NBr
reagents.comments: Used as a 2 mL portion of a 60 g-in-water solution (186 mmol total in the stock). Exact mass in 2 mL is not specified.

name: Diethyl ether
Ether
reagents.comments: 60 mL first wash + 100 mL after precipitation step

name: Butanol
reagents.comments: Used in two dissolving steps: 150 mL then 50 mL

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 15.00 g Na3VO4 (81.6 mmol) in 110 mL water.
procedure_steps.comments: 110 mL water not listed as separate reagent

procedure_steps.description: Rapidly add 71 mL of 3 M HCl (213 mmol) with continuous stirring until color remains unchanged.
Gradually add 2 mL of the (n-C4H9)4NBr solution (60 g in water) while stirring for 15 minutes.
procedure_steps.comments: Concentration in the 2 mL portion unknown

procedure_steps.description: Filter the resulting yellow precipitate.
Wash with 60 mL of ethanol, followed by 60 mL of ether. Dry the product overnight to obtain 17 g of crude material.
Dissolve the 17 g crude material in 150 mL butanol, stir for 10 minutes.
procedure_steps.comments: Crude dissolves partially or fully in butanol

procedure_steps.description: Filter and reduce the volume to ~100 mL by heating. Form deep yellow precipitates, filter and wash with 100 mL ether, vacuum dry to get 12.3 g of yellow powder.
Dissolve in 50 mL butanol again, precipitate out more crystals, filter, wash with ether, and dry to obtain 8 g of yellow powder (overall yield ~85%).
procedure_steps.comments: Third precipitation step, final mass 8 g

characterization.comments: Good agreement between calculated and experimental

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve equivalent amounts of KVO3 and Zn(Ac)2 in water.
Adjust pH to 5 with acetic acid (HAc).
Allow gradual evaporation to obtain yellow crystals of K2Zn2[V10O28]·16H2O.

product_summary.name: Na6[V10O28]·12H2O
product_summary.notes: Red hexagonal crystals after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.5 g NaOH in 15 mL water.
Introduce 0.77 g V2O5 and 0.66 g H2MoO4; heat to 50–70 °C and stir until a blue solution forms.
Adjust the solution to pH 6 with 1 M HCl; colour changes to dark-red.
Transfer the solution to a Teflon-lined autoclave and heat at 150 °C for 2 days.
Filter, wash the solid, and obtain a red filtrate.
Allow the filtrate to evaporate slowly at room temperature for 1–2 weeks to give red hexagonal crystals of Na6[V10O28]·12H2O.
Dissolve 1.8 g KOH in 21 mL water.
Add 2.3 g V2O5; heat to 60–80 °C and stir until dissolved.
Cool and stir 10 min, then add 0.5 mL 85 % H3PO4 (pH ≈ 6); stir a further 30 min.
Filter the solution.
Transfer filtrate to a Teflon-lined autoclave; heat 150 °C for 2 days.
Cool, filter, and allow slow evaporation to afford dark-red crystals of K6[V10O28]·9H2O.

product_summary.name: [H4bim]2[H2V10O28]·4H2O
product_summary.notes: Brown crystals after one month standing

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.085 g VOSO4·nH2O in 150 mL water.
Add 0.42 g H2O2; adjust pH to 6 (reagent unspecified).
Dissolve 0.95 g Hbim in 350 mL ethanol and add drop-wise to the vanadium solution with stirring.
Stir the mixture continuously for 24 h.
Remove gray precipitate to obtain a brown solution.
Let the solution stand; brown crystals grow after ~1 month.
Dissolve 0.4547 g V2O5, 1.2 g NaOH and 0.3857 g thiohydantoin in 40 mL water with stirring.
Adjust the resulting orange-yellow solution to pH 3 using dilute HCl.
Allow the solution to stand at room temperature; orange-yellow plate crystals appear after several weeks.
Dissolve 0.117 g NH4VO3, 0.095 g bbi and 0.121 g Cu(NO3)2·3H2O in 10 mL ethanol under stirring.
Adjust pH to ~5 using Et3N and acetic acid.
Transfer the mixture to a 25 mL autoclave and heat at 150 °C for 72 h.
Cool to room temperature at 10 °C h-1 to obtain dark-green crystals.
Dissolve 7.6 g KVO3 in 200 mL hot water.
Add 5 mL 1 M HNO3, followed by 5 mL 1 M MnSO4 and 2.7 g K2S2O8.
Maintain at 90 °C, then cool and filter after 0.5–1 h.
Concentrate filtrate (evaporate 30–50 mL) and crystallise using 0.3 M K2SO4 / 0.2 M KHSO4; slow evaporation yields black-red crystals of K5[MnV11O32]·(10–12)H2O.
Dissolve 0.6 M (NH4)2SO4 and 0.4 M NH4HSO4 in water. Let the solution stand to obtain red crystals.
Dissolve 1.5 g K5[MnV11O32] in 10 mL hot water with 1 mL of 0.3 M K2SO4/0.2 M KHSO4 solution.
Add 1.3 g CsCl (7.5 mmol). A yellow precipitate appears. Cool and filter the solid material.
Recrystallize the solid with 0.8 g CsCl (5 mmol) and 2 mL of the hot K2SO4/KHSO4 solution. Adjust pH to 2~3, evaporate slowly at room temperature for ~1 week to obtain dark red crystals.
Dissolve (n-Bu4N)4[H2V10O28] in ethanol.
Reflux for 1–2 min.
Add excess ethyl acetate to precipitate a black powder.
Filter and wash the powder with ethyl acetate.
Dissolve the powder in CH2Cl2 : EtOAc (1 : 2 v/v) and recrystallize to give black rhombohedral crystals.
Dissolve 2.93 g NaVO3 and 1.58 g As2O3 in 75 mL water at 90 °C to form a yellow solution.
Cool to 80 °C, add 0.493 g N2H4·H2SO4, stir for 30 minutes, then keep at 80 °C for 8 hours.
Cool to room temperature over 16 hours, filter off any undissolved solids.
Adjust the pH to 6 using 1 M HCl solution (green precipitate may form but redissolves upon stirring). Maintain pH 6 for at least 6 hours.
Store the solution at 4 °C in a sealed bottle for 2–3 days to obtain green block-shaped crystals.
Dissolve 2.39 g NaVO3, 1.58 g As2O3, and 1.50 g NH(C2H5)3 Cl in 50 mL water at 90 °C. Cool to 80 °C.
Slowly add 2.05 mmol N2H4·HCl, stir for 30 minutes at 80 °C, then maintain at 80 °C for 2 hours.
Cool to room temperature for 16 hours, filter off undissolved solids.
Adjust pH to 6 using 1 M HCl (any green precipitate will redissolve upon stirring). Keep pH at 6 for at least 6 hours.
Store at 4 °C in a sealed bottle for 2–3 days to obtain black-purple block-shaped crystals.
Dissolve 1.66 g KVO3 in 50 mL water at 90 °C.
Add 0.52 g As2O5·5H2O; yellow solution (pH 5).
Stir 10 min at 90 °C.
Add 0.70 g KSCN and H2SO4 to pH 2 (green solution).
Stir 45 min at 90 °C.
Cool to room temperature and stand 1 day.
Collect black-purple crystals by filtration.

product_summary.name: (n-Bu4N)3[V13O34]
product_summary.notes: Product isolated as solid after reflux

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve (n-Bu4N)3[H3V10O28] in glacial acetic acid (26 mmol L-1).
Reflux under dry N2 for 7 h.
Cool, isolate the product by filtration, wash and dry.
Dissolve As2O3, V2O5 and NMe4OH in 23 mL water with stirring.
Evaporate the solution until 60 % of the original volume remains.
Transfer to a Teflon-lined autoclave.
Heat at 200 °C for 48 h.
Cool to room temperature; black-brown crystalline needles form.
Filter and air-dry the crystals.

product_summary.name: [Et4N]5[V14O36Cl]
product_summary.notes: Brownish-red crystals obtained after DMF recrystallisation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.273 g VO(acac)2 and 0.099 g Et4NCl in 50 mL acetonitrile with stirring.
Add 0.8 mmol Et3N and 11 mL CHCl3 drop-wise.
Stir 6 h at room temperature.
Remove solvent under reduced pressure.
Recrystallize the residue from DMF, filter and dry.

characterization.comments: Theoretical values: V 36.09 %, Cl 1.79 %, C 24.32 %, H 5.10 %, N 3.54 %

name: Semi-collagen
C2N2S2H14? (approx)
reagents.comments: 5 mmol (stated in text but uncertain composition)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.4547 g V2O5, 1.2 g NaOH, and 0.3857 g semi-collagen in 40 mL water.
Adjust the pH to 6.0 with HCl solution to obtain a greenish product, block-like appearance.
Dissolve 5.0 g (NMe4)Br in 75 mL water at ~60 °C.
Gradually add 1.0 g {NH4}3[VS4] (4.3 mmol) at 60~65 °C, stir for 16 hours. The solution changes from red to purple.
Filter and dry at 60~65 °C for five days to obtain the brownish product.
Dissolve 5.88 g Li2CO3 in 150 mL water.
Add 12 g V2O5 in portions, stir 5 min and filter.
Heat filtrate to 90 °C, add 1.5 g hydrazine hydrate, stand 1 h.
Filter; seal dark-green filtrate with 20 mL ethanol + 6 mL water.
Keep at 5–7 °C for 2–3 days to crystallise.
Collect black crystals by filtration.
Under nitrogen, dissolve [NEt4]2[VOCl4] and NaOAc in MeCN in a 1 : 4 molar ratio, giving a dark-red solution.
Reflux briefly until the solution turns red.
Remove ~50 % of the solvent under vacuum.
Allow the concentrated solution to stand in air; black crystals deposit.
procedure_steps.comments: Product contains mixed-valence V after air exposure

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 600 mg NH4VO3 (5 mmol), 600 mg Sb2O3 (2 mmol), and 4 mL of 50% tren solution in 30 mL water.
Place the solution in a reactor at 150 °C for 7 days. Green crystals form upon slow cooling.
Filter the green crystals, wash with water, and use ultrasonic cleaning. Dry as needed.
Dissolve 1.0 g VOSO4·5H2O (4.00 mmol) in 60 mL water. Add 1.38 g KOH (23.3 mmol), forming a dark red solution.
Add 1.09 g N,N',N''-tris(2-aminoethyl)amine (4.62 mmol). Seal the mixture and allow crystallization at room temperature.
Allow the sealed solution to stand. Dark red platelet crystals of K10[H2V16O38]·13H2O appear. Another phase K11[V18O12(SO4)]·20H2O may form under certain conditions.
Add reagents R1–R5 into the 23 mL vessel; stir 30 s.
Heat sealed vessel at 90 °C for 19 h.
Cool slowly to room temperature; crystals form on standing.

product_summary.name: (HNEt3)2[{Cl2(H2O)4}C(VO)16(OH)8(O4AsC6H5)2(O3AsC6H5)8]·6CH3CN
product_summary.notes: Blue crystals obtained after short crystallization period

name: Tea Decoration Acid
reagents.comments: 0.5 mmol, exact identity not fully specified

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.290 g VCl3 (1.10 mmol), 0.103 g Tea Decoration Acid (0.5 mmol), 0.08 mL NEt3, and 25 mL CH3CN. Reflux at 80 °C for 30 minutes.
Transfer the filtered solution to a recrystallization chamber. After 1 hour, blue crystals appear.

product_summary.name: H5[{Cl4(H2O)2}CC(VO)16(O3AsC6H5)8]Cl·4H2O·3CH3CN
product_summary.notes: Multiple crystal forms depending on additional Dy(NO3)3

name: Dysprosium nitrate hydrate
Dy(NO3)3·xH2O
reagents.comments: Optional step for green crystals after 3 weeks

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.290 g VBr3 (1.10 mmol), 0.103 g Tea Decoration Acid (0.5 mmol), 0.08 mL NEt3, and 25 mL CH3CN. Reflux at 80 °C for 30 minutes, then filter.
procedure_steps.comments: Initial step to form a blue product

procedure_steps.description: Transfer the solution to a recrystallization chamber. Blue crystals form after ~1 hour.
procedure_steps.comments: Alternatively, if Dy(NO3)3 is added (0.149 g), after 3 weeks green crystals can be isolated.

product_summary.name: (HNEt3)2[{Br2(H2O)4}C(V)O16(OH)8(O4AsC6H5)2(O3AsC6H5)8]·6CH3CN
product_summary.notes: Blue crystals produced after brief crystallization

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.290 g VBr3 (1.10 mmol), 0.103 g Tea Decoration Acid (0.5 mmol), 0.08 mL NEt3, and 25 mL CH3CN. Reflux at 80 °C for 30 minutes.
Transfer the filtrate to a recrystallization container. Blue crystals form after about 1 hour.
Dissolve 1.16 g CsVO3 in 100 mL water at 90 °C.
Add 180 µL conc. HBr; stir 1 min.
Maintain 90–95 °C for 1 h (pH ≈ 8.2). Adjust to pH 7.9–8.0 with 47 % HBr while heating.
If pH unchanged, continue heating for 1.5 h.
Cool slowly to 20 °C; black crystals form.

product_summary.name: Cs9[H14V18O42I]·12H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystal formation after controlling pH to ~7.9

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.16 g CsVO3 (5.0 mmol) in 100 mL water at 90 °C.
Add 180 µL of 100% H2O2 (3.7 mmol) with stirring for 1 min.
Place mixture in oil bath at 90–95 °C for several hours.
Adjust pH to 7.9 with 57% HI and keep it stable.

apparatus.notes: Used for heating at 75 °C for 16 h

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 4.0 g NEt4BF4 (18.43 mmol) in 200 mL H2O. Add 1.65 g (NH4)8[H9V19O50]·11H2O (0.78 mmol) and 1.0 g NaN3 (15.38 mmol).
Transfer to a 300 mL crystallization bottle. Heat at 75 °C for 16 h.
Yellow-green crystals form upon cooling. Store them in a sealed container under nitrogen.

product_summary.name: [(CoII)3V18O42(H2O)12(XO4)]·24H2O
product_summary.notes: Dark brown pillars, possibly containing Co in the framework

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.5 mmol V2O5 in 10 mL water (pH 8.4-8.6). Quickly add 3 mL LiOH·H2O solution (5 mmol) and 2.5 mmol H2SO4. React ~10 min.
procedure_steps.comments: pH shifts from ~8.6 down to ~4.6 eventually

procedure_steps.description: Filter the brown solution, titrate volume to 25 mL (pH ~4.6). Add 1.25 mmol CoSO4·6H2O and stir for ~7 h.
Store the solution at room temperature for 12 h. Dark brown pillar crystals form.
Filter, wash crystals with water, and air dry.

product_summary.name: [(FeII)3V18O42(H2O)12(XO4)]·24H2O
product_summary.notes: Dark brown pillar crystals containing Fe(II)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.5 mmol V2O5 in 10 mL water (pH 8.4-8.6). Quickly add 3 mL LiOH·H2O (5 mmol) and 2.5 mmol H2SO4. React about 10 min.
Filter the brown solution, titrate volume to 25 mL (pH 4.6). Add 1.25 mmol FeCl2·4H2O, stir for ~7 h.
Store at room temperature for 12 h. Dark brown pillar crystals form.
Filter, wash with water, and air dry to isolate crystals.

name: Acetic acid solution (1.4 M)
reagents.comments: Used for partial dissolution with V2O5 solution

apparatus.notes: Used for 3 h stirring and slow cooling

procedure_steps.description: Mix 1.4 M acetic acid solution with 0.6 M V2O5 solution, heat for 3 h, filter hot to remove white crystalline byproduct ((n-C4H9)6NH3VO3).
Dissolve 375 mg (n-C4H9)6N H3VO3 (6.16 mmol), 253 mg VOSO4·5H2O (1.1 mmol), 0.2 mL n-C4H9NH2 (0.22 mmol), and 5 mL H2O in the steel reactor.
Stir in the sealed reactor for 3 h, then cool slowly. Filter to obtain brownish-red crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Slow cooling step fosters crystal growth

procedure_steps.description: Add 3 mL LiOH solution (5 mmol) to 10 mL aqueous V2O5 (2.5 mmol); keep at 90 °C.
Add solid MnSO4·H2O (2.5 mmol); stir 5–10 min until black precipitate forms.
Add KMnO4 (1.25 mmol); continue heating 1 h.
Filter hot and let filtrate stand 12 h; deep-black rod-like crystals form.

product_summary.name: (NH4)8[V19O41(OH)9]·11H2O
product_summary.notes: Dark brown solid, stored under inert atmosphere

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.8 g NH4VO3 (68.4 mmol) in 250 mL water at 75 °C. Adjust pH to 5.8 with 10% H2SO4 solution.
Cool solution in an ice bath to 70 °C, add 1.37 g H2SO4 (10.5 mmol). Color changes from yellow → dark blue → green → purple → dark brown.
Filter the reaction product, wash with 10% H2SO4. Then increase pH of solution to 7.3.
procedure_steps.comments: Dark brown solution or precipitate forms

procedure_steps.description: Place solution in oil bath at 65–70 °C for 5 h without stirring. A dark brown solid forms.
Filter the black solid, wash with 2-propanol and ether, dry in air. Store product under N2.
Combine R1–R5; stir at 80 °C for 30 min.
Cool to room temperature and stir 1 h.
Filter; let filtrate stand 2 weeks to obtain green crystals.
Dissolve 16 g NEt4ClO4 in 250 mL water.
Add 6.6 g (NH4)8[HV19O50]·11H2O; heat at 75 °C for 60 h.
Filter hot; black crystals form on cooling.
Dissolve 0.111 g Dy(NO3)3 ⋅ xH2O, 0.155 g VCl3, 0.103 g benzoic acid, 0.08 mL NEt3 and 25 mL CH3CN.
Stir the solution at 80 °C for 30 minutes.
Cool the solution to room temperature.
Grind the mixture for 1 hour.
Filter the mixture.
Let the filtrate stand quietly for 2 weeks to obtain green crystals.

product_summary.name: K10[V16O18]·20H2O
product_summary.notes: Dark-red stripe crystals obtained after overnight standing.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.45 g KVO3 (R1) in 50 mL water (R2).
Add 0.182 mL glacial acetic acid (R3).
Maintain the mixture at 90 °C.
After the solution turns dark-red, adjust pH to 3.8 with additional acetic acid (R3).
Continue heating for 2 h.
Filter the hot solution.
Allow the filtrate to cool to room temperature and stand overnight; stripe-shaped dark-red crystals form the next day.
Add 0.4 g [t-BuNH3]4[V4O12] and 0.8 g NaN3 dissolved in 20 mL water.
Adjust the pH to 9.4 using KOH solution.
Add 2 mL of MeOH.
Irradiate the solution with a 500W high-pressure mercury lamp for 6.5 hours.
Add 0.4 g [t-BuNH3]4[V4O12] and 0.25 g KH2PO4 dissolved in 20 mL water.
Adjust the pH to 9.4 using KOH solution.
Add 2 mL of MeOH.
Irradiate the solution with a 500W high-pressure mercury lamp for 18 hours.
Dissolve 1.0 g Na3VO4 in 20 mL water.
Add 28 g H3BO3 to the solution.
Adjust the pH to 7.0.
Add 2 mL of MeOH.
Irradiate the solution with a 500W high-pressure mercury lamp for 3 days.
Dissolve 1.6 g [t-BuNH3]4[V4O12] in 40 mL water in a 50 mL Pyrex tube.
Adjust the pH to 6.8 using K2CO3 solution.
Adjust the pH to 9.4 with MeOH.
Irradiate the solution with a 500W high-pressure mercury lamp for 2 days.
Add 4 mL of ethanol and KCl solution.
Filter the solution after 1 day.

product_summary.name: K9.5[H3.5V18O42Cl]·11.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Dark green block-shaped crystals obtained as the original material

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.4 g [t-BuNH3]4[V4O12] in 20 mL water in a 20 mL Pyrex tube.
Adjust the pH to 6.8 using K2CO3 solution.
Adjust the pH to 9.5 with MeOH.
Irradiate the solution with a 500W high-pressure mercury lamp for 9 hours.
Add 2 mL of ethanol and KCl solution.
Filter the solution after 1 day.
Add 0.5 g [t-BuNH3]4[V4O12] dissolved in 20 mL water.
Adjust the pH to 9.5 with K2CO3 solution.
Add 2 mL of MeOH.
Irradiate the solution with a 500W high-pressure mercury lamp for 1 day.
Slowly add 13.8 g Nb2O5 (R1) into 26 g molten KOH (R2) in a nickel crucible.
Heat the melt for 30 min.
Cool the reaction to room temperature.
Dissolve the solidified mass in 100 mL deionized water (R3).
Filter to remove insoluble matter.
Evaporate the filtrate to 50 mL.
Store the concentrate at 0 °C for 12 h to crystallize flakes.
Filter the crystals.
Wash the product with methanol (R4) followed by ethanol (R5).
Vacuum-dry the washed crystals.
Melt Nb2O5 (R1) with 85 % KOH (R2) in a sealed system (mass ratio 1:8).
Maintain the melt until reaction completes; allow to solidify on cooling.
Dissolve the solidified mass in excess water (R3).
Filter the solution.
Wash the product repeatedly with 95 % ethanol (R4).
Dry the washed solid under nitrogen.

name: Sodium acetate aqueous solution
NaAc solution
reagents.comments: Used instead of ethanol for recrystallization

procedure_steps.description: In a nickel crucible under heating, dissolve Nb2O5 in 85% KOH solution (molar ratio 1:8) until a molten state is reached.
Cool the mixture to remove excess KOH.
Add NaAc aqueous solution to recrystallize the product.
Wash the crystals with 95% ethanol.
Dry the product in air.

product_summary.name: Li7K[Nb6O19]·15H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystals formed after cooling; purity improved by recrystallization.

procedure_steps.description: Heat 679 mL 1 M LiOH solution (R1) to 90 °C.
Add 2.00 g K7[Nb6O19]·14H2O (R2) and 10 mL water (R3); stir until dissolved.
Cool the solution to 25 °C and allow to stand for several hours; crystals form.
Filter the crystals.
Wash the solid with 50 mL ethanol (R4).
Air-dry the washed product.
Dissolve 9.4 g KOH (R1) in 75 mL water (R2) to prepare a 1 M solution.
Heat the solution with stirring to 90 °C until steam appears.
Gradually add 16 g Nb2O5·xH2O (R3) in ~0.5 g portions, ensuring each portion dissolves before the next.
Cool the clear solution to room temperature.
Let the solution stand for 12–48 h; yellow crystals form.
Collect the yellow crystals by filtration.
Add 50 g of 50% aqueous RbOH solution.
Heat and stir the solution at around 90 °C until steam appears.
Slowly add 21 g of Nb2O5·xH2O.
Add 14.6 g of 50% aqueous CsOH solution.
Heat and stir the solution at around 90 °C until steam appears.
Slowly add 5 g of Nb2O5·xH2O.
Add 2.0 g of 50% aqueous RbOH solution and 8 mL water to obtain a 2 mol·L-1 solution.
Under stirring, heat the solution to about 90 °C.
Slowly add 2 g of Nb2O5·xH2O to obtain a clear solution.
Cool the solution to room temperature.
Add 4.5 g of 50% aqueous CsOH solution.
Add 15 mL of water to obtain a 1 M solution.
Under stirring, heat the solution to about 90 °C.
Slowly add 0.7 g of Nb2O5·xH2O to obtain a clear solution.
Cool the solution to room temperature.
Introduce 10 mL 1 M KOH solution (R1) into the reaction vessel.
Slowly add 1.0 g Nb2O5·xH2O (R2) while stirring.
Boil the mixture until dissolution is complete.
Cool to room temperature and allow crystals to form.
Filter the crystalline product.
Dissolve 114 mg K7[HNb6O19]·13H2O, 58 mg NaCl, and 42 mg LiCl in 4 mL water.
Stir the solution.
Add 4 mL of n-butyl alcohol and stir vigorously.
Heat the mixture at 80 °C for 30 minutes.
Cool the solution to room temperature.
Filter the solution.
Let the filtrate stand at room temperature for several days to obtain yellow transparent block crystals.

apparatus.notes: Used to cover the reaction mixture

procedure_steps.description: Add 178.2 g Nb(OC2H5)5 and 127.5 g [N(CH3)4]OH solution in 200 mL methanol and 25 mL aqueous solution.
Cover with a semi-permeable membrane and let stand for 24 hours.
Filter the obtained substance.
Wash the filtered solid with ether on an inclined filter.
Store the product [N(CH3)4]6[Nb10O28]·6H2O in a desiccator.
Add 5 mL of NaOH/methanol solution to the remaining half of the permeable solution.
Cover and let the solution stand for 24 hours.
Filter the obtained substance.
Wash the filtered solid with ethanol on an inclined filter.
Store the product [N(CH3)4]4Na2[Nb10O28]·8H2O·1/2CH3OH in a desiccator.
Add 1.0 g TBA4H3[HNb6O19]·13H2O (R1) to 10 mL water (R2).
Filter while heating to remove insoluble matter.
Add 7 mL 1 M HCl (R3) to the hot filtrate.
Filter and collect the orange solution.
Wash the solid three times with 120 mL water (R4) in total.
Evaporate under vacuum and dry overnight over P2O5 (R5).

product_summary.name: (TBA)4[Nb10O34]·H2O
product_summary.notes: Product obtained after THF recrystallization and vacuum drying.

procedure_steps.description: Add 1.0 g TBA4H3[HNb6O19]·7H2O (R1) to 20 mL THF (R2).
Purge with N2 gas (R3) for 6 min.
Filter the suspension.
Recrystallize by adding 0.8 mL acetic acid (R4).
Filter and collect the crystals.
Dry the product under vacuum.
Add 0.95 g Rb6[HNb6O19]·14H2O, 0.48 g Cu(NO3)2·2.5H2O, and 10 g ethylenediamine to 10 mL water.
Stir the blue solution at 60 °C for 30 min.
Seal the mixture in a crystallization dish and leave undisturbed.
Collect violet hexagonal crystals by filtration.

product_summary.name: (K19Na4)[H10Nb31O93(CO3)]·35H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystals obtained by very slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.0 g K7[HNb6O19]·13H2O and 0.4 g 3-aminopropylphosphonic acid in 8 mL water.
Seal the solution in an autoclave and heat at 200 °C for 3 days.
Cool to room temperature and filter off ~0.7 g white flocculent solid.
Allow the clear filtrate to evaporate very slowly in air for 1 week.
Collect 0.2–0.3 g colorless crystals of (K19Na4)[H10Nb31O93(CO3)]·35H2O.
Dissolve K7[HNb6O19]·13H2O and 3-aminopropylphosphonic acid in water (8 mL).
Heat the sealed mixture at 200 °C for 3 days.
Cool, filter off white flocculent solid (~0.7 g).
Let the filtrate evaporate slowly (≈1 week).
Collect 0.2–0.3 g of (K13Na3)[HNb27O76]·25H2O crystals.
To 10 mL water add 0.176 g 1,4-diaminobutane and 0.2 g Cu(Ac)2·H2O, stir to dissolve.
Add 0.685 g K7[HNb6O19]·13H2O; solution turns purple.
Adjust pH to 10.5–11 with 1 M NaOH.
Heat at 50–60 °C for 5 h, reducing the volume to 35 mL.
Filter the hot solution and transfer to a 50 mL crystallization dish.
Allow slow evaporation at 15 °C for 3 weeks.
Collect colorless crystals of KNa2[Nb24O72H21]·38H2O (0.3 g).
Dissolve 0.246 g isophthalic acid and 0.2 g Cu(Ac)2·H2O in 20 mL water.
Add 0.685 g K7[HNb6O19]·13H2O.
Adjust pH to 10.6–11.5 with 1 M NaOH.
Heat at 55–60 °C for 5 h.
Quickly filter hot to remove purple solution; obtain clear filtrate.
Stand at 15 °C for slow evaporation; colorless block crystals appear after 4 weeks.
Collect 0.23 g crystals.
Dissolve 0.685 g K7[HNb6O19]·13H2O in 50 mL water containing 10 % acetic acid.
Adjust pH to 9.0 with 1 M NaOH.
Add 0.148 g 1,3-diaminopropane dropwise while maintaining pH 10.0–11.5 with NaOH.
Stir at 50–60 °C, reduce volume to 35 mL.
Filter and transfer the clear solution to a crystallization dish.
Allow slow evaporation at 15 °C for 3 weeks.
Collect 0.29 g colorless block crystals of K12[Nb24O72H21]·107H2O.
Dissolve 0.6 g Cu(Ac)2⋅H2O in 25 mL water.
Add 1.2 g K7[HNb6O19]⋅13H2O and 0.58 g sodium acetate dissolved in 50 mL water.
Gradually heat the combined solution to 50–60 °C.
Cool the solution to room temperature and let it stand for 1 week.

apparatus.notes: Used as reaction vessel for molten fusion.

procedure_steps.description: Slowly add 10 g Ta2O5 to 40 g molten KOH in a nickel crucible.
Maintain fusion for 30 min to complete reaction.
Allow the fused mass to cool to room temperature.
Dissolve the solid in 100 mL water and concentrate to 25 mL by evaporation.
Store the concentrated solution at 0 °C for 12 h to crystallize needle‐like product.
Filter the crystals.
Wash with 1:1 ethanol/water mixture.
Dry the product under vacuum.

product_summary.name: [Na6(H2O)13][Li(H2O)(H3O)][Ta6O19]
product_summary.notes: Colorless transparent crystals formed on standing.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 167 mg K8[Ta6O19]·17H2O in 4 mL water under stirring.
Add 58 mg NaCl and 42 mg LiCl sequentially with stirring.
Introduce 4 mL n-butanol and stir vigorously to form biphasic mixture.
Adjust pH to 10.36 with dilute HCl.
Heat at 80 °C with stirring for 30 min.
Cool, filter, and leave filtrate to stand at room temperature to crystallize colorless blocks.
Keep 15 mL 30 % H2O2 in ice bath (5–10 °C) and add 1.75 g TaCl5 slowly to form yellow solution.
Add 4 mL 50 % RbOH dropwise; O2 evolves, yielding pale yellow peroxotantalate.
Add 30 mL methanol to precipitate white solid; cool to 5 °C, add 20 mL ether, filter and dry (gives Rb3Ta2(O2)4 precursor).
Dissolve 5 g Rb3Ta2(O2)4 in 50 mL 0.2 M RbOH at 85 °C, add 0.007 g Na3VO4, stir 20 min, reduce volume to 10–15 mL.
Cool, add 0.45 mL ethanol, stand at 4 °C 1–2 days to crystallize Na8[Ta6O19]·23H2O.
Dissolve 3.2 g product in 78 mL water, slowly add 310 mL 0.31 M NaOH, heat to 90 °C then cool; form white block crystals.
Evaporate solvent in air for 3 days to obtain Na8[Ta6O19]·15H2O.
Dissolve 3.44 g TaCl5(O2CNEt2)3 in 50 mL anhydrous diethyl ether (pale yellow).
Add 0.27 g sodium metal; solution colour changes over 72 h from pale yellow to pale brown.
Filter to remove metallic residue; evaporate filtrate to dryness under vacuum.
Dissolve residue in 50 mL pentane; precipitate pale-yellow solid.
Filter and wash with pentane; dry to obtain product.

product_summary.name: [Ta8O10(OEt)20]
product_summary.notes: Yellow solid obtained; NMR indicates partial decomposition

name: Ethanol
reagents.comments: Initial volume; additional ethanol is added up to 1.25 hₘ, where hₘ is the molar amount of H2O to Ta atoms

procedure_steps.description: At room temperature, slowly add a solution of 7.0 g Ta2(OEt)10 to a mixture of 50 mL ethanol, 20 mL methanol and 0.16 mL water.
Stir the reaction mixture at room temperature for one week.
Add additional ethanol (up to 1.25 hₘ relative to Ta atoms) and mix thoroughly at room temperature for 10 days while slowly evaporating the solvent to reduce the volume to 30 mL.
Store the resultant yellow solid at -20 °C.
Add 0.04 mL water dropwise to 40 mL i-propanol containing 1.90 g Ta(i-PrO)5 at room temperature.
Allow the solution to stand for one week with slow solvent evaporation.
Collect yellow crystals, filter, and air-dry.

name: Water
reagents.comments: Added slowly in a molar ratio h = 1.0 (H2O:Ta atoms)

procedure_steps.description: Mix 4.45 g Ta(t-BuOH)5 with 35 mL t-BuOH and 35 mL toluene.
Slowly add 0.16 mL of water while the solution stands at room temperature.
Evaporate the solvent under vacuum to obtain 5 mL of residue.
Heat the residue to 235 °C.
Mix BaCl2 and Ba2N in a 1:1 molar ratio.
Place the mixture in an alumina crucible and roast at 1273 K.
Cool the crucible to room temperature.
Mix 5 g precursor and 9.5 mL 1 M (n-Bu4N)OH in CH3OH; add 30 mL MeCN and filter.
Allow filtrate to evaporate 24 h at 25 °C to give yellow oily phase.
Wash oil with anhydrous ether, dissolve residue in 20 mL Et2O; yellow crystals form within hours.
Filter and dry crystals.

product_summary.name: [(n-C4H9)4N]2[Mo2O7]
product_summary.notes: Yellow plate crystals after low-temperature layering.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.58 g precursor in 20 mL CH2Cl2; slowly add 4.8 mL 1 M (n-Bu4N)OH with stirring for 20 min.
Filter, evaporate filtrate to thick residue and add 15 mL Et2O; stir 20 min and filter.
Re-dissolve crude solid in CH2Cl2, layer with ether and store at –10 °C 24 h; yellow crystals form in 12 h at RT.
Filter and dry product.
Dissolve pre-isolated [Mo5O17H]3- in a CH3CN/Et2O mixture (ratio not specified).
Add 10 mL CH3CN solution of 1.0 g [(n-Bu4N)2[Mo2O7]] at 1 mL min-1.
Quickly add 1.0 mL water while stirring.
Allow white amorphous precipitate to form.
Filter and collect 190 mg of product.
Dissolve 1.0 g [(n-Bu4N)2[MoO4]] in 10 mL HCl solution (pH 5–6).
Stir, filter the mixture, and obtain a white powder.

name: (n-C4H9)4N salt
reagents.comments: 99% purity; used in 6 mL organic solvent

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.50 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 10 mL water.
Add 9.2 mL of 6 M HCl solution and shake for 1 minute.
Add 1.21 g of the quaternary ammonium salt dissolved in 6 mL organic solvent.
Heat the mixture to 75–80 °C and stir for 45 minutes until the white precipitate turns yellow.
Filter the filtrate, wash the product with 80 mL hot ethanol at 60 °C, cool to -20 °C, then filter and dry in a vacuum oven for 12 hours.
Dissolve 8 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 100 mL DMF and stir.
Slowly heat the solution to the boiling point of 48 mL acetic acid until it boils.
Add 33 mL concentrated HCl, then heat and filter the precipitate.
Dissolve the precipitate in 1 M ethanol solution and dry in 100 mL DMF solution.
procedure_steps.comments: Followed by filtering, washing, and drying to yield the product

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 4.0 g [(n-C4H9)4N]2[α-Mo8O26] in 20 mL acetonitrile and heat the solution to its boiling point.
Add 4.0 mL concentrated HCl solution.
Precipitate by filtering and cool the mixture to room temperature to obtain yellow crystalline solid.
Dissolve 2.15 g (Bu4N)4[α-Mo6O26], 0.43 g DCC, and 1.0 g ethyl propanedinitrile polymer in 20 mL anhydrous benzene and stir.
While stirring, add the complete alkali mixture.
Stir the mixture and heat to 110 °C until the solution turns yellow and flows, indicating formation of the desired product.
procedure_steps.comments: An orange disulfide may form concurrently

characterization.comments: NMR shows formation of partial decomposition products and ester polymer

procedure_steps.description: Add 10 g MoO3, 2.4 g NaOH, and 50 mL water to the reaction vessel and dissolve the reagents.
Heat the solution to 50 °C to evaporate water until the volume reduces to 10 mL.
Cool the solution to 25 °C to allow crystallization of Na6[Mo7O24]·4H2O.
Filter the precipitated crystals.
Wash the crystals with absolute ethanol.
Dry the crystals under vacuum at 24 °C.

product_summary.name: [(n-C4H9)4N]4[α-Mo8O26]
product_summary.notes: White crystals obtained after drying under vacuum.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.25 g Na2Mo2O4·2H2O in 3 mL water and add 1.0 mL 6 M HCl to adjust the pH to about 4.5.
Add 0.80 g (n-C4H9)4NCl to the solution.
Filter the obtained precipitate and wash it with acetone and diethyl ether.
Dissolve the crude product in 10 mL of methanol/CH3CN mixture.
Place the solution in a refrigerator at 0 °C.
Dry the cooled solution under vacuum to obtain white crystals.
Dissolve 5.00 g Na2Mo2O4·2H2O in 12 mL water.
Add 5.17 mL of 6.0 M HCl to the solution and stir vigorously for 1-2 minutes.
Add 3.34 g (n-C4H9)4NBr dissolved in 10 mL water, immediately forming a white powder.
Stir the mixture for 10 minutes.
Filter and collect the precipitate, then sequentially wash with 20 mL water, 20 mL ethanol, and 20 mL diethyl ether.
Dry the crude product in a desiccator over P2O5 at 100 °C for 24 hours to obtain colorless block crystals.

product_summary.name: [(n-C4H9)4N]3K[b-Mo8O26]·2H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals obtained after vacuum filtration.

procedure_steps.description: Combine 0.38 g [(n-C4H9)4N]4[α-Mo8O26], 10 mL CH3CN, 0.1 g KBr, and 18 mL water in a reaction vessel.
Maintain the mixture at 0 °C for 24 hours to promote crystallization.
Perform vacuum suction filtration to collect the colorless crystals.
Combine Na2MoO4·2H2O, CuSO4·5H2O, 4,4′-bipy·2H2O and nicotinic acid in 18 mL water.
Adjust pH to 2.4 with dilute acid.
Transfer mixture to an autoclave and heat at 170 °C for 48 h.
Cool to room temperature; blue crystals form.
Wash crystals with ethanol and dry.

product_summary.name: [Me3N(CH2)6NMe3]2[y-Mo8O26]·2H2O
product_summary.notes: Small, well-shaped crystals formed after overnight standing.

procedure_steps.description: Add 4.0 mL·L-1 Na2MoO4·2H2O solution and [Me3N(CH2)6NMe3]Cl2 dropwise.
Immediately add 1.0 M HCl to the solution to induce formation of a white precipitate.
Stir the mixture and filter under reduced pressure.
Let the filtrate stand overnight to allow small, well-shaped crystals to form.
Dissolve 1.235 g (NH4)6[Mo7O24]·4H2O in 15 mL water.
Add 0.913 g DBU to the solution.
Adjust the pH to 5.7 by adding 1.0 M HCl.
Heat the mixture to 110 °C for 24 hours.
Filter to isolate the pale yellow block crystals.
Wash the crystals with water and ethanol.
Dry the crystals at 85 °C.
Dissolve 0.72 g MoO3 and 0.380 g DBU in 20 mL water.
React the solution at 160 °C.
Filter the yellow crystalline product.
Wash the product with water, ethanol, and acetone.
Dry the product at room temperature.
Dissolve 0.040 g NiCl2·6H2O, 0.122 g MoO3, and 0.053 g 4,4'-bipyridine in 10 mL water.
React the solution at 160 °C for 72 hours.
Filter to collect 0.10 g of blue crystals.
Dissolve 0.046 g CuSO4·5H2O, 0.027 g MoO3, and 0.108 g μ-4,4'-bipyridine-typrpyz in 56 mL water in a reaction flask.
Heat the solution at 120 °C to obtain orange crystals.
Filter to collect the orange crystals.
Dissolve 0.255 mmol NiCl2⋅6H2O, 0.15 mmol (NH4)6[Mo7O24]⋅4H2O, 0.5 mmol phen and 9 mL water in air and stir for 15 minutes.
Transfer the solution to a tightly sealed 18 mL polymethylpentene reaction flask.
Heat the flask at 200 °C for 6 days.
Filter the hot solution to obtain green transparent crystals.
Wash the crystals three times with water.
Dry the crystals at room temperature.
Dissolve 0.187 g (0.159 mmol) (NH4)6[Mo7O24]⋅4H2O, 0.078 g Fe(CH3CO2)2, 0.086 g typrpyz, and 0.083 g H2O2P(CH2)2PO3H2 in 10.053 g water.
Heat the solution at 150 °C for 96 hours.
Dissolve 0.48 g Na2MoO4⋅2H2O in 10 mL water.
Add 0.54 g V2O5 and 3 mL of 85% H3PO4, then mix.
Slowly dilute the solution to 50 mL.
Heat the solution at 100 °C with stirring for 1.5 hours.
Cool to room temperature to obtain large red crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: No V2O5 detected in final product

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 177 mg (NH4)6[Mo7O24]⋅4H2O, 700 mg NH2OH⋅HCl, and 500 mg Bu4NBr in water.
Heat the solution to 90 °C under nitrogen for 10 hours.
Cool the solution to room temperature and evaporate to obtain a green oily product.
Repeat crystallization using a CH2Cl2/MeOH mixture to obtain dark green crystals.

characterization.comments: Theoretical: C 48.73, H 9.20, N 3.55, Mo 24.32; Experimental: C 48.85, H 9.30, N 3.49, Mo 24.48.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2 g hexamethylenetetramine in 20 mL water at room temperature.
Add 1.2 mL of 37% HCl solution.
Add 0.96 g Na2MoO4⋅2H2O and 0.07 g Na2S2O4 while stirring.
Observe the solution change from colorless to yellow, then green, then brown (pH 4.0–4.5).
Filter the mixture and fill the filtrate into a small bottle.
Allow the solution to stand for two weeks to form brown block-shaped crystals.
Dissolve 7.0 g Na2MoO4⋅2H2O, 50.0 g NaAc⋅3H2O, and 5.0 g NaCl in 300 mL water.
Add 61 mL of 1.0 M H2SO4 solution with stirring.
Add 75 mL acetic acid and heat the solution to 35 °C, stirring until the color changes to blue-green.
Allow the solution to cool to room temperature.
Filter the solution and wash the crystals with 20 mL cold water.
Suck dry and then dry the crystals with CaCl2.

characterization.comments: IR peaks: 3440, 3162, 1636, 1541, 712, 636, 565, 498, 411 cm^-1; Raman and UV-Vis data provided.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.0 g (NH4)2[Mo6O19]⋅4H2O in 25 mL water.
Add 0.8 mL acetic acid.
Add 0.20 g Na2S2O4 with stirring; after 5 minutes, add 3.00 g NaCl.
Allow the reaction to proceed for 5 hours.
Filter the mixture to obtain the crystalline precipitate, then wash with 50% ethanol and dry.

product_summary.name: (NH4)12Na20[H4Mo54O168(CH3COO)4]·ca.64H2O
product_summary.notes: Red amorphous aggregates obtained; product not suitable for catalytic experiments

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.00 g (NH4)7[Mo7O24]⋅4H2O and 0.5 g NaAc⋅3H2O in 25 mL water.
Add 3.0 mL of 1.0 M HCl solution.
Add 0.30 g Na2S2O4 while stirring; after 5 minutes, add 3.00 g NaCl.
Allow the solution to crystallize within 15-18 hours.

product_summary.name: (NH4)12Na20[H4Mo54O168(CH3COO)4]·ca.64H2O
product_summary.notes: Red amorphous aggregates obtained; product not suitable for catalytic experiments

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.00 g (NH4)7[Mo7O24]⋅4H2O and 0.5 g NaAc⋅3H2O in 25 mL water.
Add 0.8 mL of 100% HAC.
Add 0.30 g Na2S2O4 while stirring; after 5 minutes, add 3.00 g NaCl.
Allow the solution to crystallize within 12–15 hours.

product_summary.name: (H3O)16[(H2O)2MoO(OH)]2(Mo28Mo4(NO)4(BuSnO)2[BuSn(OH)2]2[O102(H2O)12]·18H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystals or white aggregates obtained after cooling.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.21 g n-BuSnO(OH) in 5 mL of 12 M HCl.
Add the above solution to a solution of 0.59 g Na2Mo4O13·2H2O dissolved in 10 mL water.
Add 0.12 g NH2OH·HCl dissolved in 3 mL water and stir the mixture.
Adjust the pH of the mixture to 2.50 using NaOH.
Cool the reaction mixture to room temperature to allow crystallization.
Dissolve Na2MoO4·2H2O, NH4OH·HCl and NH4Cl in 150 mL water (total solution 300 mL).
Add 1.5 mL 3.5 % HCl.
Reflux the mixture at 70–75 °C for 2 h while stirring.
Cool to 20 °C and store; red crystals form.
Wash crystals with small amounts of water and dry.

product_summary.name: (NH4)14[H14Mo37O112]·35H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals obtained after slow cooling.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 14 g (NH4)6[Mo7O24]·4H2O, 14 g NH4Cl, and 2 g N2H4·H2SO4 in 1.5 mL ice-acetone with 350 mL water.
Heat the solution to 100 °C until the color changes from blue to green and then to colorless.
Filter the hot solution.
Slowly cool the filtrate to room temperature over 1-2 weeks to form colorless crystals.
Dissolve 0.5 g [H3O]12+[Mo36O108(NO)4(H2O)16]12- and 0.2 g N2H4·HCl in 20 mL water.
Reflux the solution for 30 minutes.
Filter the red solution.
Slowly evaporate the filtrate at room temperature to obtain brown-red crystals.

product_summary.name: (NH4)42[Mo(VI)72Mo(V)60O372(CH3COO)30(H2O)72]·ca.300H2O·ca.10CH3COONH4
product_summary.notes: Reddish crystalline complex obtained after air cooling.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g (NH4)6[Mo7O24]·4H2O and 12.5 g CH3COONH4 in 250 mL water.
Add 0.8 g N2H4·H2SO4 and react for 10 minutes; the solution turns green.
Add 83 mL of 50% CH3COOH solution; the solution turns dark green.
Store the green solution in 500 mL redistilled water and allow it to air cool in a glass container for 4 days.
Wash and dry the reddish crystalline complex using ethanol rinse and air drying.

product_summary.name: Na26[Mo142O432(H2O)58H14]·ca. 300H2O
product_summary.notes: Red product obtained after 20 days reaction and vacuum drying.

procedure_steps.description: Grind 3.00 g Na2MoO4·2H2O and 1.00 g Na2SO4·10H2O in 20 mL of 5.00 M H2SO4 solution with 1.50 mL of 0.80 M H2SO4.
Let the mixture rest in a sealed beaker with a rubber stopper for 20 days.
Add 1.90 g NaCl; the solution changes to red.
Filter the red solution and vacuum dry below 7 °C.

product_summary.name: Na15[Mo144O409(OH)28(H2O)56]·ca. 250H2O
product_summary.notes: Blue-black crystals obtained after prolonged standing and drying.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 50 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 450 mL water and gradually add 32% H2SO4 to adjust the pH to 0.8.
procedure_steps.comments: pH adjusted to 0.8 during acid addition.

procedure_steps.description: Add 500 mg iron powder and mix at 20 °C until crystals appear.
After 24 hours, add an additional 500 mg iron powder until the solution turns dark blue.
Allow the reaction mixture to stand for 5–6 weeks without stirring.
Separate the blue-black crystals using a glass sand funnel in a nitrogen stream and dry in an air current at room temperature.
Dissolve 3.04 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 25 mL water.
Add 2.7 mL of 32% HCl and stir the solution.
Add 0.15 g Na2S2O4 to form a blue reaction mixture.
After 5 minutes, add 1 mL ethanol to the blue mixture.
Dry the mixture in a sealed container at room temperature for 7 days.
Wash the blue solid with cold water and dry in an air current at room temperature.

product_summary.name: Na16[Mo152O429(μ3-O)28H14(H2O)66.5]·ca.·~300H2O
product_summary.notes: Deep blue precipitate obtained with ~45% theoretical Mo(V) content.

apparatus.notes: 100 mL glass funnel used for filtration

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6.00 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 40 mL water.
Add 15 mL of 10% HCl and stir.
Add 0.58 g SnCl2·2H2O; the solution becomes deep blue and a deep blue precipitate forms.
Filter the reaction mixture through a 100 mL glass funnel and wash the precipitate with water.
Dry the washed precipitate in an air current at room temperature.

product_summary.name: Na15[Mo(VI)126Mo(V)28O462H14(H2O)70]0.5·[Mo(VI)124Mo(V)28O457H14(H2O)68]0.5·400H2O
product_summary.notes: Blue solid product obtained; theoretical content ~45%.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.04 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 25 mL water.
Add 2.7 mL of 32% HCl to the solution.
Add 0.15 g Na2S2O4 to the stirred mixture to form a blue reaction mixture.
Let the reaction mixture stand for 1 day in a closed container at room temperature.
Filter the blue solid product.
Wash the product rapidly with a small amount of water.
procedure_steps.comments: Wash quickly if solution is hot.

procedure_steps.description: Dry the product in an air current at room temperature.
Dissolve 7.46 g Na2MoO4·2H2O, 1.19 g NH4VO3, and 12.83 g NH2OH·HCl in 9.5 mL of 3.5% HCl.
Dilute the acid solution with 200 mL water and stir for 1–2 minutes.
Place the mixture into a 300 mL autoclave with Teflon liner.
React the solution at 65–70 °C.
After cooling, filter the green precipitate.
Dry the filtered product at 70 °C.

product_summary.name: Na22{[Mo(VI)36O112(H2O)16][Mo(VI)130Mo(V)20O442(OH)10(H2O)61]}·180H2O
product_summary.notes: Small blue rod-like crystals obtained after rediffusion crystallization.

procedure_steps.description: Mix Solutions A, B, and C with Solutions D and E at a slow dropwise rate of 4 mL/h.
Transfer the mixed solution into a 500 mL reactor and stir under flowing conditions for 24 hours; blue rod-like crystals appear.
After 2 days, filter the product for rediffusion crystallization.

product_summary.name: Na16[(MoO3)176(H2O)63(CH3OH)17H16]·600H2O·6CH3OH
product_summary.notes: Dark blue crystals obtained after air drying.

procedure_steps.description: Mix 60 mL of 0.5 M Na2MoO4·2H2O solution with 7.3 mL of 25% H2SO4.
Add 30 mL methanol and 0.14 g surfactant; stir continuously for 5 minutes.
Open the sealed container and allow natural evaporation for 7 days to obtain dark blue crystals.
Dry the crystals with flowing air.

product_summary.name: Na48[HxMo368O1032(H2O)240(SO4)48]·ca. 1000H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystals obtained after two weeks of storage.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.15 g Na2S2O4 in a solution containing 3 g Na2MoO4·2H2O dissolved in 10 mL deionized water.
Add 35 mL of 0.5 M H2SO4 acidic solution and allow the solution to gradually transform.
Store the solution in a closed vessel for two weeks until crystals precipitate.
Filter the precipitated crystals.
Dissolve 1 g Cs2WO4 and 0.07 g WO3⋅H2O in 1.5 mL water at 20 °C under constant stirring.
Filter the solution to separate solids, then let the filtrate stand for a few hours (pH ≈ 8) to obtain the product.
Dissolve 10 mL of 1 M Na2WO4 solution with 0.7 g tungstic acid.
Heat the mixture under reflux at 150–180 °C for 3 weeks.
Separate the white powder by conventional supercentrifugation.

product_summary.name: K7[H5W9O19]·10H2O
product_summary.notes: Crystalline product of K7[H5W9O19]·10H2O obtained after recrystallization.

procedure_steps.description: In a sealed container, remove carbon dioxide.
Dissolve 11.2 g K2WO4 and 1.25 g WO3⋅H2O in 12.5 mL water containing 2 M acetic acid; the solution turns from yellow‐green to pale yellow.
Filter and slowly evaporate the solvent over one month to obtain a crystalline solid.
Filter and extract the product; recrystallize by adding K7[HW5O19]·10H2O to obtain two types of crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Both crystal types obtained in good yields.

procedure_steps.description: Under nitrogen at 20 °C, dissolve 45 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 5 g WO3⋅H2O in 50 mL water; shake for 30 minutes.
Allow WO3 to settle and decant the clear solution.
Add ethanol to the decanted solution and wait about 15 minutes for a white precipitate to form.
Dry the white precipitate in air.
procedure_steps.comments: Crystals obtained are stable in dry air but convert in damp conditions.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.7 g WO3⋅H2O in 10 mL of 1 M Na2WO4·2H2O solution.
Heat the mixture in a sealed tube at 150–180 °C for 24–48 hours.
Cool and decant the clear solution.
Add ethanol to the decanted solution and wait about 15 minutes for a white precipitate to form.

product_summary.name: [(n-C4H9)4N]2[W6O19]
product_summary.notes: White precipitate converted to clear colorless crystals after DMSO treatment

amount_details.unit: g (in 50 mL ethyl acetate) and 40 mL n-butyl bromide

apparatus.notes: Used for initial heating and reaction transfer

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 33 g Na2WO4·2H2O, 40 mL acetic acid, and 30 mL DMF in 250 mL of the mixed solvent.
Heat the solution to 100 °C and stir for 3 hours to form a yellowish viscous paste.
Transfer the paste into a beaker containing 18 mL of 12 M HCl in 50 mL DMF.
Quickly filter to remove white insoluble solids.
Stir the filtrate while adding a mixture of ethyl acetate (with 15 g) and 40 mL n-butyl bromide to induce white precipitation.
Shake the mixture for 5 minutes.
Filter and extract the solid with 20 mL each of ethanol and methanol.
Allow solvent evaporation to yield 22.5 g of crude product.
Dissolve the product in 8 mL DMSO at 80 °C and let stand at room temperature for 2 days for recrystallization.
procedure_steps.comments: Recrystallized product is clear and colorless

product_summary.name: (Ph4P)2[W6O19]
product_summary.notes: Obtained WO3·H2O was converted to (Ph4P)2[W6O19] after processing

procedure_steps.description: Add 6 M HCl dropwise to 0.5 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 40 mL water to precipitate WO3·H2O.
Wash the WO3·H2O precipitate with water, then with acetone, and dry in a vacuum oven at room temperature.
In the obtained WO3·H2O, add 20 mL 30% H2O2 and 1.0 g Ph4PCl, stirring until a white precipitate forms.
Filter the solid, wash with 95% ethanol and diethyl ether, then dry under vacuum over CaCl2.
Precipitate WO3·H2O by adding 6 M HCl dropwise to 0.5 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 40 mL water.
Wash the precipitate with water, then with acetone, and dry in a vacuum oven at room temperature to obtain WO3·H2O.
In the obtained WO3·H2O, add 20 mL 30% H2O2 and 1.7 g (PPN)Cl, stirring until a white precipitate forms.
Filter the solid, wash with 95% ethanol and diethyl ether, and dry under vacuum over CaCl2.

product_summary.name: (C6H11N2)4[W6O19][BF4]
product_summary.notes: Yellow-brown solid obtained; recrystallization in DMSO yields clear crystals.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 0.1 g Na2HPO4·12H2O in 10 mL of [EMIM][BF4].
Stir the mixture at 150 °C for 10 hours.
After cooling to room temperature, filter, wash with ethanol, and dry under reduced pressure.
Dissolve 1.5 g [(n-Bu4N)4[W10O32]] in 8 mL CH3CN and 30 mL CH3OH.
Reflux for 24 h.
Cool to 0 °C; white precipitate forms.
Filter and air-dry the precipitate.
Recrystallize by dissolving in hot saturated solution (60 °C) and slow cooling to 25 °C.

product_summary.name: [(n-C4H9)4N]4[W10O32]
product_summary.notes: Yellow block crystals obtained; conversion to [W6O19]2- if recrystallized from DMSO

amount_details.quantity: 60 mL (ethanol, repeated 3 times), 100 mL (2-butanol, 2*), 100 mL (diethyl ether, 2*)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 16 g Na2WO4•2H2O in 100 mL boiling water; quickly stir.
Slowly add 33.5 mL boiling 3 M HCl; the white precipitate disappears instantly.
After 1–2 minutes of boiling, add 4.6 g tetrabutyl ammonium chloride solution in 10 mL water.
Filter and wash the resulting yellow solid with water, then boil repeatedly with ethanol and rewash with 2-butanol and diethyl ether.
Recrystallize the crude product from 10 mL hot DMF at 80 °C for 1 day to obtain yellow block crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Crystals may be redissolved and recrystallized further if desired

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.3 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 50 mL water.
Within 5 minutes, add 6 mL 1 M HCl and adjust pH to 2.1.
Filter and wash the solution for 3 days while cooling.
Add 1.7 g (Pr4N)Br in 30 mL solution to collect the precipitate.
Dry under vacuum, redissolve in CH3CN, and recrystallize.
Dissolve 9.1 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 16 g Na2HPO4·12H2O in 10 mL [EMIM][BF4].
Stir the mixture at 90 °C for 10 hours.
Cool to room temperature and let the solution evaporate slowly over 1–2 days to yield brownish-red crystals.
At 100 °C, slowly dissolve 4 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 450 mL water containing 50 mL of 1.0 M HCl.
Add additional 3 M HCl to rapidly precipitate a yellow solid.
Stir for 30 minutes, then filter and wash with 0.1 M HCl; dry in an oven at 100 °C.
Heat with stirring to dissolve 0.38 g Na2WO4 in 25 mL water; remove yellow impurities.
Allow the solution to evaporate to about 20 mL, then cool and filter within 2 hours to obtain a pure white solid.

name: Methanol
reagents.comments: Used again for final wash, unknown additional volume

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.0 g of Na6[H2W12O40] in 15 mL of 0.5 M HCl under nitrogen atmosphere.
Electrolyze at -410 mV with a Ag/AgCl electrode (3.5 M KCl).
Stir the mixture at 390 °C until color change is observed.
procedure_steps.comments: High temperature reported as 390 °C; possibly an error but taken as written

procedure_steps.description: Filter the reaction mixture.
Wash the filtrate with 2 mL of absolute ethanol.
Add 20 mL of methanol to the filtrate.
Filter the resulting solution.
Wash once more with methanol to obtain the final product.
Dry the product in vacuum.

characterization.comments: Text reports formula as [NH4]4H6[H2W12O40] but heading indicates (NH4)3H8[H2W12O40]

name: n-Bu4NBr
Tetrabutylammonium bromide
reagents.comments: 1.6 g + 0.96 g used in two steps

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6.5 g Na6[H2W12O40] in 40 mL of HCl solution (pH 3).
Add the acidic solution to 50 mL of CH2Cl2 containing 1.6 g n-Bu4NBr, stir vigorously, allow layers to separate, and collect the lower layer.
Stir the upper layer with 40 mL CH2Cl2 containing 0.96 g n-Bu4NBr, allow layers to separate, combine lower layer with previous one.
Dry the combined organic phase overnight with MgSO4.
Filter off MgSO4, then concentrate the filtrate to ~25 mL.
procedure_steps.comments: Concentration under reduced pressure or by evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Under vigorous stirring, add ethyl acetate dropwise until precipitation begins, then store in a refrigerator.
Filter the precipitated solid, wash with a CH2Cl2/ethyl acetate mixture (1:1), and air dry.

name: CH2Cl2
Dichloromethane
reagents.comments: Used in 1:1 ratio with ethyl acetate in final step

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6.7 g Na6[H2W12O40] in 25 mL of HCl solution (pH 3).
Add the acidic solution to 50 mL ethyl acetate containing 4.2 g (C5H13)4NBr, stir vigorously and leave for 30 min to separate layers.
Dry the collected layer overnight with MgSO4, then filter.
Under vigorous stirring, add 1.6 g Pr4NBr in 20 mL of ethyl acetate/CH2Cl2 (1:1) dropwise.
Filter the precipitate, wash with isopropanol and acetonitrile, air dry.
Recrystallize the crude product from MeCN/CH2Cl2 to obtain white crystals.

name: Bu4NBr
Tetrabutylammonium bromide
reagents.comments: Used in two portions: 0.93 g + 0.42 g

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.4 g of [NH4]4H8[H2W12O40] in 35 mL of HCl solution (pH 3).
Add to 40 mL CH2Cl2 containing 0.93 g Bu4NBr, stir vigorously, separate layers, collect lower solution.
Stir the upper layer with 30 mL CH2Cl2 containing 0.42 g Bu4NBr, combine lower solution with previous one.
Dry overnight with MgSO4, then concentrate to 25 mL under vigorous stirring.
Add ethyl acetate dropwise until precipitation forms at -20°C.
Filter, wash with ethyl acetate/CH2Cl2 (1:1) and ethyl acetate, vacuum dry.
Dissolve 5.0 g of triethanolamine (TEA) and 3.3 g of Na2WO4·2H2O in 30 mL of water with stirring.
Adjust the pH to 2.0 by adding 37% HCl dropwise.
Add 0.66 g KCl into the mixture.
Allow the solution to stand for 14 days to form sky-blue crystals.
Further drying leads to side product [TEAH]6[H2W12O40].
procedure_steps.comments: Side product formed upon extended drying

name: Na2WO4·2H2O
reagents.comments: 1.0 M solution? Not fully clear, text says 50 mL of 1.0 mol·L^-1

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3 g WO3·2H2O in 450 mL of water at 25 °C.
Add 50 mL of 1.0 mol·L^-1 Na2WO4·2H2O solution slowly to the mixture while stirring.
Add slowly to 450 mL of 3.0 mol·L^-1 HCl solution while stirring; a yellow flocculent precipitate appears.
Filter the precipitate, wash with 25 mL water.
Grind the obtained yellow solid; final mass 12 g, 90% yield.

name: Acid solution
reagents.comments: Exact volume not specified, but results in a yellow precipitate

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 20 g WO3·2H2O, 20 g Na2WO4·2H2O, and 20 mL of water with stirring for 10 minutes.
Add the resulting mixture slowly to the acid solution; a yellow flocculent precipitate forms.
Decant and dry the precipitate for 3 days, yielding 36 g, 90% yield.

name: HNO3
reagents.comments: 4 mol·L^-1 used to adjust pH to 7.0

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 50 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 5.16 g Al(NO3)3·9H2O in 20 mL of water.
Adjust the pH to 7.0 with 4 mol·L^-1 HNO3 solution, then heat to boiling for 10-15 minutes.
Allow the solution to stand until a precipitate forms.
Filter and dry to obtain the product with white block-like appearance.
Dissolve 2.7 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 20 mL of water, adjust pH to ~5.3 with 2 mol·L^-1 HCl.
Add 1.26 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 Ce(NO3)3 solution, stir and boil for 60 minutes.
After cooling, adjust pH to 5.0 with 2 mol·L^-1 HCl, then add 3.4 g KCl.
Heat the solution to boil, then cool to room temperature and let stand for 48 hours.

characterization.comments: Possible transcription error for Ge (maybe Ce?).

product_summary.name: (TEAH)6[H2W19O62]
product_summary.notes: Yellow solid; TEAH+ presence affects product formation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 14.0 g TEAHCl and 13.0 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 80 mL of water.
Slowly add 6 mL of ion-exchanged acid solution (pH 1.2) while stirring.
Heat and stir the solution for 3 days.
Cool the mixture to room temperature to obtain a yellow solid.
Dry the solid in vacuum to obtain a pale yellow powder.

product_summary.name: (Pr4N)6[H4W19O62]·6CH3CN
product_summary.notes: An additional fraction was reported (21% yield, 0.45 g); total procedure yield includes multiple portions

procedure_steps.description: Grind 2.0 g of (TEAH)6[H4W19O62] with 80 mL of water.
Gradually add 2.2 g of Pr4NBr in 50 mL of water to the grinding mixture.
Continue grinding/stirring for 10 minutes.
Filter, wash, then extract the obtained compound with 140 mL of acetone.
Dissolve 20.0 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 40 mL water, bring to boiling.
Slowly add 0.85 g Na2SO3 (solid) to the boiling solution.
Add ion-exchanged acid solution dropwise until pH 3.4.
Filter the mixture after 4-7 hours at 80°C.
Place filtrate in a dish at ambient temperature for 3 days; pale yellow crystals form.
Filter and dry in air.
Stir 40 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 40 mL water, then add 1.70 g Na2SO3 slowly.
Slowly add 1 mol·L^-1 HCl to adjust pH to 2.4.
procedure_steps.comments: Intermediate colored precipitate may form pH 4-7, then dissolves

procedure_steps.description: Heat to 80°C, filter, then evaporate the filtrate at ambient temperature.
Allow solution to stand for 5 days; pale blue needle crystals form.
Filter crystals and dry in air.

product_summary.name: (TEAH)9Na2[(H2O)4K[H12W36O120]]·17H2O
product_summary.notes: Blue needle crystals after 1 month at 4°C; side products formed

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.0 g TEA and 1.6 g Na2WO4·2H2O in 25 mL of water.
Slowly add 37% HCl to adjust pH to 2.0.
Add 0.11 g Na2SO3 to the pale blue mixture, stir for 10 minutes.
Seal and store at 4 °C for one month; water slowly evaporates to form blue needle crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Gives 135 mg of main product (10% yield); side product (TEAH)6[H2W12O40] also observed

procedure_steps.description: Slowly evaporate mother liquor further to obtain more crystals of the same composition.
Adding 0.013 g KCl to the acidic solution can increase yield of the main product.
Filtrate after heating forms amorphous white powder that transforms into α-K[TEAH]4[K[K2W12O42]] upon further heating.
procedure_steps.comments: Mentioned as an additional note/side product

product_summary.name: K8[Mo4V8O36]·12H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow needle-like crystals form after aging

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.60 g MoO3 in 50 mL of 0.5 M KOH hot solution.
Dissolve 5.85 g NH4VO3 in 60 mL of hot water.
Add the vanadate solution to the molybdate solution, then add 12.5 mL of 2.0 M HCl.
Add 7.46 g of KCl to the mixture, filter at 313 K, and age overnight.
Redissolve crystals in water; after a few days, yellow needle-like crystals appear.

name: MoO3
reagents.comments: 1.80 g in 25 mL solution; possibly 2 mol/L solution but partial detail

procedure_steps.description: Mix 25 mL MoO3 solution (1.80 g in 2 mol/L) with 25 mL solution of 2.9 g NH4VO3.
Add 13 mL of 2.0 M HCl to the mixture, forming a dark red-orange solution.
Add 5.49 g (CH3)4NCl to the filtrate. After 10 days at room temperature, orange crystals form.
Recrystallize in water to obtain [(CH3)4N]4[H2MoV2O28]Cl·6H2O.
procedure_steps.comments: Second product formula is slightly different

product_summary.name: (Hmorph)6[Mo4V5O27]Cl·H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow crystals after 8 hours at room temperature

procedure_steps.description: Mix 10 mL of 2.0 M HCl with 0.2 g NH4VO3 and 10 mL of a solution containing 0.41 g Na2MoO4·2H2O.
Add 0.06 g α-bromocaprolactam and 20 mL morpholine to the solution.
Adjust pH to 5.0, then let the solution stand at room temperature for 8 hours.
Filter the yellow crystals, wash with ethanol/ether, and dry.
Stir V2O5 (0.11 g) with 30 mL 0.1 M (n-Bu4N)OH solution containing 0.08 mL water.
Add solution of 1.5 g [(n-Bu4N)4[α-Mo8O26]] in 20 mL CH3CN; stir while cooling from 60 °C to 25 °C.
Add a few drops of glacial acetic acid to the ethanolic solution.
Stand; orange crystals form after several days.
Collect and dry 0.38 g crystals.
Dissolve 1.94 g NaVO3·4H2O in 30 mL hot water. Dissolve 7.26 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 30 mL water separately and mix both solutions.
Add 33 mL of 3 M HCl dropwise, then add 5 g NaCl, heat to 313 K, and filter.
Dry at room temperature to obtain yellow crystals.
Dissolve Na2MoO4·2H2O, NaVO3·H2O and KCl in 50 mL water with heating.
Add (NH4)2SO4 drop-wise while simultaneously adding 13.33 mL 3 M HCl.
Filter the solution while hot.
Allow filtrate to evaporate at room temperature; yellow rod crystals appear after 1–2 weeks.

name: V2O5
reagents.comments: Ratios stated as 1:1 with Vⁿ2O5, etc.

procedure_steps.description: Take V2O5 with an additional vanadium oxide at a 1:1 ratio (6:9 in terms of partial references) and dissolve with NH4VO3 solution. Mix with MoO3.
Place in quartz tubes, seal, and heat in air at 600–700 °C for 24 hours.
procedure_steps.comments: Slowly cool, reheat in multiple cycles

product_summary.name: β-V(IV)V(V)8Mo(VI)6O40
product_summary.notes: Formation of β-[Vⁿ2 Vᵛ6 Mo60O180] under high-temperature conditions

procedure_steps.description: Mix MoO3 and V2O5 in appropriate ratios, reduce them with pure oxygen flow at 923 K for 24 hours.
procedure_steps.comments: Heating in air or oxygen environment

name: HCl, NaCl solution, then HNO3 (2 mol·L^-1)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.60 g MoO3 in 50 mL boiling 0.5 M KOH solution. Dissolve 5.85 g NH4VO3 in 60 mL hot water separately.
Combine the two solutions, add HCl and NaCl solution as needed, then inject 12.5 mL of 2 M HNO3.
Add 7.46 g KCl, filter after maintaining at 313 K for the yellow needle-like product.

product_summary.name: (VO)2[Mo72V30] = Na8K14(VO)2[{(Mo(VI)Mo(VI)5O21(H2O)3}10{(Mo(VI)Mo(VI)5O21(H2O)3(SO4)}2{V(IV)O(H2O)}20{V(IV)O}10({KSO4}5)2]·150H2O
product_summary.notes: Dark blue crystals formed after 5 days

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.42 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 8 mL of 0.5 M H2SO4, shake. Dissolve 2.53 g VOSO4·5H2O in 35 mL water and add to the mixture.
Add 84.72 mmol KCl, shake for 30 minutes, store sealed for 5 days at ambient conditions to obtain dark blue crystals.
procedure_steps.comments: Kept in a roasted/sealed environment per text

procedure_steps.description: Filter the dark blue crystals, wash with cold water, and dry.

product_summary.name: {Mo80V22}
product_summary.notes: Black-red crystals form after several hours; lower yield if aged only 0.5 h

procedure_steps.description: Neutralize 3 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 30 mL water with 5 mL 2 M H2SO4 (pH ≈ 2).
Add 2 g VOSO4·5H2O; solution turns deep blue.
Introduce 0.1 g Na2S2O4 to reduce; maintain at room temperature.
Add 0.7 g KCl, shake 10 min.
Filter the mixture; seal the filtrate.
Allow to stand several hours; black-red crystals form.
Filter crystals, wash with ice-cold water, air-dry.
Dissolve 2.53 g VOSO4·5H2O (10 mmol) in a solution of 2.42 g Na2MoO4 (10 mmol) in 1.0 M acidic solution (16.4 mL).
Stir immediately, add 1.16 g NaCl to promote precipitation. Bubble air for 10 minutes, then remove excess gas by filtering.
Allow 7 days of precipitation to form black crystals. Wash with 50 mL distilled water, dry in an ammonia stream.
Dissolve 6.2 g of NaVO3 in 55 mL of water at 70°C until dissolved.
Add 6.0 g of Na2MoO4·2H2O to the solution.
Add 75 mL of water to the mixture.
Add 14 mL of 2 mol·L-1 H2SO4 and adjust pH to 3.0.
Add 0.9 g of N2H2SO4.
Add 3.0 g of KCl and keep the mixture below 4°C.
Isolate the precipitation by filtration, wash, and separate to obtain purple-black cubic crystals.

characterization.comments: Measured in aqueous solution at pH 2.5

procedure_steps.description: Add 300 mL of 1 M Na2WO4 solution (R1) to 300 mL of 1 M NaVO3 solution (R2).
Heat the mixed solution to 70–80 °C until homogeneous yellow coloration develops.
Gradually add a small quantity of HCl (R3) to adjust pH to 7–8; the solution darkens to red.
Maintain the solution at 70–80 °C for 3 h.
Allow the mixture to stand at room temperature (≈25 °C) for 1–2 days.
Filter to remove brown impurities.
Wash the crude crystals with cold water (R4) followed by ethanol (R5).
Dissolve the washed crystals in 3 mL hot water (R4) and cool to recrystallise.

name: Water
reagents.comments: Approx. total (100 mL + 100 mL) before final concentration

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5.5 g of K2CO3 in 100 mL of water.
Add 3.6 g of V2O5 and 20 g of WO3·H2O into 100 mL of water separately.
Gradually add about 5 mmol of H2O2, stir and allow reaction for 2–3 hours.
Concentrate the reaction mixture to about 50 mL total volume.
procedure_steps.comments: Some solid appears in the mixture

procedure_steps.description: Filter the mixture to obtain a solid.
Dissolve the obtained solid in 20 mL of KAc and allow to stand for several days. A white precipitate forms.
Filter the precipitate and recrystallize the product. Wash with up to 50% ethanol-water mixture, then dry.
procedure_steps.comments: Store in sealed vessel with desiccant; yield ~90%

procedure_steps.description: Mix 0.08 g of V2O5 with 0.06 mL of water.
Add 20 mL of 0.1 mol·L-1 (n-C4H9)4NOH solution and stir vigorously for 24 h at 25°C.
Dissolve 1.3 g of [(n-C4H9)4N]4[W10O32] in 8 mL of CH3CN, stir, then pass the mixture through a column filter.
Collect the solid, transfer to a mixed acetonitrile solution, evaporate to dryness.
Wash the residue with a mixed solvent (acetonitrile/another organic solvent), then dry with acetone.
Dissolve part of the residue in acetone, mix with CH3CN, evaporate, rest for 24 h, and further dry under vacuum.
Heat the product to ~80°C to remove CH3CN, cool to 25°C, and dry to obtain yellow-orange crystals (0.47 g).
Add 8 mmol of HVOCl3 and 8 mmol of oxalic acid to 4 mmol of NH2H5Cl. Dissolve and then add ~10 mL of water.
The solution contains 4 mmol of K2WO4 and 60 mmol of perchloric acid in a total of ~200 mL of water. The mixture gradually turns blue-purple upon standing.
Heat to about 90°C, stir, then pass through a substitution column.
Wash the residue of the stripped mixture with 100 mL of cold water. An orange impurity is present, weight ratio ~1/53.
Filter and separate the solid. Wash the obtained crystals repeatedly, dry, then evaporate until the product crystallizes as large dark brown needle crystals.
Heat the solution to ~90°C, further evaporate to collect ~80 mL, then cool. Collect colorless and black solids formed.
procedure_steps.comments: Final product includes large needle crystals (dark brown).

name: Water
reagents.comments: Approx. total after multiple additions and evaporation steps

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 8.25 g of Na2WO4·2H2O in ~300 mL of water. Then add 200 mL of solution containing 2.6 mL of concentrated sulfuric acid.
procedure_steps.comments: Heat to 80°C and stir for ~3 days

procedure_steps.description: Add 5 mL of 0.50 M V(V) solution and an appropriate amount of 1 M NaOH to maintain conditions. Heat to 80°C and stir for 1 day.
Add n-Pr4NBr, let the solution evaporate and condense to about 200 mL.
If a yellow crystal precipitates, filter and collect the solid. Wash with water and ethanol. Dry in vacuo.

name: Acetic acid
HAc
reagents.comments: 100 mmol of ice acetic acid solution? Approx.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve K8[H2W11VV2O40]·13H2O in 50–60 mL of 0.20 mol·L-1 KAc / 0.04 mol·L-1 HAc buffer. Cool the solution to 25–40°C.
Immediately extract with CCl4/chloroform mixture until the solution turns yellow.
Mix 5 g of the KAc solution with 5 mL of water, then add 6 mL of acetic acid and 40 mL of 95% ethanol. Shake well.
Filter out the yellow powder, wash with small amounts of ethanol and then absolute ethanol. The product is ~0.61 g, yield 90–95%.

characterization.comments: Data for K8[H12W11VV2O40]·14H2O cited. Possibly partial mismatch of formula in references.

name: Water
reagents.comments: Used at 60–70°C, final volume not explicitly stated

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve NaVO3 (0.3 mmol), NaCl (5 mmol), and Me4NCl (4 mmol) in water at 60–70°C.
Add Na2WO4·2H2O and NH2NH2·2HCl in 6 mL of water, stir for 24 h to obtain an orange solution.
Filter and slowly evaporate the orange solution at room temperature.
procedure_steps.comments: After two months, orange-yellow crystals obtained

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.242 g of Cu(Ac)2·3H2O (1.0 mmol) in 10 mL of water.
Add 0.099 g of 1,10-phenanthroline (phen) to the stirring copper solution.
Dissolve 1.370 g of K6[HnNb6O19]·13H2O and 0.3159 g of NaVO3·2H2O in 80 mL of water separately, then combine into one solution.
Combine the phen/Cu solution with the Nb/V solution.
Adjust pH to 11.2 using 1 mol·L-1 NaOH.
Concentrate the mixture at 58°C for 8 hours until volume is ~50 mL.
Filter the concentrated solution.
Transfer the filtrate to a glass test tube and leave for 6 weeks to obtain blue block crystals.
Wash the crystals with water and air dry.
Dissolve K7H[Nb6O19]·13H2O, NaVO3 and CuSO4·H2O in 8 mL water.
Add ~10 drops ethylenediamine; adjust pH = 12.3 with 10 % HOAc.
Transfer to 23 mL autoclave.
Heat at 110 °C for 90 h.
Cool to room temperature; purple block crystals form.
Filter, wash with water, air-dry.
Prepare aqueous solution of K7H[Nb6O19]·13H2O, NH4VO3, CuSO4·H2O (8 mL).
Add 1 drop en and 0.045 g 2,2'-bipyridine; adjust pH ≈ 9.94.
Transfer to autoclave.
Heat 110 °C, 90 h.
Cool slowly; dark-purple crystals appear.
Filter, wash twice with water, air-dry.
Dissolve 0.15 g of K6[HnNb6O19]·13H2O, 0.05 g NaVO3, and 0.1 g CuSO4·H2O in 8 mL of water.
Add 10 drops of ethylenediamine, stir continuously, then adjust pH to 12.3 with 10% acetic acid.
Transfer the mixture to a 23 mL stainless steel reaction vessel, seal, and heat at 110°C for 90 hours, then slowly cool to room temperature.
Filter the cooled mixture to obtain purple block crystals.
Replace NH4VO3 with NaVO3. Add a drop of ethylenediamine, 0.045 g of 2,2'-bipyridine, and adjust pH to 9.94 with acetic acid. Stir the mixture.
Slowly cool the mixture to room temperature, then filter to obtain purple crystalline product.
procedure_steps.comments: Washed twice with water, air dried

name: [(Bu4N)3[MoW5O19]]
product_summary.notes: Contains mixture of polyoxometalates, eventually leading to (Bu4N)2[MoW6O19]

name: Hydrochloric acid
HCl
reagents.comments: Used for washing CaWO2 to form WO3·H2O

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 150 g of Na2WO4·2H2O in 250 mL water, heat to 100°C. Add 75 g of CaCl2·2H2O in 100 mL water, producing a white precipitate of CaWO2.
Filter to obtain CaWO2, wash with 2 M HCl solution at 70°C to form WO3·H2O precipitate. Wash until free of chloride ions.
Slowly add 50 mL of 1 M Na2MoO4 solution at 80°C to the WO3·H2O, stir for a few hours.
Filter, wash with water. Add Na2CO3 to the filtrate to keep pH > 6, evaporate to dryness to obtain more WO3·H2O. Re-adjust pH to 7–8, boil 30 minutes, filter hot.
Add 200 mL of diluted Bu4NBr solution to the hot filtrate, stir at 90°C for 30 minutes. Cool, filter, wash with ethanol, and dry in air.
Repeatedly crystallize to get high purity complex crystals (~14 g).
Dissolve 14 g in 70 mL of 4 M Bu4NBF4/DMF. Apply cathodic voltage (0 to -0.5 V vs SCE). Observe a greenish-blue solution with (Bu4N)2[MoW6O19] formed over days.

characterization.comments: Mixed IR absorption from Mo/W species

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 8 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 36 g CH3COONa·3H2O in 100 mL water.
Add 60 mL glacial HOAc to pH ≈ 4.
Quickly add 9 g ammonium molybdate-oxalate complex.
Heat at 120 °C in N2 for 90 min; solution dark-red.
Cool, filter to obtain reddish-brown microcrystalline powder (1.8 g, 15 %).
Dissolve 200 mg powder in 10 mL water; add 200 mg (CH3)2NH2Cl.
Stand 2–3 days; red crystals appear, filter, wash with EtOH, dry with ether.

name: Water
reagents.comments: 60 mL hot + 20 mL for GaCl3 solution

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 32.0 g of K8[SiW11O39]·13H2O (0.0100 mol) in 60 mL of 90°C hot water.
Slowly add 1.78 g GaCl3 (0.0101 mol) dissolved in 20 mL of water. Stir until homogeneous.
Cool to room temperature, filter off excess Ga(OH)3. Precipitate the product by adding ~2 volumes of cold acetone (5°C).
Wash the precipitate with a 1:1 acetone/ether mixture. Dissolve the white precipitate in minimal methanol, cool to 2°C, filter, and dry.

name: Water
reagents.comments: 60 mL hot + 20 mL for InCl3 solution
