procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 32.0 g K8[SiW11O39]·13H2O (0.0100 mol) in 60 mL of 90°C hot water.
Dissolve 2.23 g InCl3 (0.0101 mol) in 20 mL of water, add slowly while stirring. Heat ~10 minutes, allow to cool.
Remove any In(OH)3 precipitate. Wash with a 1:1 acetone/ether mixture, then precipitate again with acetone. Filter and dry.
Dissolve 32 g K8[SiW11O39]·13H2O in 100 mL near-boiling water.
Cool slightly; adjust pH to 3.2 with HOAc.
Slowly add 3.98 g Tl(NO3)3 over 10 min, keep pH ≈ 3.
Cool to 2 °C; remove Tl(OH)3 precipitate.
Adjust supernatant to pH 4.5 with 1 mM NaOH, filter and dry.

name: K5[SiAlW11O39]·15H2O
product_summary.notes: Solid product recovered after washing and drying

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 64.0 g K6[SiW11O39]·13H2O (0.0200 mol) in 125 mL of 90°C hot water with stirring.
Slowly add 7.58 g Al(NO3)3·9H2O (0.0202 mol). Stir until homogeneous, then heat for 10 minutes, cool to 5°C.
Filter under reduced pressure to recover solid particles. Wash with water/ether (2:1) until clear. Then wash with 50-60°C water, and finally with acetone. Dry.
Dissolve 28 g of H4[SiW12O40]·7H2O in 100 mL of water, heat to 95°C.
Add 7.2 g of NaHCO3 to adjust the pH to 6.0 while stirring.
Add 3.1 g of Zn(NO3)2·6H2O. Stir for 10 minutes at 95°C.
Filter the hot solution and dry the collected solid for 2 hours to obtain a white powdered product.

name: Water
reagents.comments: Total ~80 mL used across solutions A, B, C

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 20 g of K8[SiW11O39]·13H2O (6.2 mmol) in 40 mL of water at 90–95°C to form solution A.
Dissolve 196 g of KMnO4 (1.24 mol) in 20 mL of water to form solution B. Add 1.8 mL of 6.0 mol·L-1 HCl to this solution.
Dissolve 22 g of Mn(CH3COO)2·4H2O (4.6 mmol) in 20 mL of water to form solution C.
Simultaneously add solutions B and C dropwise into solution A at 90–95°C over ~30 minutes with stirring.
procedure_steps.comments: Formation of intermediate solids and Mn species

procedure_steps.description: Cool to room temperature and filter off any MnO2 solid. Then cool the filtrate to 10°C to obtain ~12 mL of precipitate.
Redissolve the precipitate in water and stir for 3 hours to form a purple suspension. Filter and dry at 70°C to obtain a purple powder.
procedure_steps.comments: Purple powder is a partial form

procedure_steps.description: Further treat the purple powder by suspending in water (17 g powder per 10 mL water) for 2 hours. Filter to get solid purple granules.
Dissolve 0.3 g Na4P2O7 in 30 mL water; pass through H⁺-resin to pH 3.
Add 0.2 g Co(NO3)2·6H2O; stir 8 min at 85 °C (purple → dark-brown).
Add 3.2 g K8[SiW11O39]·13H2O; stir 10 min, filter hot.
Add 0.5 g KCl to filtrate.
Treat water phase with equal volume water/ether (1 : 1) to precipitate product.
Air-dry precipitate; yield 3 g solid (~30 % crystal water).
Dissolve 0.3 g of Na4P2O7 (1 mmol) in 30 mL of water, adjust pH to 3.0 using H⁺-type cation exchange resin.
Add 0.16 g of MnSO4 (1 mmol) and stir at ~85°C for several minutes. The solution eventually darkens.
Dissolve 3.2 g of K8[SiW11O39]·13H2O (1 mmol) into the mixture, stir ~10 minutes, then filter.
Add 0.5 g of KCl to the filtrate. Treat with 1:1 water/ether to obtain brown crystals upon precipitation.
Dissolve 0.3 g of Na4P2O7 in 30 mL of water, adjust pH to 3.0 using H⁺-type cation exchange resin.
Add 0.14 g of Ni(NO3)2 (1 mmol) and stir at 85°C for 8 minutes. The solution color changes to green.
Dissolve 3.2 g of K8[SiW11O39]·13H2O (1 mmol) into the mixture, stir 10 minutes, then filter.
Add 0.5 g of KCl to the filtrate. Treat with 1:1 water/ether to precipitate green crystals.
Dissolve 0.3 g of Na4P2O7 in 30 mL water, adjust pH to 3.0 using H⁺-type cation exchange resin.
Add 0.13 g of ZnCl2 (1 mmol) and stir at 85°C for ~8 minutes. A colorless solution is formed.
Dissolve 3.2 g of K8[SiW11O39]·13H2O (1 mmol) into the mixture, stir 10 minutes, then filter.
Add 0.5 g of KCl to the filtrate. Treat with 1:1 water/ether. A colorless crystalline product forms.
Dissolve 5 g of K8[γ-SiW10W2O32]·12H2O (1.67 mmol) in 50 mL of water with 570 mg CsCl. Heat to 80°C in a 1 mol·L-1 KAc/HAc solution.
Add 7.5 mL of 0.5 mol·L-1 Cr(NO3)3 solution. After 8–10 minutes at 80°C, the green solution fades to pale green. Stir for 20 more minutes.
procedure_steps.comments: Color change from green to pale green

procedure_steps.description: Cool the mixture, add 4.0 g CsCl to obtain a dark green precipitate (<0.5 g). Then cool to -16°C, add 6.0 g CsCl to get a light green precipitate.
Wash the precipitate with water, then dissolve it in 20 mL of 40°C water. Filter the solution.
Take 10 mL of the filtered solution, adjust to pH 4.7 at 40°C, and allow slow recrystallization. A cyan crystal is obtained.

name: (n-Bu4N)3H2[γ-SiCo2W10O32(OH)(Cr2(OOCCH3)2(OH)2)]·3H2O
product_summary.notes: Light green or tan precipitate, purified to final product

name: HCl
1 mol·L^-1
reagents.comments: Used in increments to adjust pH

name: Water/ethanol mixture
reagents.comments: Approx. or partial volumes; also for washing

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g of K8[γ-SiW10W2O32]·12H2O (1.67 mmol) in ~50 mL of water with 0.57 g CsCl at 80°C in 1 mol·L^-1 KAc/HAc buffer. Add 7.5 mL of 0.5 mol·L^-1 Cr(NO3)3 solution and stir 30 minutes. Cool to room temperature.
procedure_steps.comments: Color changes then cool to RT

procedure_steps.description: Add about 40 mL of water/ethanol mixture plus 0.27 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 HCl to adjust pH to ~3.0, forming a light tan precipitate (a-SiW12Cr).
Continue adding 1 mol·L^-1 HCl in increments to pH 2.5, 2.0, and 1.5. A light green precipitate forms, dissolve in hot water/ethanol.
Evaporate to dryness in air. Add acetone and dry 2 hours at 40°C to obtain the crude product (~1.2 g).
Dissolve 0.55 g of Fe(NO3)3·9H2O in 30 mL of water.
Add 2.0 g of K8[γ-SiW10O32]·12H2O to the solution. The mixture becomes yellowish-brown. Stir at 70°C for 5 minutes.
Add 2.0 g of (CH3)2NH2Cl. Stir briefly and then filter.
Dry the filtrate for 4–5 days to obtain a verdigris-colored crystal.

characterization.comments: Large discrepancy in found vs. theoretical values

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.090 g CuCl in 20 mL water. Separately dissolve 1.0 g of K8[γ-SiW10O36]·12H2O in 20 mL water, mix the two solutions for 1 minute.
Add 20 mL solution containing 114 g NaN3. Then immediately add 6 g of a 2.0 g [(C4H9)4N]Br in 20 mL aqueous solution. Adjust pH to ~6 with 1 mol·L^-1 HCl.
Filter the green precipitate, wash twice with water. Yield ~0.78 g of crude product.
Dissolve the green solid in 20 g of acetonitrile (CH3CN). Evaporate in 1.5 mL of 1,2-dichloroethane, then add 1.5 mL of acetone. Green crystals separate out.
Obtain ~0.08 g of green crystals after drying.

name: (TBA)3H[γ-SiW10O36(Al(OH2)2(μ-OH2)2]·4H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow solution, final solid after washing

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 10.0 g of K6[γ-SiW10O36]·12H2O (3.4 mmol) in 100 mL of deionized water. Add 2.6 g of Al(NO3)3·9H2O and adjust pH to 3.8 with 2 mol·L^-1 K2CO3 solution. Stir for 15 minutes.
Add 4.8 g of (CH3)4NCl at room temperature, grind half of it, then filter to remove colored solution (details unclear).
Transfer to 250 mL of deionized water, add 28.0 g of (C4H9)4NBr, then adjust pH to 2 with 1 mol·L^-1 HCl. A yellow solution is formed.
Filter the yellow solution, wash with water. Product presumably (TBA)3H[γ-SiW10O36(Al(OH2)2(μ-OH2)2].

product_summary.name: Tetrabutyl-ammonium/pyridinium γ-silico-aluminotungstate
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals obtained after one-week standing

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.20 g precursor R1 in 4 – 4.8 mL ethanol at room temperature to give a clear solution.
Keep the solution undisturbed at room temperature for 1 week; colorless crystals of the product appear.

name: [(CH3)3C(C6H5)N4[(SiO3)W10MnIIIO36H6]·2CH3CN·H2O
product_summary.notes: Incomplete procedure details, presumed complex formation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 6.0 g of K6[γ-SiW10O36]·12H2O in 15 mL of deionized water. Carefully maintain pH at 3.8–4.5.
Add 0.784 g Mn(Ac)2·2H2O directly into 10 mL of prepared solution (solution B?), along with rapid acidification or pH adjustment. Possibly combine solutions A and B slowly.
After 5 minutes, add 3.0 g of TBA, obtaining a yellow filtrate upon further processing.
procedure_steps.comments: Step details are incomplete in original text

procedure_steps.description: Dilute the solution with CH3CN, then add water to filter. Roughly 6.0 g of barium (??) or final product is mentioned, but text is unclear.
procedure_steps.comments: References some intermediate or final product, uncertain details

name: PhSnCl3
Triphenyltin chloride? or Phenyl tin chloride?
reagents.comments: 0.35 g or 0.30 mL in some references, but text says 6 mL?

name: Brine solution?
reagents.comments: The text mentions taking off the brine solution

procedure_steps.description: Add 2.7 g of Na10[α-SiW9O34]·18H2O (1 mmol) into 6 mL PhSnCl3 in 40 mL solution. Shake vigorously for 10 minutes.
Remove the brine solution and filter the remainder. Dry to obtain the precipitate. Possibly melted or recrystallized into needles.
Dissolve 0.09 g R1 in 20 mL pH 6.0 buffer to form an orange solution.
Add 0.50 g Na10[α-SiW9O34]·18H2O; heat the mixture at 80 °C until clear.
Cool to room temperature and filter to remove traces of solid.
Add 1 mL 1 M RbCl to the filtrate; leave to evaporate slowly at room temperature.
Yellow crystals form after several days of slow evaporation.

name: Cs3Na[(C6H5)3Sn(OH)3(A-α-GeW9O34)]·9H2O
product_summary.notes: Product depends on CsCl amount, ~9H2O or 8H2O forms

procedure_steps.description: Mix 0.35 g of Na[α-GeW9O34]·18H2O with 20 mL water containing 0.30 mL of (C6H5)SnCl3. React for 30 minutes.
Filter off the white precipitate. Add several drops of 1 mol·L^-1 CsCl solution to the filtrate and evaporate.
procedure_steps.comments: Cs6Na vs. Cs3 depends on stoichiometry

procedure_steps.description: Evaporate to obtain Cs6Na[(C6H5)Sn(OH)]3(A-α-HGeW9O34)]·9H2O or with excess CsCl, yield Cs3[(C6H5)Sn(OH)]3(A-α-HGeW9O34)]·8H2O. Text is inconsistent.

product_summary.name: Triphenyltin-substituted α-germanotungstate
product_summary.notes: Product isolated after excess CsCl treatment

procedure_steps.description: Disperse 1.35 g Na10[A-α-GeW9O34]·18H2O in 20 mL water; add 0.30 mL (C6H5)SnCl3 with stirring for 30 min.
Filter off a white precipitate; collect filtrate.
Add several drops of 1 M CsCl to the filtrate and evaporate to obtain Cs3Na[((C6H5)Sn(OH))3(A-α-GeW9O34)]·9H2O.
Add excess CsCl to convert to Cs3[(C6H5)3Sn(OH)3(A-α-HGeW9O34)]·8H2O.
Dissolve 0.09 g of RuC6H6Cl2 (0.18 mmol) in 20 mL of 0.5 mol·L^-1 pH 6.0 HAc/NaAc buffer.
Add 0.5 g of Na[α-GeW9O34]·18H2O (0.17 mmol), heat the mixture to ~80°C, cool to room temperature, then filter.
Add 1.0 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 CsCl solution to the filtrate. Evaporate slowly at room temperature to obtain yellow crystals.
Dissolve 200 mg of K7[PW11O39]·7H2O and 200 mg LiNO3 in water at 48°C.
Add 27 mg K2IrF6. Heat at 120°C for 48 hours, then cool to room temperature and filter.
Pass filtrate through basic alumina column to remove brown solution, wash with water. Final compound yield ~90%.
Dissolve 0.22 g Ni(CH3COO)2·4H2O in 10 mL of water at 60°C containing 1.07 g K9[A-α-PW9O34]·16H2O.
Add 0.087 g Na3N3. Stir for 10 minutes, cool to room temperature.
Add 0.750 g RbCl. After 30 minutes, a yellow-green precipitate forms.
Filter the yellow-green precipitate, yield ~0.4 g (34%).

name: Cs2[H2PW9Ni3O34(OH)3(H2O)5]·5H2O
product_summary.notes: Stored and crystallized over several days

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.42 g of Na2H3[β-PW10O34] and 1.16 g NiSO4·6H2O into a pH 4.8 solution. Then add 10 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 NaAc solution, heat to 80°C, and cool for 20 minutes.
Add 1 mol·L^-1 CsCl solution. A precipitate forms, which is washed with ethanol, then air dried. Yield ~16 g, 35%.
procedure_steps.comments: Remaining green precipitate re-dissolved, partial yield

name: Na9[A-α-PW9O34]·7H2O
product_summary.notes: Large yellow precipitate. IR for A- vs B-isomer differs.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 120 g of Na2WO4·2H2O (0.36 mol) in 150 mL of water under stirring. Slowly add 4.0 mL of 85% phosphoric acid (~0.06 mol). pH ~8.9–9.0.
Add 5.0 mL of acetic acid (0.40 mol) dropwise, producing a large yellow precipitate. pH ~7.5 ± 0.3. Stir 1 hour, filter, and wash the precipitate.
Replace acetic acid with 35 mL of 1.2 mol·L^-1 HCl (0.42 mol) and stir 4 hours to obtain Na9-H4[A-PW9O34]·7H2O. Elemental analysis given.
procedure_steps.comments: IR data: different for A- vs B-isomer

characterization.comments: Heating at 120°C transforms A- to B-isomer. B-isomer IR differs.

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.30 g Na9[A-α-PW9O34]·nH2O and 0.80 g NiCl2·6H2O in 10 mL of pH 4.8 buffer (5 mol·L^-1 NaAc/HAc). Stir to get a pale green clear solution.
Add 0.30 mL of 1,2-propylenediamine (enMe), then 0.20 g of 1,3-H2BDC. Stir for 120 minutes.
Transfer mixture to a 35 mL crucible (App1). Heat at 170°C for 5 days, then cool to room temperature. Pale green bulk crystals form.
Dissolve 0.58 g H3[PW12O40] (~0.20 mmol), 0.18 g Co(CH3COO)2 (1 mmol), and 0.06 g 4,4'-bipyridine (~0.2 mmol) in 10 mL water. Stir for 30 minutes.
procedure_steps.comments: Solution is likely purple or red

procedure_steps.description: Use 1 mol·L^-1 HCl to adjust pH to 5.8. Stir until reaction stops, then heat at 120°C. Cool to room temperature, obtaining red block-like crystals.

product_summary.name: Thallium-substituted β-undecatungstate
product_summary.notes: Large crystals obtained after low-temperature evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 3.98 g Tl(NO3)3 in 100 mL water at 50 °C.
Add 32 g K9[BiW11O39]·10H2O; stir until decomposition is complete.
Adjust the clear solution to pH 5.0 with 1 M NaOH.
Filter hot; cool the filtrate to 2 °C and allow slow evaporation to crystallize the product.
Dissolve 18 g of K6[α1-LiP2W17O61]·18H2O in 100 mL of pH 4.7, 0.5 mol·L^-1 HAc/LiAc buffer at 50°C.
Add 3 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 Zn(NO3)2 solution. A precipitate or cloudy mixture may form; maintain about 70 mL of clear solution.
Obtain clear filtrate. Add 7 g of KCl, forming a precipitate. Wash with ethanol and ether, then dry. Yield ~75%.
Dissolve 5 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 Mg(NO3)2 solution in 100 mL of water, then add 10 g of K6[α1-LiP2W17O61]·18H2O with stirring.
Filter the clear solution. Add 10 g of KCl to cause precipitation (swimming sediment). Wash product with ethanol, then ether, and dry. Yield ~80%.
Similarly to the magnesium method, replace Mg(NO3)2 with CaCl2. Dissolve in 100 mL of water, add 10 g K6[α1-LiP2W17O61]·18H2O, stir.
Filter the solution, add 10 g of KCl to cause precipitation, then wash with ethanol and ether, and dry. Forms K8[α1-P2W17CaO61]·19H2O.

name: K8[α1-P2W17CoO61]·19H2O
product_summary.notes: By analogy with Mg, likely ~80% yield

procedure_steps.description: Similarly to the magnesium method (SYN492), replace Mg(NO3)2 with CoCl2. Dissolve in 100 mL water, add 10 g K6[α1-LiP2W17O61]·18H2O, stir.
Filter the solution, add 10 g KCl to precipitate the product, wash with ethanol and ether, dry. Yields K8[α1-P2W17CoO61]·19H2O.

product_summary.name: Manganese-substituted α1-phosphotungstate
product_summary.notes: Yellow precipitate converted to air-dry solid

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 10 g Li[α1-P2W17O61]·18H2O in 100 mL pH 4.7 buffer.
Add 1.87 mL 1.6 M Mn2+ solution drop-wise; filter off any precipitate.
Add KCl to the clear filtrate to precipitate the potassium salt.
Wash the precipitate with ethanol followed by acetone; air-dry.
Add 2 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 HNO3 to 50 mL of 0.2 mol·L^-1 LiCl solution. Then add 5 g of K6Li[α1-P2W17NiO61]·18H2O with stirring.
Add ethanol to the filtrate, then add KCl to precipitate the product. Wash with ethanol and ether, dry in air. Yield ~75%.

name: K6Li[α1-P2W17NiO61]·18H2O
reagents.role: similar precursor, replaced Ni with Cu

procedure_steps.description: Follow the procedure of SYN496 but replace the Ni salt with Cu salt. E.g., add 2 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 HNO3 to 50 mL of 0.2 mol·L^-1 LiCl, stir in 5 g K6Li[α1-P2W17NiO61]·18H2O (or direct Cu-based POM), then add ethanol and KCl to precipitate.
procedure_steps.comments: Copper salt substituted for Ni salt

procedure_steps.description: Wash the precipitate with ethanol and ether, dry in air. Yield ~75%.
Dissolve 2.43 g of Fe(NO3)3·9H2O (6 mmol) in 65 mL of water.
Add 23 g of K10[P2Mo5W10O38]·21H2O (4.9 mmol), stir at ~35°C, then filter.
Cool the filtrate to 5°C overnight to obtain a yellow precipitate. Filter and air-dry. Yield ~18 g.
Dissolve 2.43 g Fe(NO3)3·9H2O (6 mmol) in 90 mL water. Add 23 g K9Li[α2-P2W17O61]·20H2O (4.9 mmol) and stir well.
Filter the solution. Add ethanol and KCl (amount not specified) to the filtrate to precipitate the product. Filter and air-dry. Yield 15.5 g.
Dissolve 2.43 g Fe(NO3)3·9H2O (6 mmol) in 65 mL water. Add 23 g K6Li[α2-P2W17O61]·20H2O (4.7 mmol), stir at 30°C, then filter.
Cool the filtrate to 6°C overnight to obtain a yellow precipitate. Filter and dry in air, yield ~17 g.
Dissolve 0.839 g K2ReCl6 and 6.67 g K10[α2-P2W17O61] in minimal water; obtain a reddish-brown solution.
Stir 30 min; color changes to dark brown.
Heat to 50 °C to remove volatile components; dissolve residue in little water and evaporate again at 80 °C.
Cool in an ice bath to precipitate the product.
Filter and wash with CH3CN (2 * 5 mL) and Et2O (3 * 50 mL); dry.
Add 10 g K6Li[α1-P2W17O61] to 25 mL water and stir until dissolved.
Dissolve 89.6 mg YbCl3 in 2 mL water separately.
Adjust the pH of the precursor solution to ~4.5 with 1 M HCl.
Stir the pH-adjusted solution for 2 minutes.
Add the YbCl3 solution to the main mixture.
Slowly add 750 mg (TBA)Br dissolved in 10 mL water.
After the reaction appears complete, add 0.1 mL 1 M acetic acid.
Filter the resulting white precipitate.

Dissolve 6.78 g (NH4)2[Ce(NO3)6] (12.4 mmol) in 7 mL H2O + 7 mL CH3COOH. Add 2.02 g Mn(O2CCH3)2·4H2O (8.2 mmol) in 4 mL H2O + 4 mL CH3COOH. Stir to get dark red solution, evaporate slowly at RT for 2 days -> black crystals. Filter, wash with cold ethanol and ether, vacuum dry. 0.98 g (54% yield).

Take 20 g of the intermediate (0.13 mmol) in 20 mL HAc/H2O (1:3). Filter, stir, add 0.56 g Na2[α2-P2W18O56]·18H2O (0.13 mmol), stir 12 h, then add 0.20 g trihydrate (?) under cooled 70°C. Filter, evaporate slowly at RT for 2 days -> black solids. Wash with water, vacuum dry, 0.15 g (21.7% yield).
Dissolve 10.46 g GeO2 in 120 mL 12 M HCl with stirring.
Add 16 mL 50 % acetic acid to the solution.
Heat the reaction mixture at 90 °C (water bath) for 3 h.
Cool the mixture to room temperature, then further in an ice bath to precipitate the product.
Filter to collect the wet white precipitate (≈ 7.2 g wet).
Spin-dry the precipitate at room temperature for 1 h; wash repeatedly with cold water.
Dissolve the dried powder in 150 mL hot water (70 °C).
Allow the solution to cool; remove warm supernatant; stand at 4 °C to obtain yellow powder.
Wash the yellow powder three times with 50 mL water.
Dry the product in an oven at 80 °C for 2 h.
Dissolve 0.25 g Cl3Ge(CH2)2COOH in 30 mL water.
Add 5.0 g K10[α2-P2W17O61]·24H2O and stir.
Continue stirring for approximately 30 minutes.
Add 5.5 g Me2NH·Cl; a yellow precipitate forms.
Filter off the yellow powder.
Wash the solid three times with 30 mL ethanol.
Wash the solid three times with 50 mL diethyl ether.
Vacuum-dry the product to constant weight.
Suspend 1.5 g crude sample in 4 mL water.
Heat the suspension in an 80 °C water bath, then allow to cool slowly to room temperature while solvent evaporates.
Collect the yellow crystalline mass after 1 day.
Wash crystals three times with 30 mL ethanol.
Wash three times with 50 mL diethyl ether.
Vacuum-dry the crystals.

name: Me4NH2Cl (dimethylammonium? Possibly mislabel, or a different quaternary ammonium?)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 453 μL allyltrimethoxysilane (2.0 mmol) in 50 mL C2H4Cl2. Then add 100 mL water plus 5.0 g K10[α2-P2W17O61]·23H2O (1.0 mmol). Adjust pH to 1.5 with 1 mol·L^-1 HCl. Stir for several hours at RT.

Use rotary evaporation at 30°C to reduce solution volume to ~20 mL. Add 5.5 g of Me4NH2Cl. Stir in ice bath 1 h, filter yellow powder. Wash with 30 mL MeOH x2, 50 mL Et2O x2, vacuum dry -> 3.58 g yield.
Dissolve the powder in 15 mL water, adjust pH to 2.0 (1 mol·L^-1 HCl). Slowly evaporate at RT for 3 days -> yellow crystals. Wash with Et2O, vacuum dry 2 h, yield 0.63 g (63.5%).
Dissolve 0.032 g LaCl3·7H2O (0.085 mmol) and 0.5 g K8[β2-SiW11O39] (0.155 mmol) in 20 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 KCl solution.
Slowly add 0.1 mol·L^-1 HCl to adjust the solution pH to 5.0.
Stir the mixture at 50°C for 30 minutes. Then cool to room temperature.
Filter and concentrate the solution slowly by evaporation. After one week, colorless crystals form. Filter and wash.

product_summary.name: K13[Ce(β2-SiW11O39)2]·25.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.032 g CeCl3·7H2O and 0.5 g K6[β2-SiW11O39] to 20 mL of 1 M KCl solution.
Slowly add 0.1 M HCl solution until the pH reaches 5.0.
Stir the mixture at 50 °C for 30 min.
Cool the reaction mixture to room temperature.
Filter the solution to remove any solids.
Allow the filtrate to evaporate slowly at room temperature for one week to obtain colorless crystals.

product_summary.name: K13[Sm(β2-SiW11O39)2]·29.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.031 g SmCl3·6H2O and 0.5 g K6[β2-SiW11O39] to 20 mL of 1 M KCl solution.
Slowly add 0.1 M HCl solution until pH 5.0.
Stir the mixture at 50 °C for 30 min.
Cool to room temperature.
Filter the solution.
Evaporate the filtrate slowly at room temperature for one week to obtain crystals.

product_summary.name: K13[Eu(β2-SiW11O39)2]·27H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.032 g EuCl3·6H2O and 0.5 g K6[β2-SiW11O39] to 20 mL of 1 M KCl solution.
Slowly add 0.1 M HCl solution until pH 5.0.
Stir at 50 °C for 30 min.
Cool to room temperature.
Filter the mixture.
Evaporate slowly at room temperature for one week to obtain crystals.

product_summary.name: K13[Gd(β2-SiW11O39)2]·27H2O
product_summary.notes: Colorless crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.032 g GdCl3·6H2O and 0.5 g K6[β2-SiW11O39] to 20 mL of 1 M KCl solution.
Slowly add 0.1 M HCl solution until pH 5.0.
Stir at 50 °C for 30 min.
Cool to room temperature.
Filter the mixture.
Evaporate slowly at room temperature for one week to obtain crystals.

Slowly add 0.1 M HCl solution until pH 5.0.

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.031 g LuCl3·6H2O and 0.5 g K6[β2-SiW11O39] to 20 mL of 1 M KCl solution.

Stir the mixture at 50 °C for 30 min.
Cool the reaction mixture to room temperature (≈25 °C).
Filter to remove any solids.
Allow the filtrate to evaporate slowly at room temperature for one week to yield colorless crystals.

Cool the mixture to room temperature
Add 2.5 g of KCl
Filter the precipitate at 0°C
Dry to obtain the crude product (repeated P2O5 drying steps)

Cool the reaction mixture to room temperature.
Add 2.5 g KCl to precipitate the product.

Dry the solid over P2O5 to constant weight (three subsequent weighings).

procedure_steps.comments: Li2CO3 solid added dropwise as needed

procedure_steps.description: Add 0.434 g Ce(NO3)3·3H2O
procedure_steps.comments: Formation of a higher phase solution and yellow precipitate

procedure_steps.description: Add dropwise Li2CO3 (solid) to maintain pH at 4.3
Add 2.94 g NH4Cl
Mix the solution thoroughly
Directly add ethanol (EtOH)
Cool to 5°C to obtain crystals
Dissolve 4.68 g H3[PMo12O40]·xH2O in 20 mL water.
Adjust the solution to pH 4.3 by adding Li2CO3 solid dropwise.
Add 0.445 g Sm(NO3)3·6H2O to the pH-adjusted solution.
Add 2.94 g NH4Cl to the reaction mixture.
Introduce ethanol (or dropwise CH3CN) as anti-solvent to promote crystallization.
Keep the mixture at 5 °C to crystallize.

name: Hydrochloric acid
HCl
reagents.comments: 1 M; used to adjust pH to 1.5

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.143 g HfCl2·8H2O in 20 mL of water
Adjust pH to 1.5 with 1 M HCl
Stir briskly, then add 1.0 g Na10[A-α-PW9O34]·16H2O (0.39 mmol)
Heat at 50°C for 30 minutes
Cool to room temperature
Add 0.25 g dimethylamine hydrochloride (CH3)2NH·HCl
Final pH of the solution is 5.0
Cool slowly to obtain white block-like crystals

product_summary.name: (NH4)5KLi[α1-Ce(P2W17O61)]·9H2O
product_summary.notes: Orange-brown single crystals; molecular formula does not reflect dimer structure

name: Ammonium chloride
NH4Cl
reagents.comments: Used as 4 M solution (10 mL) in second step

procedure_steps.description: To 20 mL of 1 M LiAc solution (pH 4.75), add 2.0 g K6Li(α1-P2W17O61)ₙ·xH2O (0.44 mmol)
Add 3 mL aqueous solution containing 0.72 g Ce(NO3)3·6H2O (1.66 mmol)
procedure_steps.comments: Stir at room temperature for 5 min

procedure_steps.description: Obtain a white powder, centrifuge to remove precipitate and wash with steam
Add 10 mL of 4 M NH4Cl solution to the filtrate
Remove white precipitate to obtain an orange base
After two weeks, orange-brown single crystals form
Dissolve 1 g of K9Li[α2-P2W17O61] in 12 mL of 0.285 M LiAc solution (pH 4.75) at room temperature
Add 0.115 mL of 0.90 M EuCl3 solution (0.10 mmol) and mix vigorously for 15 minutes
Add 0.32 g KCl to form a precipitate
Filter off the precipitate
Add the filtrate to 0.285 M LiAc/HAc buffer (pH 4.75)
Leave at 4 °C for 3 days to obtain bright green crystals
Dissolve 1 g K9Li[α2-P2W17O61] in 12 mL 0.285 M LiAc buffer (pH 4.75).
Add 0.115 mL 0.90 M NdCl3 solution (0.10 mmol) to the mixture.
Mix vigorously for 15 min.
Add 0.32 g KCl to form a precipitate.
Filter the precipitate; keep the filtrate.
Add the filtrate to LiAc/HAc buffer (pH 4.75).
Allow the solution to stand at 4 °C for 3 days to grow crystals.
Dissolve 1 g of K9Li[α2-P2W17O61] in 12 mL LiAc (0.285 M, pH 4.75) at room temperature
Add 0.115 mL of 0.90 M NdCl3 solution (0.10 mmol) and stir vigorously for 15 minutes
Add 0.32 g KCl to form a precipitate, then filter
Add the filtrate to 0.285 M LiAc/HAc buffer (pH 4.75)
Let stand at 4 °C for 3 days to obtain bright green crystals

procedure_information.title: Synthesis of K4[H3O]3[Ho(α1-P2W17O61)2]·4KCl·64H2O (Ln = La3⁺, Eu3⁺, Nd3⁺, Dy3⁺, Ho3⁺, Er3⁺)

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1 g of K9Li[α2-P2W17O61] in 12 mL LiAc solution (0.285 M, pH 4.75) at room temperature
Add 0.115 mL of 0.90 M HoCl3 solution (0.10 mmol) and mix vigorously for 15 min
Add 0.32 g KCl, filter the formed precipitate
Add the filtrate to LiAc/HAc buffer (0.285 M, pH 4.75)
Keep at 4 °C for 3 days to obtain bright green crystals
Dissolve 1 g K9Li[α2-P2W17O61] in 12 mL 0.285 M LiAc buffer (pH 4.75).
Add 0.115 mL 0.90 M ErCl3 solution (0.10 mmol) to the mixture.
Mix vigorously for 15 min.
Add 0.32 g KCl to form a precipitate.
Filter the precipitate; keep the filtrate.
Add the filtrate to LiAc/HAc buffer (pH 4.75).
Allow the solution to stand at 4 °C for 3 days to grow crystals.
At room temperature, dissolve 1 g of K9Li[α2-P2W17O61] in 12 mL of LiAc solution (0.285 M, pH 4.75)
Add 0.115 mL of 0.90 M LaCl3 (0.10 mmol) and mix vigorously for 15 min
Add 0.32 g KCl, then filter the precipitate
Add the filtrate to LiAc/HAc buffer (0.285 M, pH 4.75)
Keep at 4 °C for 3 days to obtain bright green crystals
Prepare a vigorously stirred solution of 0.5 mmol UCl4 in 50 mL 1 M HCl.
Add 4.88 g K9Li[α2-P2W17O61]·20H2O; colour changes from deep green to deep purple.
Stir the mixture for 5 min.
Filter to remove insoluble material.
Add 25 g solid KCl to the filtrate and allow it to dissolve completely.
Let the solution stand; a yellow powder precipitates. Filter to collect the first crop, then heat the mother liquor to 70–80 °C to obtain a second crop.

procedure_information.title: Isolation of K16[Eu(α2-P2W17O61)]·32H2O from mother liquor

procedure_steps.description: Remove solvent from the mother liquor under reduced pressure.
Allow the concentrate to crystallise; collect white crystalline product by filtration.

product_summary.name: K16[Th(α1-P2W17O61)2]·H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow crystals obtained after 1 week at 4°C

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.55 g Th(NO3)4·4H2O in 50 mL of 1 M LiAc/HAc buffer (pH 4.75) with vigorous stirring
Add 9.76 g K9Li[α2-P2W17O61]·20H2O until completely dissolved (pH 5.0)
Cool slowly to room temperature, then place in refrigerator at 4 °C for a week

name: Potassium acetate
KAc
reagents.comments: Adjust pH to 7.0 with acetic acid

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.8 g Yb(NO3)3 (0.005 mol) in 47.6 g K6[P2W18O62]·10H2O (0.1 mmol), then add to a heating solution
procedure_steps.comments: Exact process not fully clear from text

procedure_steps.description: Slowly add 40.0 g KAc into 50 mL water solution (pH ~7 adjusted with HAC), stir vigorously, filter to obtain filtrate
Place filtrate at 5°C for several hours to form colorless crystals
Dissolve 0.051 g Th(C2O4)2·6H2O and 1 g K10[α2-P2W17O61] in 25 mL water
Store solution in an open beaker in a refrigerator at 5°C for four days
Dissolve 0.068 g U(C2O4)2·6H2O and 1.42 g K10[α2-P2W17O61] in 25 mL water at 80°C with stirring
Store at room temperature. After five days, deep purple crystals obtained
Dissolve 0.02 g Np(C2O4)2·6H2O and 0.377 g K10[α2-P2W17O61] in 30 mL water at 80°C with stirring
Store at room temperature. After 14 days, orange crystals obtained

name: Plutonium(IV) oxalate hydrate
Pu(C2O4)2·6H2O
reagents.comments: Formed by precipitation with oxalic acid

procedure_steps.description: Obtain Pu(C2O4)2·6H2O by precipitating Pu4⁺ with oxalic acid and washing off excess
Mix 0.146 g K10[α2-P2W17O61] (0.032 mmol) with Pu(C2O4)2·6H2O (0.016 mmol) in 5 mL water, heat to 90-95°C with stirring
Store at room temperature. After five days, gray-rose crystals were obtained

product_summary.name: K14[(α2-P2W17TiO61)2(μ-O)]·17H2O
product_summary.notes: White crystals, soluble in water, CH3CN, DMSO; partial solubility data provided

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.625 g Ti(SO4)2·4H2O in 10 mL warm water, do not heat too long. Dropwise add to 40 mL water
procedure_steps.comments: Caution: solution may become cloudy if overheated

procedure_steps.description: Add 10 g K10[α2-P2W17O61]·23H2O at 60°C with stirring, forming a pale yellow solution
Cool to room temperature, add 20 g KCl, stir 30 min, filter the white precipitate
procedure_steps.comments: Wash with 20 mL ethanol & 20 mL diethyl ether

procedure_steps.description: Redissolve the powder in pH 1.0 HCl solution, heat to 90°C to obtain a yellow transparent solution
Store in refrigerator at 4°C overnight to obtain white crystals
procedure_steps.comments: Wash with 20 mL ethanol & 20 mL diethyl ether, vacuum dry

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.55 g Th(NO3)4·4H2O (0.1 mmol) in 15 mL LiAc/AcOH buffer (pH 5.9)
Add 8.2 g K10[α2-P2W17O61]·20H2O (2.0 mmol) in 50 mL hot buffer (pH 6.1), stir at 80°C for 5 min
Cool the solution to room temperature, then place in 4°C refrigerator. Crystalline product obtained
Dissolve 9.76 g Ki9Li(α1-P2W17O61)·20H2O in 50 mL of 1 M LiAc/AcOH buffer (pH 4.8) at <50°C
Slowly add 0.43 g Ce(NO3)3·6H2O dissolved in 10 mL buffer solution. Mixture turns yellow
Heat the mixture at 75°C for 5 minutes
Add 25 mL ethanol to the solution to obtain a deep yellow solution
procedure_steps.comments: Filter to yield a crystalline product

product_summary.name: (NH4)17[Ce(α2-P2W17O61)2]·H2O
product_summary.notes: Filtrate treated as above; final IR and 31P NMR data provided

Dissolve 100 g Na2MoO4·2H2O in 450 mL water.
Add 15 mL 85 % H3PO4 and 80 mL concentrated HCl to the solution.
Reflux the mixture for 8 h.
Cool the solution to room temperature; add 100 g NH4Cl to precipitate a white solid.
Filter and collect the precipitate.
Dissolve the precipitate in water; add concentrated HCl and acetic acid to form H6[P2Mo18O62].
After partial removal of acetic acid, add CeCl3 (1.5–2 equiv) to the solution.
While stirring, slowly add 50 % NaOAc solution until pH 4.0.
Allow the mixture to stand for 2 h.
Add 25 g KCl, cool in an ice bath for 20 min.
Filter to collect the precipitate.
Wash the solid three times with pH 3.7 H2SO4 solution.
Dry the product under vacuum.

Recrystallise from dilute H2SO4 (pH 3.7); collect crystals three times.
Dissolve 20 g H6[AsMo18O62]·28H2O in 20 mL water.
Add an equimolar amount of Ho(NO3)3·xH2O.
Adjust pH to ~3.7 with NaOAc solution while stirring.
Stir for 1.5 h.
Add 10 g NH4Cl or evaporate to near dryness.
Cool in an ice bath for 20 min.
Recrystallise from dilute H2SO4 (pH 3.7); collect crystals three times.
Dissolve 20 g H6[AsMo18O62]·28H2O in 20 mL water.
Add an equimolar amount of Y(NO3)3·xH2O.
Adjust pH to ~3.7 with NaOAc solution while stirring.
Stir for 1.5 h.
Add 10 g NH4Cl or evaporate to near dryness.
Cool in an ice bath for 20 min.
Recrystallise from dilute H2SO4 (pH 3.7); collect crystals three times.
Dissolve 1.0 g of K6[γ-SiW10O36] in 20 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 KCl solution
Add 0.078 g MnCl2·4H2O (0.40 mmol)
Add 0.1 mol·L^-1 HCl solution to adjust pH to 4.5
Heat the mixture at 50°C for 30 minutes with mixing
Refrigerate at 5°C and allow slow evaporation to form red crystals

product_summary.name: K10[Co(H2O)2(γ-SiW10O35)2]·8.25H2O
product_summary.notes: Deep-red crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.095 g CoCl2·6H2O and 1.0 g K8[γ-SiW10O36] in 20 mL of 1 M KCl solution.
Adjust the pH to 4.5 with 0.1 M HCl.
Heat the mixture to 50 °C and stir for 30 min.
Refrigerate at 5 °C and allow slow evaporation.
Continue slow evaporation until deep-red crystals form.

product_summary.name: K10[Ni(H2O)2(γ-SiW10O35)2]·13.25H2O
product_summary.notes: Purple crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.095 g NiCl2·6H2O and 1.0 g K8[γ-SiW10O36] in 20 mL of 1 M KCl solution.
Adjust the pH to 4.5 with 0.1 M HCl solution.
Heat the mixture to 50 °C while stirring for 30 min.
Refrigerate at 5 °C and allow slow evaporation.
Continue slow evaporation until purple crystals form.
Disperse 1.0 g PdSO4 (4.2 mmol) into 50 mL of 0.25 mol·L^-1 HAc/NaAc buffer (pH 4.9) at room temperature with rapid stirring
Add Na3[A-PW9O34] (2.8 mmol) in portions (e.g., 7 drops repeated 8 times), stir vigorously
After 0.5–1 min, add 20 g KCl to the brown solution (pH ~3)
Filter to obtain brown crystals, dry and grind
Resuspend the dried product into 50 mL water at 55°C, heat until solution turns red, filter again
Add 6 mol·L^-1 HCl to bring pH to 7, then slightly lower to 6.5
Cool to room temperature, filter, then wash with water–ethanol for 24–48 h
Dissolve 0.16 g ZrO(NO3)2·6H2O (0.47 mmol) in 15 mL water.
Add 0.25 g DMF (1.4 mmol).
Heat the mixture under reflux for 2 h.
Allow the solution to cool to room temperature.
Add 0.4 g (CH3)2NH2Cl (4.9 mmol) and stir vigorously.
Stir the solution for 5 min.
Heat the solution at 70 °C for 20 min.
Obtain yellow needle-like crystals by slow evaporation of the solvent.
Dissolve 1.50 g K12[H2P2W12O48]·24H2O (0.38 mmol) in 70 mL of pH 4 NaAc/HAc buffer, heat at 70–80°C
Add 0.62 g Cl2Sn{CH2CH2COOCH3}2 (2.0 mmol) and 0.13 g Na2WO4·2H2O (0.39 mmol), stir, cool to room temperature
Slowly evaporate over 2 days to form yellowish crystals
Dissolve 0.19 g Yb(NO3)3·5H2O (0.42 mmol) in 70 mL water, stir intensely
Add 2.0 g K6[As2W20O68(H2O)5] (0.38 mmol), heat at 60°C for 20 min
Cool down, add 10 g KCl, stir 15 min, filter white precipitate, dry
Dissolve 1.78 g H3[AsMo12O40]·30H2O (1 mmol) in 40 mL water
Add 8 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 MnSO4 solution, heat to 60°C in water bath
Use HCl and NaHCO3 solution to adjust pH to 4 after the solution becomes yellow
Cool to room temperature, add 4 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 (CH3)4NBr solution, stand 48 hours

characterization.comments: Similar to Mn compounds, from the text

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.78 g H3[AsMo12O40]·30H2O (1 mmol) in 40 mL water
Add 8 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 MnSO4 solution, heat to 60°C in water bath
Use HCl and NaHCO3 solution to adjust pH to 4 after solution becomes yellow
Cool to room temperature, add 4 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 (CH3)4NBr solution, stand for 48 hours

product_summary.name: (NH4)12[(UO2)2(H2O)2(TeW9O33)2]·25H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow-green precipitate formed, no exact yield reported

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1.13 g Na2[TeW9O33]·19.5H2O (0.40 mmol) in 100 mL water
Add 0.2 g UO2(NO3)2·6H2O (0.40 mmol) and 0.13 g Na2WO4·2H2O (0.40 mmol)
Under stirring, add 5.5 g urea (102.8 mmol), then heat under sunlight

product_summary.name: (NH4)12[(UO2)2(H2O)2(TeW9O33)2]·25H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow-green precipitate, total yield after workup

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 2.00 g Na2WO4·2H2O (0.66 mmol) in 80 mL water
Dissolve 0.107 g TeO2 (0.67 mmol) in 5 mL concentrated HCl, add dropwise into the boiling solution
Add 0.34 g UO2(NO3)2·6H2O (0.68 mmol) and 0.221 g Na2WO4·2H2O (0.67 mmol) to the acidic solution
Dissolve 0.20 g TiO(SO4) (~25 mmol) in 40 mL water
procedure_steps.comments: A small amount of precipitate forms upon next step

procedure_steps.description: Add 1.4 mL of 6 mol·L^-1 HCl solution until a small amount of precipitate forms
Add 5.00 g Na12[P2W15O56]·24H2O (1.13 mmol), cool to room temperature
Drop in 1.00 g NH4Cl solution over 10 min, filter
Dissolve 5 g Na2WO4·2H2O (15.2 mmol) and 0.24 g Na2HPO4 (1.7 mmol) in 100 mL water
Add 0.31 g Co(NO3)2·6H2O (0.1 mmol) to obtain pink solution
Adjust pH to 7.5 with 6 mol·L^-1 HCl, solution turns purple, heat to 90°C
Cool to room temperature, add 0.6 g KCl (8.0 mmol), then allow slow evaporation over days

product_summary.name: K8Na4[Na2Ni2(PW9O34)2]·30H2O
product_summary.notes: Needle-like crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 0.24 g Na2HPO4 in 100 mL water.
Introduce Ni(NO3)2·6H2O (0.1 mmol) to the solution.
Adjust the pH to 7.5 with 6 M HCl solution.
Heat the mixture to 90 °C.
Cool to room temperature (≈25 °C).
Add 0.6 g KCl and dissolve.
Allow slow evaporation at room temperature for several days to produce needle-like crystals.

product_summary.name: Na12[Na2Mn2(PW9O34)2]·36H2O
product_summary.notes: Needle-like crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 0.24 g Na2HPO4 in 100 mL water.
Introduce Mn(CH3COO)2·4H2O (0.1 mmol).
Adjust pH to 7.5 with 6 M HCl solution.
Heat to 90 °C.
Cool to room temperature.
Add 0.6 g KCl and dissolve.
Allow slow evaporation at room temperature for several days to yield needle-like crystals.

product_summary.name: K8Na2[Na2Zn2(PW9O34)2]·31H2O
product_summary.notes: Needle-like crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 5 g Na2WO4·2H2O and 0.24 g Na2HPO4 in 100 mL water.
Introduce Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (0.1 mmol).
Adjust pH to 7.5 with 6 M HCl solution.
Heat to 90 °C.
Cool to room temperature (≈25 °C).
Add 0.6 g KCl and dissolve.
Allow slow evaporation at room temperature for several days to obtain needle-like crystals.
Dissolve 1.3 g K8Na4[Na2Co2(PW9O34)2]·28H2O in a small volume of 1 M LiCl solution.
Allow the solution to evaporate slowly over several days to form purple crystals.
Dissolve 1.0 g K8Na4[Na2Ni2(PW9O34)2]·30H2O in a small amount of 1 mol·L^-1 LiCl solution
Slowly evaporate over a few days to obtain purple crystals
Dissolve 1.5 g K6Li6[Li2Mn2(PW9O34)2]·36H2O in a small amount of 1 mol·L^-1 LiCl solution
Slowly evaporate over a few days to obtain yellow crystals
Dissolve 0.8 g K6Na4[Na2Zn2(PW9O34)2]·31H2O in a small amount of 1 mol·L^-1 LiCl solution
Slowly evaporate the solution over a few days to obtain orange crystals
Dissolve 0.11 g Pd(CH3COO)2 (0.49 mmol) in 20 mL of 0.5 mol·L^-1 pH 4.8 HAc/NaAc buffer, stir rapidly
Add 1.0 g K10[A-α-SiW9O34]·24H2O (0.33 mmol), heat at 80°C, then cool
procedure_steps.comments: Filter the orange solution, resulting solution is red

procedure_steps.description: Add 1.5 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 CsCl solution to the filtered solution, slowly evaporate over 1 month

product_summary.name: Na11[Ni3Na(H2O)2(PW9O34)2]·14H2O
product_summary.notes: Yellow crystal. A green crystal byproduct is also formed

procedure_steps.description: Mix 0.31 g NiCl2·6H2O (1.30 mmol) with 1 mol·L^-1 NaCl solution, stir for 5 minutes
Slowly add 2.00 g Na9[A-PW9O34]·5H2O (0.79 mmol), heat in water bath at 60°C for 30 minutes
Store the green filtrate at 4°C for several months. Two crystal products form (green & yellow). The yellow product is target compound
Dissolve 0.68 g Co(NO3)2·6H2O in 500 mL 2 M NaCl solution and heat to 90 °C.
Quickly add 10 g Na12[α2-P2W15O56]·24H2O while stirring; keep at 90 °C for 20 min until dissolved.
Filter the hot solution to remove any insoluble matter.
Slowly evaporate the filtrate for 5–10 h; two Co-POM species form.
Let the separated solution stand 2–3 days to yield green crystals of Na17[(NaOH2)Co3(H2O)(P2W15O56)2].
Dissolve 2.84 g Na6[α-As2W18O67]·19.5H2O in 5 mL water
Add 0.255 g MnSO4·H2O dissolved in 5 mL water, stir at room temperature for 15 minutes
Add ascorbic acid, an immediate gel forms
Wash precipitate with ethanol and acetone
Dissolve 2.84 g Na6[α-As2W18O33]·19.5H2O in 5 mL water
Add 0.38 g VO2SO4·5H2O in 5 mL water, then use 1 mol·L^-1 Na2CO3 to keep pH ~8.0–8.5, heat at 50°C for 15 minutes
Cool to room temperature, add 0.780 g KCl, filter the yellow powder
procedure_steps.comments: Wash with 2 mol·L^-1 KCl, ethanol, acetone

procedure_steps.description: Recrystallize 300 mg in 5 mL H2O at 3°C for needle-like crystals

product_summary.name: Cs3KNa5[Cs2Na(H2O)10Pd2(SbW9O33)2]·16.5H2O
product_summary.notes: Slow evaporation yields 0.39 g of product

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.14 g Pd(CH3COO)2 (0.620 mmol) in 20 mL of 0.5 mol·L^-1 pH 4.8 HAc/NaAc buffer solution, stir rapidly
Add 0.50 g Na9[α-SbW9O33] (0.2 mmol), slowly heat to 80°C for 15 minutes, then cool and filter
Add 0.5 mL of 1 mol·L^-1 CsCl solution, slowly evaporate at room temperature
Dissolve 262 mg K6Ru2OCl10 (0.359 mmol) in 30 mL water
Add 1 g K8[γ-SiW10O36]·12H2O (0.336 mmol)
procedure_steps.comments: pH adjusted to 6, heated at 70 °C for 1 h

procedure_steps.description: Lower pH to 1.8, allow mixture to settle, then centrifuge
Add 4.4 g CsCl (26.1 mmol) to solution. After cooling, wash with cold water (2–3 mL) thrice
Dissolve 0.5 g CuBr2 (2.24 mmol) in 5 mL ethanol plus 20 mL water
After pH stabilized, add 2.0 g K8[γ-SiW10O36]·12H2O (0.67 mmol). Wait 20 minutes until pH is 4.2, filter and collect ~20 mL filtrate
Transfer filtrate to 50 mL beaker, add 0.225 g NaAc and 1.5 mL acetic acid, stir 2 h
Filter, then add 10 mL 2-propanol, stir 5 minutes
procedure_steps.comments: Place in black box to obtain pale blue needle crystals

product_summary.name: Cs6K2[(CeII(H2O)2)2MnII2(B-α-GeW9O34)2]·10H2O
product_summary.notes: Muddy-yellow crystals obtained after slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.28 g K12[Mn4(H2O)2(B-α-GeW9O34)2] in 20 mL water.
Add 1 mL 0.1 M Ce(NH4)2(NO3)6 (0.10 mmol) to obtain a yellow-green solution (pH 1.1).
Add 0.5 mL 1 M CsCl solution.
Allow the solution to evaporate slowly at room temperature to yield muddy-yellow cubic crystals.
Dissolve 0.076 g CuCl2·2H2O (0.44 mmol) and 0.056 g K10[A-α-SiW9O34] (0.16 mmol) in 20 mL 0.5 mol·L^-1 HAC/NaAc (pH 4.8)
After reaction completes, a green clear crystal forms upon workup
Dissolve 0.5 g K8[γ-SiW10O36] in 10 mL water; stir and filter.
Add 1 mL 1 M NiCl2 while stirring vigorously.
Add 3 g KCl.
Use 1 M Na2CO3 to adjust pH to ~6.2.
Maintain the solution at 80 °C, holding pH constant until reaction completion.
Filter at room temperature; let filtrate evaporate slowly.
Leave solution undisturbed several weeks to obtain pale-green crystals.
Dissolve 0.5 g K8[γ-SiW10O36] in 10 mL water; stir and filter.
Add 1 mL 1 M NiCl2 while stirring vigorously.
Add 3 g KCl.
Adjust pH to ~8.2 with 2 M Na2CO3.
Maintain solution at 95 °C, keeping pH constant, until the reaction is complete.
Filter at room temperature; allow the filtrate to evaporate slowly.
Wait several weeks for crystal growth.
Dissolve 3.80 g Cs5[SiNb3W9O40]·10H2O (1.02 mmol) in 160 mL of 2.0 mol·L^-1 HCl solution
Filter the hot solution, then allow slow evaporation at room temperature for 5 days
Dissolve 0.42 g Cs6H[A-α-Si(NbO2)3W9O37]·8H2O (0.12 mmol) in 10 mL of 0.5 mol·L^-1 HCl solution, filter to remove insoluble material
procedure_steps.comments: Yellow solution becomes colorless upon reflux

procedure_steps.description: Allow the colorless solution to evaporate slowly at room temperature for 3 days to form crystals
Dissolve 0.15 g of FeCl3·6H2O in 20 mL of 0.5 mol·L^-1 HAc/NaAc buffer (pH 4.8).
Add 0.52 g of K5Na2[A-α-GeW9O34]·25H2O and stir the mixture.
Heat the solution to 50 °C.
Filter the hot solution.
Cool the filtrate to room temperature.
Add 0.5 mL of 1.0 mol·L^-1 CsCl solution.
Leave the solution to evaporate slowly for one week, yielding red crystals.
Dissolve the precursor (n-BuNH3)12[{Eu(H2O)2(AsW9O33)2}]·8H2O (0.1 mmol) and 1.4 g Na9[AsW9O33]·19.5H2O in 40 mL water.
Add 0.23 g Cu(NO3)3·6H2O dissolved in 10 mL water.
Heat the mixture to 80 °C.
Add 0.55 g of n-BuNH3Cl and keep the solution at room temperature for a few days.
procedure_steps.comments: Colorless crystals form after a few days

product_summary.name: (n-BuNH3)12[CuCl6(AsW9O33)2]·6H2O
product_summary.notes: Orange crystals formed after long storage

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.6 g of the precursor and 1.0 g CuCl2 in 30 mL water.
Store the solution at room temperature for one month, leading to orange crystals.
Dissolve RbOH (0.0124 mol·L^-1) in 0.5 mL·L^-1 HCl solution under -0.53 V to form an intermediate product. Stop electrolysis when color reaches 6F·mol^-1.
Add a solution of 1 mol·L^-1 NaAc (1 mole fraction) and 0.2 mol·L^-1 ammonium acetate (0.4 mole fraction) to adjust pH to 4.0.
Slowly evaporate under vacuum to obtain deep red crystals. Filter and dry under vacuum.
Dissolve 0.968 g Na2MoO4·2H2O, 0.184 g V2O5, 0.275 g malonic acid, and 7.0 mL HCl in 12 mL water in a 23 mL flask.
Heat the mixture at 180 °C for 72 hours.
Cool to room temperature and let stand for 4–10 hours.
Filter to obtain a deep red solid.
Dissolve 50 g Na3[PW12O40] in 25 mL of 0.1 mol·L^-1 pH 4.5 HAc/NaAc buffer.
Prepare a solution of 1 mol·L^-1 VOSO4 (light green) and add 1 kg of KAc. Evaporate in an ice bath under vacuum.
Filter and redissolve the residue in boiling pH 4.5 HAC/NaAc buffer solution for recrystallization.
Dissolve K6[PV1W11O40] in 1 mol·L^-1 pH 2 sulfuric acid solution.
Subject the solution to constant current electrolysis at 0.4 V to obtain a purple solution.
Dissolve 4.00 g of (NH4)12[Mo36(NO)4O108(H2O)12]·33H2O and 82 g of (NH4)2SO4 · FeSO4 · 6H2O in 100 mL water under anhydrous nitrogen purge.
Add 4 mL of aqueous ammonia and 0.08 g N2H4 · H2O while stirring at 70 °C for 18 hours.
Filter the resulting mixture to obtain dark purple-black crystals. Wash with 125 mL ethanol and dry in a vacuum oven.
Heat and stir 12 g (NH4)6[Mo2O74]·4H2O in 82 g water under nitrogen (Method 1 initial step).
Add 0.16 g (NH4)2S2O8 to 12 mL of 50% acetic acid and 24 mL water. Allow the homogeneous solution to stand at room temperature for two months.
Add 10 mL of 0.014 mol·L^-1 (NH4)6[Mo7O24]·4H2O solution (pH 1.4) to 6.66 mL of 0.025 mol·L^-1 SnCl2 solution (pH 1.4). Adjust with hydrochloric acid as needed.
Let the homogeneous solution stand at room temperature for two months to form crystals.
Add 10 g (NH4)6[P2Mo18O62] and 25 g FeSO4 to 60 mL of 10% H2SO4 solution. Stir and mix.
Add 12 g NH4Cl to obtain a blue precipitate.
Filter, wash with 20% nitric acid, and obtain the product.

apparatus.notes: Separate anode and cathode compartments with salt bridge; Pt electrodes

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 1 g H4[SiMo12O40]·15H2O in 40 mL of 0.5 mol·L^-1 HCl/acetic acid solution.
Perform electrolysis with a platinum cathode and anode. Use a salt bridge to separate compartments, control the potential to the prototype state. Seal anode compartment under nitrogen and stir.
Obtain a red precipitate, filter, and dry to give the final solid product.

product_summary.name: [(C5MesRe)8(Mo(V)12O36)(Mo(VI)O4)]Cl2
product_summary.notes: Red-black intermediate, final product crystallized at 0 °C

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.083 g MoO3·2H2O and 0.1 g [(C5Me5Rh2)(OH)3]Cl in 2 mL water inside a sealed tube.
Heat at 190 °C for 2 days, then filter off any crystalline intermediate and evaporate to obtain a red-black precipitate.
Wash the red-black precipitate with acetone and ethanol, then dry to obtain a black powder.
Dissolve the dried black powder in 3 mL water, then add 15 mL ether. Cool to 0 °C for crystallization.

name: As2O3
reagents.comments: Exact amounts not clearly stated aside from ratio

procedure_steps.description: Mix As2O3, MoO3, NaCl, and other metals in a ratio of 5:10:10 (unclear total). Place in a 230 mL reaction tube.
procedure_steps.comments: Amounts in text are partially contradictory

procedure_steps.description: Heat the mixture at 150 °C for 50 hours, then cool to room temperature. Obtain a black solid after evaporation.
Dissolve the black solid in an appropriate solvent, let stand at room temperature for 2–7 days to form dark blue crystals.
Filter, wash the dark blue crystals with ammonia, and air dry.

product_summary.name: [C(NH2)3]5H[V(IV)2W4O19]·H2O
product_summary.notes: Black crystals after evaporation and filtration

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 16.5 g Na2WO4·2H2O (50 mmol), 40 mmol guanidine hydrochloride, 20 mmol N2H4SO4, and 10 mmol NaOH in 600 mL water in a Teflon bottle.
procedure_steps.comments: Stir and heat to boiling under reflux

procedure_steps.description: Under reflux, add dropwise 20 mmol VOSO4 and 40 mmol H2SO4 to form a transparent dark orange solution.
Continue refluxing, then cool. Reduce to dryness, filter to obtain black crystals. Dry in air 3–2 days (as reported).
Dissolve 0.29 g Mn(Ac)2·4H2O and 0.30 g benzoic acid in 15 mL triethylamine (2.40 mmol total) in a round bottom flask.
procedure_steps.comments: Reaction states 0.33 mL triethylamine added, but total was 2.40 mmol

procedure_steps.description: Heat the solution at 100 °C to dissolve, then cool slowly to obtain the compound.
Dissolve 0.24 g Mn(Ac)2·4H2O and 0.25 g benzoic acid in a 100 mL flask with 15 mL acetonitrile.
Add 0.21 g NaOMe (4.00 mmol), followed by 10 mL water. Stir at room temperature, then heat and evaporate slowly.
procedure_steps.comments: Yellow block crystals form upon slow evaporation

procedure_steps.description: Obtain yellow block crystals after slow evaporation. Yield = 0.10 g (35%).

product_summary.name: H6[Si2Mo(V)2Mo(V)16O40]·15H2O
product_summary.notes: Pale green crystals after one month

procedure_steps.description: Dissolve 0.76 g Zn(Ac)2·2H2O in 1.00 g 4-Cl-C6H4-SbO3H2. Add 15 mL ethanol and 0.96 mL triethylamine.
Place the reaction flask at 100 °C with slow heating and gradual cooling to room temperature. Let the mixture stand for one month to form pale green crystals.
Filter the pale green crystalline substance and dry. Yield is 0.55 g (38%).
Dissolve 3.0 g FeF3·3H2O in 90 mL methanol to obtain a yellow solution.
Add 3 mL pyridine to the solution; mild heating dissolves remaining solids.
Filter the solution to remove any undissolved material.
Reduce the filtrate volume to 60 mL under gentle heating.
Place the concentrated solution in a refrigerator for 24 h to grow crystals.
Filter off the yellow-green crystals, wash with ethanol, and dry.
